loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a 52 year old man who lives in Bekaa with his wife and their three children. Ali has owned a grocery store since 1999. He sells all types of canned food, beverages, candies, chips and more. Ali requested a loan from Al Majmoua in order to purchase stock. This is the first time that Ali has requested a loan. 

Ali is special in his work because he knows how to treat his clients. He is a welcoming person and he has a good reputation. His clients are his friends and neighbors. When he first started his business he didn’t have a lot of merchandise. Ali decided to run his business because he wanted to have  independent work. He, therefore, came up with the idea of opening his grocery store. In the future he plans to keep expanding his business by diversifying his merchandise.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise for his store.

loans.name: Anifat

texts.en:
Anifat makes lovely Nigerian and Western hairstyles for her customers. She also sells hair extensions, cosmetics and creams. She opens her salon daily from 8 a.m. to 7 p.m. She hopes to own a world-class salon in the future. She loves her business because she makes her customers look beautiful. 

She hopes for a loan of 50,000 Nigerian naira to purchase more extensions to sell. Anifat is 28 years old and married with two children. Her eldest child is 10 years old while the youngest is 7. Her children are doing well in school. Her husband is a mechanic and he also supports their home. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more hair extensions to sell

loans.name: C 2892 Tuzamurane Group

texts.en:
Clothilde is 32 years old. She is married with four children and she takes care of two dependents.

Clothilde is the president of a group called Tuzamurane. She and her team operate the business of sewing various styles of clothes. This is their third successful year in this business and the hours of their business are from 6 a.m. until late in the evening hours.

Clothilde and her team are requesting a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company for the purpose of purchasing more sewing machines plus some other clothing items. With these new purchased machines, she and her team will sew more attractive clothing styles for sale as well as additional sizes.

With this Kiva loan, Clothilde and her team hope to earn more profits in the process. This, in turn will allow each member of the team to take care of his or her family.

loans.use: To purchase more sewing machines and clothing items

loans.name: Mehdi

texts.en: Mehdi is a 45-year-old man who lives in the Bekaa with his wife and their four children. Mehdi has been working as a school bus driver since 1984. He requested a loan from Al Majmoua in order to do some maintenance work on his bus. This is the first time that Mehdi has requested a loan. He is special in his work because of his punctuality. His clients can be anyone from his region. He decided on doing his business because he wanted to have independent work and improve his income. In the future, he plans to improve by purchasing another school bus.

loans.use: To do some maintenance work on his bus.

loans.name: Khalil

texts.en:
Khalil is a 45-year-old man who lives in the Bekaa with his wife and their four children.

Khalil has been working as a builder for over two years now. He requested a loan from Al Majmoua in order to purchase tools for his work. This is the first time that Khalil has requested a loan.

Khalil is special in his work because he does it well. His clients are his friends and neighbors. When he first started his business, he didn’t face difficulties except making himself known to the public. He decided on doing his business because he wanted to have an independent work as well as having previous experience.

In the future, Khalil plans on expanding his business.

loans.use: To purchase tools for his work

loans.name: Rafaela

texts.es:
Rafaela M. O., tiene la edad de 57 años, está casada, y tiene 2 hijos que son mayor prioridad. Ellos tienen 17 y 20 años. El crédito lo quiere para la compra de ganado, la idea es comprar terneros  pequeños, engordarlos, y una vez que están grandes venderlos para obtener el mayor ingreso posible. No es la primera vez que realiza un crédito con FUDECOSUR y está muy contenta con las facilidades que se le han brindado siempre. Doña Rafaela tiene varios años de trabajar en la agricultura y también con el ganado. Ella espera en un futuro brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida y una mayor estabilidad económica, y de poder seguir creciendo como persona y como productora.

About FUDECOSUR:
The Foundation for the Development of Southern Communities is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing credit and capacitating programs to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Southern Costa Rica. You can obtain more information on FUDECOSUR from the website: FUDECOSUR.org
texts.en:
Rafaela M. O. is 57-years old, married, and has two children who are her prime concern. They are 17 and 20 years old. Rafaela wants a loan to buy livestock; her plan is to purchase young calves, fatten them up, and once they are big, sell them for as much money as possible. This isn’t the first time that she has had a loan through Kiva partner, FUDECOSUR. She is very happy with the credit terms that have always been available to her. Doña Rafaela has worked in agriculture for several years, always with livestock. She hopes to be able to provide a better standard of living for her family in the future, and to continue developing both as a person and as a provider. About FUDECOSUR: The Foundation for the Development of Southern Communities is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing credit and capacitating programs to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Southern Costa Rica. You can obtain more information on FUDECOSUR from the website: FUDECOSUR.org

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy calves to fatten up

loans.name: Ruben

texts.es:
El Sr. Ruben, vive en la localidad de El Torno, es soltero y estudia una carrera tecnica y en sus tiempos libres trabaja, su actividad principal es el servicio de transporte de personas con su vehiculo automotor, tiene muchas ganas de superación por lo que desde su corta edad trabaja para salir adelante y poder ayudar a sus padres que son de edad avanzada, el es el unico que se encarga de mantener el hogar, es responsable y trabajador, el destino del credito es para el mantenimiento de su vehiculo y comprar llantas. Uno de sus deseos es el de poder terminar su carrera y pronto formar una familia.

El Sr. Ruben esta agradecido con emprender y kiva por la confianza brindada en la otorgacion del credito.
texts.en:
Mr. Ruben lives in El Torno, he is single and is studying for his technical degree and in his free time he works transporting people in his automobile. He has a lot of aspirations to excel in life and even though he is young, he wants to succeed and be able to help his parents who are elderly; he is the only one in charge of supporting the home. He is responsible and hardworking; the loan will be used as maintenance for his vehicle and to buy tires. One of his wishes is to be able to finish his degree and soon have a family.

Mr. Ruben is very grateful to emprender (Kivas’s field partner) and Kiva for the trust given to him and for the loan granted.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Duque, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Maintenance of a vehicle.

loans.name: Yousef

texts.en:
Yousef is a 41-year-old man who lives in the Bekaa with his wife and their five children.

Yousef has been working as a car electrician since 1996. He is speciA. in his work because of his clean and clear work. He decided on doing his business because he wanted to have independent work and also thanks to his experience. However, when he first started his business he passed through some financiA. issues. His clients are his friends and neighbors.

Yousef requested a loan from A. Majmoua in order to purchase tools for his work. This is the first time that he has requested a loan. In the future, he plans to keep on improving his work.

loans.use: To purchase tools for his work

loans.name: Eliada

texts.en:
Eliada is 55 years old and is married with five children who are between 21 and 29 years old. She and her family live in Nyarugenge district, one of the districts of Kigali, the capital city of Rwanda.

Eliada has been in the business of selling a variety of goods including cosmetics products as well as soft drinks. Her shop is open from 6 a.m. until late in the evening hours.

Eliada is now requesting a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to expand the size of her shop through adding foodstuffs such as beans, rice, sugar, cooking oil, etc. In addition, she will increase the sales of drinks by purchasing more drinks, including beer.

With this additional business, Eliada will hopefully earn more profits, which in turn will allow her to reinvest in her business as well as take care of her family.

loans.use: To buy a variety of additional foodstuffs and drinks

loans.name: Maroun

texts.en:
Maroun is a 29-year-old man who lives in Bekaa. He has been working as a home and furniture painter for ten years. Maroun is known for his precise and clean work. His clients are his friends and neighbors. He decided on doing this business because he wanted to work independently. When he first started, he had difficulty networking and had some financial issues because he couldn’t afford to buy all the tools needed for his work. 

Maroun requested a loan from Al Majmoua in order to purchase some painting tools for his work. This is the first time that Maroun has requested a loan. In the future, he plans to keep on improving his work.

loans.use: To purchase painting tools for his work

loans.name: Katumba

texts.en:
Katumba is 40 years of age and married with five children between the ages of 3 and 18. All her children go to school. The family resides in and owns a two-roomed house, where she stays with seven  people. She takes care of additional family members. The family has access to electricity but no piped water at home. The family has three meals a day. Her greatest monthly expenses include utility bills, school fees for the children, medication and feeding the family. 

Katumba has a food stall in Kanyanya, where she sells cassava, sweet potatoes, banana clusters and fruits like oranges, mangoes and pineapples. She buys these foodstuffs from Kalerwe market, one of the busiest markets in Kampala city, and so she incurs transport costs. She receives an average of 30 customers a day. She has done this business for over 20 years. 

Her main challenges are defaulters, the rainy season (because she works from a muddy place), and the ever increasing prices of foodstuffs  She sells on a retail basis only. She has been with MCDT, a Kiva partner, for over five years and is servicing her 10th loan, working all this time with the same group mates. She wants to use this loan to buy more bunches of bananas and sacks of cassava, sweet potatoes and pineapples. She aspires to see her business grow bigger and to start selling wholesale only.
.

loans.use: To buy more bunches of bananas and sacks of sweet potataoes, cassava and pineapples

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is 52 years of age and married with six children between the ages of 10 and 28. Three of her children go to school. The family resides in and owns a two-roomed house, where she stays with eight people. She takes care of additional family members. The family has access to electricity but no piped water at home. The family has three meals a day. Her greatest monthly expenses include paying utility bills, school fees for the children, medication and feeding the family. 

Grace owns a stall in the Owino Market for selling bananas. Grace buys bananas from delivery vans, which get them from villages, and so she doesn’t  incur any transport costs. She receives an average of 40 customers a day. She has done this business for over 20 years.

Her main challenges are defaulters, the rainy season (because she works from a muddy place), and the ever increasing price of bananas. She sells on a retail basis only. She has been with MCDT, a Kiva partner, for over 10 years and is servicing her 26th loan, working all this time with the same group mates. 

She wants to use this loan to buy more bunches of bananas. She aspires to see her business grow bigger and to start going to farmers directly.
.

loans.use: To buy more bunches of bananas

loans.name: Tom

texts.en:
Tom C. is currently in the business of selling cooked food in the hotel and is requesting a loan to stock more foodstuffs to cook and sell.  Tom is 35 years old and a widow with two children who go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to educate her children.

 BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To stock more foodstuffs to be cooked and sell.

loans.name: Gloria Del Carmen

texts.es: Gloria del Carmen C. O. de 39 años de edad, reside en el departamento de Usulután. Vive en compañía de su hija de 15 años de edad, la cual se dedica a estudiar. Gloria posee una venta de cosméticos, ganchos para el cabello, peines, decorados para uñas, esmaltes y otros productos más. A pesar que todos sus clientes  son del sexo femenino, Gloria obtiene muy buenas ganancias, es por ello que ya cuenta con 20 años de tener este negocio, a través del cual ha podido brindarle todo lo necesario a su hija, como también solventar todos los gastos del hogar. Es por esta razón que ella desea poder aumentar su inventario sobre todo para este mes de febrero en el cual sus ventas aumentan  y posteriormente en el mes de abril, debido a las vacaciones de verano. Es por esto que Gloria solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda comprar mayor cantidad de cosméticos y de toda la variedad de productos que posee, de esta manera  aprovechará el hecho de poseer muchos clientes que desde hace muchos años compran sus productos y así mismo obtener clientela nueva.
texts.en:
39-year old Gloria del Carmen C. O. lives in the department of Usulután with her 15-year old daughter who is a student. Gloria owns a business selling cosmetics, hair and nail accessories, combs, nail polish etc. Although all her clients are women, Gloria makes a good living and has already had her business for twenty years. She is able to provide her daughter with all the basics and also pay for household expenses. Now she would like to expand her inventory, especially for the month of February when sales increase, and then later in the month of April, when the summer holidays begin. For this reason Gloria is asking for a loan to buy more cosmetics and the other items that she stocks. In this way she will continue to attract the many regular customers who have bought her products for many years, and she will also attract new customers.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy cosmetics and hair accessories

loans.name: Hammed

texts.en: Hammed is 40 years old and married with three children. His wife sells building materials to support the home. Hammed sells electrical materials to earn a living. He sells for long hours to enable him to meet the basic needs and necessities of his immediate family. He has a good relationship with LAPO. He hopes for a loan of NGN 80,000 to purchase more electrical materials to sell. He says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more electrical materials to sell

loans.name: Edwin

texts.en:
Edwin is a 28-year-old farmer in western Kenya, near the town of Kitale. He has been running a mixed farm for the past six years. He is married with one child who is not yet of age to attend school. His primary income comes from the sale of milk and maize, but he also produces tomatoes and other vegetables with the assistance of one employee. At this time, Edwin says that climate issues such as a recent drought have been challenging to his business, along with other occasional problems of disease among livestock and difficulty marketing products.

Edwin successfully completed a recent loan with Juhudi Kilimo and he has now requested this loan for Kes. 30,000 to increase his stock of poultry and to build a new poultry house. He is confident that this project will generate steady income for himself and his family and he is looking to continually expand his operations in the coming years.

In the future, Edwin would like to become a large-scale supplier in his area. He also talked of a desire to attend training seminars in order to improve his poultry and dairy farming practices, if there is an opportunity to do so.

loans.use: To increase his stock of poultry

loans.name: Yorleny

texts.es:
Yorleny S. R., tiene la edad de 34 años, está casada, y tiene 3 hijos que son su mayor prioridad. Ellos tienen 11, 12 y 8 años. El crédito lo quiere para la compra de algunos terneros y su alimentación. Desea darle el adecuado mantenimiento al ganado para obtener el mayor ingreso posible cuando se vendan. También desea aumentar el número de animales y poder mantenerlos en mejores condiciones, cuenta con un área idónea para el mantenimiento y cría del ganado. Es la primera vez que realiza un crédito con FUDECOSUR y está muy contenta con las facilidades que se le brindaron. Doña Yorleny tiene varios años dedicada al ganado. Ella espera en un futuro brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida y una mayor estabilidad económica, y de poder seguir creciendo como persona y como productora.

About FUDECOSUR:
The Foundation for the Development of Southern Communities is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing credit and capacitating programs to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Southern Costa Rica. You can obtain more information on FUDECOSUR from the website: FUDECOSUR.org
texts.en:
Yorleny S. R. is 34 and married. She has three children, and they are her greatest priority. They are 11, 12, and 8 years old. The loan that she wants is to buy some calves and to buy their food. She wants to give the livestock adequate maintenance in order to get the greatest earnings possible when she sells them. She also wants to increase the number of animals she has and be able to keep them in better conditions. She has a suitable area for the care and maintenance of the livestock. This is her first loan with FUDECOSUR. She is very happy with the ease of payments that they provide. Yorleny has several years of experience with livestock. In the future she hopes to give her family a better quality of life and greater economic stability. She also hopes to keep growing as a person and as a producer. About FUDECOSUR: The Foundation for the Development of Southern Communities is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing credit and capacitating programs to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Southern Costa Rica. You can obtain more information on FUDECOSUR from the website: FUDECOSUR.org

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy livestock

loans.name: Ana Julia

texts.es: Ana Julia O. de 48 años de edad, reside en la Ciudad de Soyapango, ubicada en el departamento de San Salvador. Vive junto a sus cuatro hijos de los cuales el mayor se dedica a trabajar para ayudarle a su madre con los gastos del hogar, los tres menores estudian y por las tardes le ayudan a Ana con los quehaceres de la casa. Ana posee una tienda en la cual comercializa productos de primera necesidad, negocio a través del cual ha logrado salir adelante junto a sus cuatro hijos. Es por esta razón que Ana solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda surtir su negocio, ya que a pesar de que cuenta con varios años de poseerlo no ha logrado surtirlo con todo lo necesario para atender todos los pedidos de sus clientes, lo cual la deja en desventaja a comparación de su competencia. Para Ana el mejorar su negocio es vital, debido a que es por medio de este como ella logra obtener el dinero necesario para sostén de su familia, la cual depende por completo de ella y de las pocas ganancias que con mucho esfuerzo aporta su hijo mayor.
texts.en:
Ana Julia O. is 48 years old and lives in the city of Soyapango, in the area of San Salvador. She lives with her four children, the oldest of whom works to help his mother with the expenses of the home. The younger three children study and, in the afternoon, help Ana with the housework. Ana has a store selling basic products, and this business has allowed her to get ahead, along with her four children. Ana is asking for a loan to be able to stock her store. Despite having run the store for many years, she still has not stocked it with everything her customers request, which causes her business to suffer when compared to the competition. It is very important to Ana to improve her business, as this is her means of obtaining the money to support her family. They are entirely dependent upon her and upon the small amount that her oldest son contributes by working very hard.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Meinecke, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose C. sells fruit and vegetables in the market and is requesting a loan to stock bags of beans and rice to sell. Rose is 30 years, married with a husband who is a teacher and two school-age children. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a wholesale shop.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: stock bags of beans and rice to sell

loans.name: Thierry

texts.fr: H. Thierry est né le 19 juillet 1974 à Allada, dans le département de l’Atlantique. Marié à Prudencia, une revendeuse, Thierry est père de trois enfants.  Thierry a un autre enfant à sa charge.  Seulement certains enfants sont scolarisés.  La famille vit ensemble au quartier Gbégamey à Allada depuis quatre ans.  Le couple assure ensemble les charges de la famille.  Thierry a fréquenté l’école jusqu’au cours secondaire.  Pour subvenir  à ses besoins, Thierry mène comme activité la vente des tissus et des pantalons.  C’est au marché de Allada que Thierry s’approvisionne.  Thierry a déjà obtenu un crédit à ALIDé, crédit qu’il a bien remboursé.  Thierry sollicite un autre crédit auprès de ALIDé pour renforcer ses activités et mieux satisfaire ses clients.
texts.en:
Thierry H. was born on 19th July 1974 in Allada in the "département" (administrative division) of Atlantique. Married to Prudencia, a retailer, Thierry has three children. He also has another child in his care. Not all the children attend school. The family has lived together in the Gbégamey district of Allada for the past four years. The couple cover the household expenses between them. Thierry attended school up until secondary school level. In order to provide for his needs, he has a business selling fabric and trousers. He gets his supplies at the market in Allada. Thierry has already had a loan from ALIDé which he repaid without incident. He is applying for another loan from ALIDé in order to strengthen his business and better satisfy customer demand.

Translated from French by Alison Le Bras, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of fabric and trousers

loans.name: José María

texts.es: José María H. M. de 53 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa, la cual se dedica a los quehaceres del hogar,  viven en San Francisco Goteras, ubicado en el departamento de Usulután. Desde hace 25 años atrás, que José se dedica a la compra y venta de ganado, negocio el cual fue heredado por parte de su padre, y en el cual  posee mucha experiencia. De lunes a viernes José se encarga de vender el ganando y los sábados y domingos, compra el ganado necesario, para luego criarlos y venderlo. El solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda comprar ganado, y comida de la mejor calidad para los animales, esto le permitirá aumentar el precio del ganado y la calidad de productos que comercializa, de modo que pueda aumentar sus ventas. José es un hombre muy trabajador el cual depende por completo de este negocio, es por ello que es de mucha importancia el poder mantenerlo a flote, ya que es la única fuente de ingresos que posee. Él desea aprovechar no solo la experiencia con la que cuenta sino también el terreno que tiene el cual es apto para la crianza del ganado.
texts.en:
Jose Maria Hernandez Martinez is 53 years old. He lives with his wife, who is a housewife. They live in San Francisco Goteras. located in the department of Usulután. For 25 years years, Jose has been buying and selling cattle. He inherited this business from his father, and he has a lot of experience in it. From Monday through Friday, Jose sells the cattle. On Saturdays and Sundays, he buys the necessary cattle to then raise them and sell them. He is asking for a loan with which he can buy cattle, and a better quality of feed for the animals. This will allow him to increase the price of the cattle and the quality of the product that he sells, and thus increase his sales. Jose is a very hardworking man who depends completely on this business. This is why it is very important for him to keep it afloat, since this is the only source of income that he has. He wants to take advantage not only of the experience that he has, but the land that he has which is suited for raising cattle.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase feed and cattle.

location.town: San Francisco Gotera, departamento de Morazán

loans.name: Irma Elena

texts.es: Irma Elena tiene 74 años y su familia la conforman sus 7 hijos, que trabajan de manera independiente. Ella tiene una panadería que la estableció en su humilde vivienda, a pesar de la edad que tiene es una persona muy activa ella tiene mucha competencia, pero esto no la desanima ya que esto es lo que más le gusta hacer y la mayoría de sus clientes disfrutan de la calidad de sus productos. Por lo que le genero la experiencia necesaria para generar los ingresos necesarios y mantener a sus 7 hijos y proporcionarles estudios. Ella solicita un financiamiento para la compra de materia prima como mantequilla, queso, harina, huevos y azúcar. Por lo que sueña con mejorar las condiciones de su negocio para ofrecer un mejor servicio.
texts.en:
Irma Elena, 74, has 7 children, who all work independently. She has a bakery that she set up in her humble abode. Despite her age, she is a very active person and she has a lot of competition. However, this doesn't discourage her because she loves what she does and most of her customers enjoy the quality of her products. Her work produced experience and generated enough income to support her seven children and provide them with schooling. She needs financing to buy raw materials like: butter, cheese, flour, eggs and sugar. She dreams with improving her business' conditions so that she can offer better service.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy raw materials and supplies.

loans.name: Micaela

texts.es:
La Sra. Micaela vive en la localidad de Puerto Rico, municipio de El torno, es casada y tiene 1 hijo que se encuentra en edad escolar, su actividad es el transporte de personas, ya que conjuntamente con su esposo tienen un vehiculo, con el cual realizan su labor cotidiana, el cual es su única fuente de ingreso, para sostener a su familia, la Sra. Micaela es una persona joven responsable y trabajadora, uno de sus deseos es el de comprarse su casa propia ya que por el momento vive en alquiler. El destino del credito es para el arreglo y mantenimiento de su movilidad  

La Sra. Micaela esta muy agradecida con Emprender y Kiva por la confianza brindada en la otorgacion del credito
texts.en:
Mrs. Micaela lives in Puerto Rico, in the municipality of El Torno. She is married and has 1 son that is of school age. She works in the transportation sector, with her husband, they have a vehicle and they work daily, and it is their only source of income to support the family. Mrs. Micaela is a young responsible and hardworking person, one of her wishes is to buy her own home since for now she rents. The loan will be used to repair and to maintain the vehicle.

Mrs. Micaela is very grateful to Emprender (Kiva’s field partner) and Kiva for the trust given to her by providing her the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Duque, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Maintenance of a vehicle.

loans.name: Rachelle

texts.fr: B. Rachelle est née vers 1973 à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin, mais vit depuis 6 ans au quartier Dodji Dangban à Allada, ville dans le département de l’Atlantique.  Mariée à SONON Antoine, un maçon, Rachelle est mère de cinq enfants, tous scolarisés.  Rachelle vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants.  Le couple assure ensemble les charges de la famille.  Rachelle n’a jamais fréquenté l’école.  Pour faire face à ses besoins, Rachelle vend des plastiques au marché de Sèkou.  Rachelle exerce cette activité depuis 6 ans et s’approvisionne à Cotonou.  Rachelle a déjà obtenu un crédit à ALIDé, crédit qu’elle a bien remboursé.  Rachelle désire élever le niveau de son activité afin de mieux satisfaire ses clients, mais elle manque suffisamment de moyens financiers pour y arriver.  C’est la raison pour laquelle Rachelle sollicite un deuxième crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
B. Rachelle was born around 1973 in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin, but has been living for six years in the Dodji Dangban district in Allada, a city in Atlantique County. Married to SONON Antoine, a mason, she is the mother of five children who are all in school. She lives together with her husband and children. The couple jointly ensure that family expenses are covered. Rachelle never attended school. To meet her needs, she sells plastic ware at the Sèkou market. She has been in this business for six years and gets her supplies in Cotonou. She has already had an ALIDé loan, which she has repaid. She would like to raise her level of business in order to satisfy her customers more, but she lacks sufficient funds to do so. This is why Rachelle is requesting a second loan from ALIDé.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying 24 dozen pieces of plastic ware

loans.name: Francisco Antonio

texts.es: Francisco Antonio V.
texts.en: Francisco Antonio V.

loans.use: To buy paint and tools for car repairs

location.town: Santa Rosa de Lima, departamento de La Unión

loans.name: Waheed

texts.en:
Waheed sells motor spare parts. With this business, he hopes to meet the basic needs of his family. He is happy with his business because he is the only man in this business in his community. He hopes for a loan of 60,000 nairas to purchase more motor spare parts to sell. He is itching for progress in his business. 

Waheed is 47 years old and married with four children. His wife is a hairdresser and she also supports their family. He says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more motor spare parts to sell

loans.name: Sebastian Castillo

texts.es: Sebastian castillo D. 61 de edad, reside en Lourdes Colón, ubicado en el departamento de La Libertad. El señor Sebastian vive solo en casa propia, lugar en el cual se encuentra su negocio, el cual es una tienda en la que comercializa productos de primera necesidad como: pan, jugos, leche, huevos y otros más. Desde hace tres años que Sebastián posee este tipo de negocio el cual nació por la necesidad de poder contar con una fuente de ingresos fijos, la cual le permitiera contar con todo lo necesario para vivir de una manera aceptable. Sebastián solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda contar con el dinero necesario para invertir en su negocio, comprando productos como: embutidos, sodas, medicinas y otros productos más los cuales son de mucha  necesidad y que hasta ahora no poseía, razón por la cual perdía algunas ventas. Para él es de mucha importancia poder mejorar su negocio, ya que de esta manera podrá tener una vida mejor.
texts.en:
Sebastian Castillo D. is 61 years old. He lives in Lourdes Colon, located in the department of La Libertad. Sebastian lives alone in his own home, where is business is located. This is a store that sells primary products such as: bread, juice, milk, eggs and others. For three years, Sebastian has had this business which started out of the need to be able to have a steady source of income. This allows him to have everything necessary to live an acceptable life. Sebastian is asking for a loan with which he will have enough money to invest in his business, buying products such as: sausages, sodas, medicine and other products that are really needed and that he doesn't have yet. This has caused him to lose sales. For him it is very important to improve his business, since this way he can have a better life.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of perishable products.

location.town: Lourdes Colón, departamento de La Libertad

loans.name: Séraphine

texts.fr: H. Séraphine est née vers 1979.  Il y a 10 ans que Séraphine vit au quartier Dodji Dangban à Allada, ville dans le département de l’Atlantique.  Mariée à TOKPO Lucien, un extracteur de vin de palme, Séraphine est mère de quatre enfants.  Séraphine a trois autres enfants à sa charge.  Tous les enfants sont scolarisés.  Séraphine vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants.  Le couple assure ensemble les charges de la famille. Séraphine a fréquenté l’école jusqu’au cours secondaire.  Pour faire face à ses besoins, Séraphine vend des tissus au marché de Sèkou.  Parallèlement à cette activité, Séraphine vend du maïs.   Séraphine exerce cette activité depuis 10 ans et s’approvisionne à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin.  Séraphine a déjà obtenu un crédit à ALIDé, crédit qu’elle a bien remboursé.  Séraphine sollicite un autre crédit auprès de ALIDé pour renforcer ses activités et mieux satisfaire ses clients.
texts.en:
H. Séraphine was born around 1979. For ten years, she has been living in the Dodji Dangban district in Allada, a city in Atlantique County. Married to TOKPO Lucien, a palm wine distiller, she is the mother of four chidren and has three other children to support. All of the children are in school. She lives together with her husband and children. The couple jointly ensure that family expenses are covered. Séraphine has attended secondary school. To meet her needs, she sells cloth at the Sèkou market. Along with this business, she sells corn. She has been in operation for ten years and gets her supplies in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. She has already had an ALIDé loan, which she repaid. She's requesting another loan from ALIDé for bolstering her business and satisfying her customers further.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying cloth

loans.name: Moses

texts.en:
Moses is 40 years old and he is still single. He lives in Nyarugenge district, one of the districts of Kigali, the capital city of Rwanda.

Moses has been in the business of selling a variety of beers for about ten years and the hours of his business are from 10 a.m. until late in the evening hours.

Moses needs to request a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company for the purpose of expanding his business through adding a large quantity of beers so that he can satisfy the demand of his customers.

Moses also plans to start roasting meat, bananas and Irish potatoes in his bar so that his customers can get something to eat while they are drinking. Through the use of this loan, Moses has a hope for a better future.

loans.use: To buy a large quantity of additional beers

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy additional foodstuffs and cosmetics products

loans.name: Sylverien

texts.en:
Sylverien is 50 years old and is married with three children aged between 7 and 21. He also takes care of two dependent relatives aged 16 and 18. He and his family live in Nyarugenge district of Kigali, the capital of Rwanda, in the village called Kimisagara where his business is located.

Sylverien owns a small pub which sells different kinds of beers and soft drinks. His business is well-known in his village. His wife sells foodstuffs in the market of Kimisagara and they both work hard for their family.

Sylverien’s business is very organized and he is able to employ eight people as helpers. The hours of his pub are from 8 a.m. to 10 p.m. every day, even during the weekend. In fact on Saturdays and Sundays he receives more customers. Shortly, he will have had fourteen years of experience in his business.

The reason Sylverien is now requesting a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company is in order to expand his business which will help him to earn more profits. With this loan he needs to buy a new fridge which will allow him to cool his beers and soft drinks.

With the additional profits Sylverien expects to earn, he will be reinvesting in his business.

loans.use: To buy more drinks plus a new refrigerator to cool his drinks

loans.name: Claudia Liseth

texts.es: Claudia Liseth R. D. M. D. 34 años D. edad, resiD. en Lourdes Colón, ubicado en el departamento D. La Libertad. Vive junto a sus cuatro hijos D. 12, 10, 8 y 5 años D. edad. Claudia posee una venta D. productos D. belleza tales como perfumes, cremas para el cuerpo, ropa y otros más. Mucho D. estos productos se comercializan por catalogo, D. los cuales se venden a crédito, esta es una estrategia que Claudia utiliza para poder asegurar sus ventas aunque en muchas ocasiones es bastante riesgosa. Es por esta razón que solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda comprar mayor cantidad D. cosméticos, ropa y perfumes, la cual debe pagar al contado para obtenerla, es por ello que es D. mucha importancia obtener el préstamo dado por Integral, para que este le permita aumentar el inventario D. su negocio y poder mejorar las condiciones D. vida D. su familia. Claudia es una mujer muy trabajadora, la cual siempre se ha esforzado al máximo por brindarles Todo lo mejor a sus cuatro hijos, los cuales dependen por completo D. ella, ya que no recibe ayuda D. nadie para el sostén D. ellos.
texts.en:
Claudia Liseth R. D. M. is 34 years old. She lives in LourD. Colón, which is in the La Libertad department. She lives with her four children; ages 12, 10, 8, and 5. Claudia sells beauty products like perfume, body cream, clothes, and other things. She sells many of these products by catalog, and she sells on credit. This is a strategy that Claudia uses to be able to assure her sales even though, on many occasions, it is pretty risky. That is the reason that she is requesting a loan to be able to buy a greater quantity of cosmetics, clothes, and perfume. She needs to pay cash to get these items. That is why it is very important to get the loan given by Integral. This will allow her to increase the inventory in her business and be able to improve her family’s living conditions. Claudia is a very hard-working woman who has always put forth maximum effort to give her four children all the best. They completely depend upon her because she does not receive help in supporting them from anyone.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy hair creams, perfume, and clothes

location.town: Lourdes Colón, departamento de La Libertad

loans.name: Suma Chuyma Group

texts.es:
La señorita Julia A. M. conoce a Pro Mujer desde hace tiempo, sin embargo, en la asociación comunal Suma Chuyma del Centro Focal de Los Andes, este es su segundo ciclo de crédito.
La asociación comunal Suma Chuyma está compuesta por 8 socias entusiastas y trabajadoras.  Los negocios que desarrollan son:  producción de muebles, venta de ropa, juguetes, mantas, tejido en lana, confección de cortinas, venta de muebles y venta de lácteos.(leche, yogourt)

Julia A. es soltera y gracias a su padre, desde hace 5 años trabaja en la producción de muebles de dormitorio:  catres, peinadores, mesas de noche y cómodas.  Comenzó con la elaboración de una par de muebles, ahora logra terminar juegos de dormitorios completos, que lleva a vender en la feria 16 de Julio los dìas jueves y domingo.

Para este trabajo algunas veces le ayudan los hermanos.
Cuando se le preguntó qué le gustaba de Pro Mujer, ella respondió EL AHORRO, por que no se siente como un esfuerzo extra, pues el mismo es parte de la cuota.
texts.en:
Julia A. M. has been aware of Pro Mujer for some time. However, in the Suma Chuyma communal bank of the Los Andes Focal Center, this is her second loan cycle. The Suma Chuyma communal bank is make up of 8 enthusiastic, hard-working members. The businesses they are involved in are: furniture making, clothing sales, toy and blanket sales; wool weaving, drape making, furniture sales, and sales of dairy products (milk, yoghurt). Julia Apeza is single and, thanks to her father, she has worked as a bedroom furniture maker for the last 5 years. She makes cots, dressing tables, end tables and chests of drawers. She started out making a couple of items, now she finishes complete bedroom sets that she takes to the 16 de Julio market to sell on Thursdays and Sundays. Her brothers sometimes help her out with this task. When she was asked what she liked about Pro Mujer, she answered: THE SAVINGS because it doesn't seem like an extra effort since they are included in the payments.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy pressed wood and plywood.

loans.name: Olufunke

texts.en: The plank business is very lucrative in Nigeria. Olufunke is very happy in this plank business because of the one-on-one interaction that she has with her customers. She hopes to expand the business. She has a good relationship with LAPO. LAPO (Lift Above Poverty Organization) is committed to improving lives in Nigeria and elsewhere in Africa. She hopes for a loan of NGN 60,000 to purchase more planks to sell. She is 60 years old and she is a widow with four children. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more planks to sell

loans.name: Rwambona 4 Group

texts.en:
Odette is 50 years old and she is married with eight children. She and her family live in Gicumbi, a region of Byumba situated in the Northern Province of Rwanda.

Here, Odette is the president of the group called Rwambona 4. This group operates the business of selling milk and this is their third successful year in this business, which they operate from 8 a.m. until late in the evening hours.

Odette and her team need to request a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company for the purpose of increasing the sales of their milk as well as satisfying the need of their customers. In addition, with this loan which they are requesting, they plan also to purchase a machine which will help them to process their milk so that they can free it of microbes.

Through the use of this loan, Odette and her team hope to increase the financial situation of their business and they plan to start saving for further reinvestment in the business.

loans.use: To buy a machine for boiling milk

loans.name: Austine

texts.en: Austine is 42 years old and married with six children. His wife sells groceries and drinks. He is from Delta State but lives in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria. Austine sells plywood and planks. He purchases the planks from timber dealers in bulk and sells in smaller quantities. He has been in this line of business for over two years now and he hopes to become a timber dealer and a major distributor in the future. He loves his business because of the one-on-one interaction he is able to have with his customers. He is requesting a loan of NGN 50,000 to boost his plywood business and purchase more planks to sell.

loans.use: To purchase more planks to sell

loans.name: Julienne

texts.fr: A. Julienne est née le 1 janvier 1968 à Allada, ville dans le département de l’Atlantique.  Julienne est veuve et est mère de deux enfants.  Elle a deux autres enfants à sa charge.  Julienne n’a jamais fréquenté l’école, mais tous ses enfants sont scolarisés.   Julienne vit seule avec ses enfants.  Pour subvenir à ses besoins, Julienne vend du côme (aliment préparé à base de maïs) et des tissus. Julienne exerce cette activité depuis 5 ans.  Julienne s’approvisionne  au marché de Allada et à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin, à Cotonou.  Julienne a déjà obtenu un crédit à ALIDé, crédit qu’elle a bien remboursé.  Julienne sollicite un autre crédit auprès de ALIDé pour renforcer ses activités et mieux satisfaire ses clients.  Julienne ambitionne plus tard construire sur sa parcelle et appuyer l’étude de ses enfants.
texts.en:
A. Julienne was born on January 1, 1968 in Allada, a city in Atlantique County. She is a widow and the mother of two children. She has two other children to support. Julienne never attended school, but her children have all had schooling. She lives alone with her children. To provide for herself, she sells côme (a food made with corn) and fabrics. She has been operating this business for five years. She gets her supplies at the Allada market and from Dantokpa, the international market of Benin, in Cotonou. Julienne has already had an ALIDé loan, which she repaid. She's requesting another loan from ALIDé for bolstering her business and satisfying her customers further. Her ambition for the future is to build on her plot of land and to support her children's education.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying fabrics

loans.name: Maritza Janeth

texts.es: Maritza Janeth C. G. de 35 años de edad, reside en el departamento de San Salvador, capital del país. Vive junto a su esposo el cual trabaja como comerciante, y a sus dos hijos de 16 y 8 años de edad, los cuales se dedican a estudiar. Maritza se dedica a la venta de cosméticos, los cuales son mostrados por catalogo, así mismo vende ropa para hombres, mujeres y niños, ella vende su producto de manera ambulante ofreciéndolo de casa en casa, y entre sus vecinos. Ella es una mujer muy trabajadora y responsable, la cual al ver la necesidad de su hogar, decidió iniciar su propio negocio con el fin de ayudarle a su esposo con todos los gastos del hogar. Maritza solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda comprar mayor cantidad de cosméticos, cremas para el cabello y el cuerpo y mayor variedad de ropa en diferentes tallas, estilos y colores, de manera que abarque la mayor cantidad de gustos de personas, las cuales compren su productos, esto le permitirá aumentar sus ventas y mejorar la estabilidad económica de su hogar.
texts.en:
Maritza Janeth C. G. is 35 years old. She lives in the department of San Salvador, the country's capital. She lives with her husband, a merchant, and her two children who are 16 and 8 years old. They are in school. Maritza sells cosmetics which are shown through a catalog. She also sells men's, women's and children's clothes as a street vendor, going from house to house and among her neighbors. She is a very hardworking and responsible woman who when she saw the need in her home, decided to start her own business to help her husband with the household expenses. Maritza is asking for a loan with which she can buy a larger quantity of cosmetics, hair and body creams and a wider variety of clothes in different sizes, styles and colors. In this way she will satisfy a greater variety of tastes of the people who buy her products. This will allow her to increase her sales and improve the economic stability of her home.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of clothes and cosmetics.

loans.name: Darling Celeste

texts.es:
La señora Darling Celeste S. G., es madre de dos niños, uno en edad escolar, tiene un tramo de venta de carne de cerdo, pepena, frito y morongas, desde hace 14 años, ubicado en el sector de cerdo.
Comenzó su negocio con un capital de C$ 3,000.00 ahorrados, siempre ha vendido en el mercado pero antes solo le ayudaba a vender a su mamá, lleva cinco años de trabajar con nosotros en el cual ella nos ha manifestado que ha través de los financiamientos a  podido  mejorar su condición de vida, ya que compra mercaderia para el negocio y de esto ella le hace mejora.
Con esfuerzo de ella y el de su esposo  ambos luchan por salir adelante con sus hijos.
texts.en:
Mrs. Darling Celeste S. G. is a mother of 2 children, one is of school age. For over 14 years she has had a stall where she sells pork, bacon, fried pork, and blood sausage, located in the pig sector.

Mrs. S. began her business with a capital of C$ 3,000.00 in savings, she has always sold her products in the market but before she only helped her mother. She has 5 years working with us where she has told us that through the loans, she has been able to improve her quality of life since she buys merchandize for her business and she uses it to her advantage.

With the efforts of herself and that of her husband, both work hard to get ahead with their children.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Duque, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy more pigs to cook.

loans.name: Gilberto De Jesús

texts.es: Gilberto de Jesús F. de 47 años de edad, reside en Ciudad Arce, ubicado en el departamento de La Libertad. Vive únicamente en compañía de su esposa, la cual se dedica a los quehaceres del hogar. Gilberto posee un taller de reparación de bicicletas, así mismo vende repuestos y accesorios para estas. Él cuenta con la enorme ventaja de que su negocio esta ubicado sobre la carretera principal que conduce al municipio de Zapotitan, una calle muy transcurrida incluso por bicicletistas, los cuales disfrutan salir en grupo de amigos por las carreteras del país. Esto le trae muchas ventajas a Gilberto ya que se encuentra al paso de las personas, así mismo en su lugar de habitación posee muy buenas referencias por parte de las personas, debido a que cuenta con más de 12 años de dedicarse a este oficio lo cual lo ha hecho muy conocido por las personas, como alguien con mucha experiencia en su trabajo. Gilberto solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda poseer el dinero necesario para invertir en su negocio, comprando más repuestos para bicicletas, así mismo herramientas para la reparación de estas. El taller de reparación es un negocio el cual le ha permitido a Gilberto seguir adelante ya que le suple todas las necesidades, es por ello desea hacerlo crecer de manera que pueda mejorar sus ganancias.
texts.en:
Gilberto de Jesús F., 47, lives in Ciudad Arce, La Libertad department. He lives just with his wife, who is a housewife. Gilberto has a bicycle repair shop and he also sells bicycle replacement parts and accessories. He has a huge advantage because his business is located along the main highway that leads to the city of Zapotitan, a very busy street even by cyclists, who enjoy going out along the country's roads in groups. This brings many advantages to Gilberto because he is located on their way and his neighbors recommend him because he has over 12 years experience in this type of work so he is very well-known as someone who is highly skilled. Gilberto is asking for funding so that he can have money to invest in his business; he wants to buy bicycle replacement parts and tools needed to repair bicycles. His repair shop has made it possible for Gilberto to move further in life because it has provided for his basic necessities. This is why he wants to help it grow so that he can improve his profits.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy bicycle replacement parts and tools.

location.town: Ciudad Arce en el departamento de La Libertad

loans.name: P. Marie Raphaelle

texts.fr: D. P. Marie Raphaelle est née le 12 septembre 1957 à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin.  Il y a 15 ans que Marie Raphaelle habite au quartier Gbégamey à Allada, ville dans le département de l’Atlantique.  Marie Raphaelle est mariée à ADIGBENONGLOZOUN Patrice, qui travaille à la Direction Générale TUNDE Transport.  Le couple a cinq enfants, tous scolarisés, dont deux sont encore à sa charge.  Marie Raphaelle vit seule avec les enfants, mais le couple assure ensemble les charges de la famille. Marie Raphaelle a fréquenté l’école jusqu’au cours secondaire.  Pour subvenir à ses besoins, Marie Raphaelle vend de la nourriture et des sacs de riz à son domicile.   Marie Raphaelle exerce cette activité depuis 15 ans et s’approvisionne à Cotonou. Marie Raphaelle est une nouvelle bénéficiaire de ALIDé. Très sollicitée par ses clients, Marie Raphaelle ambitionne renforcer son activité et agrandir son étalage afin de faire face à la demande sans cesse croissante. C’est la raison pour laquelle Marie Raphaelle sollicite son premier crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
P. Marie Raphaelle D'ALMEIDA was born on 12th September 1957 in Cotonou, the economic capital of Bénin. For the past 15 years she has lived in the Gbégamey area of Allada, a town in the "département" (administrative division) of Atlantique. Marie Raphaelle is married to Patrice ADIGBENONGLOZOUN, who works in the general management department of TUNDE Transport. The couple have five children who have all attended school; two of them are still supported by the couple. Marie-Raphaelle lives alone with her children, but the couple cover the household expenses between them. Marie-Raphaelle went to school up until secondary school level. In order to provide for her needs, she sells food and bags of rice from home. She has been carrying out this activity for 15 years and gets her supplies in Cotonou. Marie-Raphaelle is a new borrower for ALIDé. In view of the strong demand from her customers, her ambition is to strengthen her business and expand her display of goods in order to be able to meet this ever increasing demand. This is why Marie Raphaelle is applying for her first loan from ALIDé.

Translated from French by Alison Le Bras, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of rice and oil

loans.name: Rosa Arabel

texts.es: Rosa Arabel R. S. de 45 años de edad, reside en el Municipio de Lourdes Colón, ubicado en el departamento de La Libertad. Vive junto a su esposo, el cual se dedica a trabajar como mecánico automotriz, y junto a sus 4 hijos de 16, 13, 11 y 8 años de edad, los cuales se dedican a estudiar en la escuela del lugar. Rosa posee una venta de huevos, fruta pelada y cortada en trocitos, y algunas golosinas, su negocio esta ubicado en una de las calles principales del lugar la cual se encuentra enfrente de su casa. Debido a la dura situación a la cual se enfrentaba su familia, ya que el sueldo de su esposo no daba abasto con todos los gastos familiares, Rosa decidió aprovechar la excelente ubicación de su hogar, y emprender un nuevo negocio, en el cual en la actualidad, posee muchos clientes a pesar de que su venta es poca. Es por esta razón que ella solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda comprar huevos, dulces, más fruta, bolsas plásticas para colocar la fruta y otros productos más los cuales aún no posee, esto lo hace con el fin de poder aumentar sus ventas y brindarle una mejor ayuda a su esposo.
texts.en:
45-year old Rosa Arabel R. S. lives in the municipality of Lourdes Colón in the department of La Libertad with her husband who is a motor mechanic and their four children aged 16, 13, 11, and 8. They are all students in local schools. Rosa runs a stall selling eggs, ready-to-eat fruit (peeled and sliced), and candy. The business is located on one of the main streets of the town, right in front of her house. Because of the financial difficulties that the family were facing--her husband’s income didn’t cover the family’s expenses--Rosa decided to take advantage of the excellent location of the house and start a new business. Now she has many customers although sales are low. For this reason she would like a loan to buy eggs, candy, more fruit, plastic bags in which to put the fruit, and other items that she does not sell at the moment. Her goal is to increase her sales and provide greater assistance to her husband.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy eggs, candy, and fruit

location.town: Lourdes Colón, departamento de La Libertad

loans.name: Françoise

texts.fr: D. Françoise est née le 18 mars 1983 en Côte d’Ivoire.  Il y a quatre ans que Françoise s’est installée au quartier Dogoudo à Allada, ville dans le département de l’Atlantique au Bénin.  Françoise est mariée à NONVIGNON Aubin, un instituteur.  Françoise a sept enfants à sa charge, tous scolarisés, dont deux sont ses propres enfants.  Françoise vit ensemble avec son mari et les enfants.  Le couple assure ensemble les charges de la famille.  Françoise n’a jamais fréquenté l’école.  Pour subvenir à ses besoins, Françoise vend de vivres au marché de Allada. Françoise a sept ans d’expérience dans ce domaine et s’approvisionne à Ouéssé.  Françoise a déjà obtenu un crédit à ALIDé, crédit qu’elle a bien remboursé.  Françoise désire élever le niveau de son activité afin de mieux satisfaire ses clients, mais elle manque suffisamment de moyens financiers pour y arriver.  C’est la raison pour laquelle Françoise sollicite un deuxième crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
Françoise D. was born on March 1983 in Côte d'Ivoire. Four years ago she settled in the Dogoudo neighborhood in Allada, a town in the Atlantic province of Benin. Françoise is married to Aubin Nonvignon, a schoolteacher. Françoise has seven children in her care, two of whom are her own, and all of whom go to school. Françoise lives together with her husband and children. The couple takes care of the household expenses together. Francoise never attended school. In order to support herself, she sells foodstuffs in the Allada market. She has seven years of experience in this business and buys her stock in Ouéssé. In the past, Françoise already had obtained a loan from ALIDé and duly reimbursed it. She wishes to expand her business in order to better meet customer demand, but lacks the financial means necessary. This is why Françoise is seeking a second loan from ALIDé.

Translated from French by Ekaterina Sukhanova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing a stock of peanuts and corn

loans.name: Martha Eugenia

texts.es: La señora Martha Eugenia M. S. tiene una pulpería en la cual ella vende de todo un poco, ubicada en el barrio Santa Ana contiguo al puente Walter penki, La señora M. nesecitaba el financiamiento para comprar mercaderia para su pulpería ya que casi no tenia surtido, su negocio lo abre desde las seis de la mañana hasta las 9 de la noche diario, ella es madre soltera no tiene carga pero es una señora que le gusta luchar y no depender de nadie ella tiene un trabajo fijo que es barrer las calles en horas de la madrugada de parte de la alcaldía luego de llegar a su casa abre su pulpería, su negocio empezo desde hace 12 años cuando comenzó vendiendo frutas en la puerta de su casa  para sacar adelante a sus hijos, luego ella surtió su venta hasta la fecha que es  una pulpería, tiene de trabajar con nosotros alrededor de 5 años con 28 créditos en los cuales a ella le han beneficiado bastante por que a podido remodelar su hogar.
texts.en:
Señora Martha Eugenia M. S. has a general store in which she sells a little bit of everything, located in the Santa Ana neighborhood, next to the Walter Penki bridge. Señora M. needs financing to buy merchandise for her store, since she has almost no stock. She opens her business from 6 in the morning until 9 at night every day. She is a single mother. She has no dependents now. But she is a woman who likes to work hard and not depend on anyone. She has a regular job, which is to sweep the streets in part of the town in the early morning hours. Then, on arriving at her house, she opens her store. Her business began 12 years ago when she began selling fruit at the door of her house in order to advance her children. Then she increased her stock for sale up to the point that it became a store. She has worked with us for about 5 years, with 28 loans, which have benefited her enough that she has been able to remodel her house.

Translated from Spanish by Pam McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy products for my store such as staple foods, snacks, soft drinks, everyday necessities, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy stock items for her store.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: Purchase of cereals and equipment to transform fruit and vegetables

loans.name: Corina Guadalupe

texts.es: Corina Guadalupe M. D. D. D. 44 años D. edad, Municipio D. Zacatecoluca, ubicado en el departamento D. La Paz. Vive junto a su esposo quien se dedica a trabajar como albañil, y junto a cinco hijos, tres D. los mayores ya finalizaron sus estudios D. bachillerato, y los dos últimos estudian educación básica. Corina posee un negocio, en el cual comercializa jugos, sodas, fruta, pupusas, golosinas y otros productos alimenticios más. Su negocio esta ubicado en las instalaciones del Colegio Salomón siempre en el mismo municipio en el que vive ella. Dentro del colegio posee competencia, por lo que Corina se esfuerza a diario por innovar en sus productos D. manera que pueda llamar la atención D. los alumnos del colegio en lo más posible. Ella solicita un préstamo por medio del cual desea poder aumentar su inventario, comprando muchos más productos alimenticios, así mismo contar con materia prima para la elaboración D. desayunos y almuerzos. Para Corina el mejoramiento D. su negocio es D. mucha importancia, debido a que el sueldo que su esposo obtiene es bastante bajo para solventar los gastos del hogar y las necesidades D. cinco hijos, es por ello que Corina desea crecer en su negocio y poder aumentar sus ventas las cuales serán D. mucho beneficio para su familia.
texts.en:
Corina Guadalupe M. D. D., 44, lives in Zacatecoluca, La Paz department with her husband, who is a bricklayer, and their five children. The oldest three have finished high school and the two youngest are still in elementary school. Corina has a store where she sells fruit juices, sodas, pupusas (Salvadorean filled corn cakes), sweets and other food items. Her store is located near the Colegio Salomón in her same residence town. She has some competition insiD. the school so Corina must make an effort daily to diversify her stock in order to catch the eye of the school's students as much as possible. She is asking for funding in order to increase her stock inventory buying many more food items; in addition, she wants to have available ingredients to prepare breakfasts and lunches. For Corina, improving her business is very important because her husband's salary is quite low and inadequate to meet household expenses and the needs of their five children. For this reason, Corina wants her business to grow so that sales will increase. This will be of great benefit for her family.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy food items.

loans.name: Blanca Mercedes

texts.es:
La señora Blanca Mercedes L. G., tiene una pulpería desde hace 15 años ubicada a dos cuadra del mercado central frente al centro de salud es su casa de habitación, su negocio lo empezo con un capital de C$30,000.00 aporte de su esposo con poco inventario y poco mobiliario para mi venta.
Anteriormente ella estudiaba y luego decidio poner una venta con ayuda de su esposo  tienen una niña de cinco años de edad, su negocio lo abre desde las 7 de la mañana hasta las 9 de la noche ella trabaja fuertemente para sacar el sustento diario para su hija.
Ella es primera vez que saca financiamientos con nosotros pero espera que no sea el único ya que ella lo solicito para surtir su negocio y no seguir agarrando productos al crédito ya que al contado ella hasta logra descuentos y promociones.
texts.en:
Blanca Mercedes L. G. has had a grocery store for 15 years located in her home, which is located two blocks from the central market across the street from the health center. She began her business with a 30,000 colon capital investment that her husband put up; she had little inventory and display capabilities. Befor this, she was a student. Later on, she decided to start a sales business with help from her husband. They have a 5-year-old daughter. The store operates from 7am until 9pm. She works hard to earn sustenance for her daughter. This is the first time that she has sought financing from us but hopes it won't be the only time. She requested funds to stock her store so that she doesn't have to continue to buy items on credit because by paying cash she can get better discounts and promotional terms.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy stock inventory items.

loans.name: D. Brigitte

texts.fr: W. D. Brigitte est née le 10 octobre 1970 à Ouidah, ville reconnu pour le vodou.  Brigitte s’est installée au quartier Dodomey à Allada, ville dans le département de l’Atlantique, il y a 20 ans.  Mariée à GBEDOLO Luc, un chauffeur, Brigitte est mère de trois enfants, tous scolarisés.  Brigitte vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants.  Le couple assure ensemble les charges de la famille.  Brigitte n’a jamais fréquenté l’école.  Pour subvenir à ses besoins, Brigitte vend de nourriture et de beignets à son domicile.  Brigitte a 20 ans d’expérience dans ce domaine et s’approvisionne à Houégbo.  Brigitte a déjà obtenu un crédit à ALIDé, crédit qu’elle a bien remboursé.  Brigitte sollicite un autre crédit auprès de ALIDé pour renforcer ses activités et mieux satisfaire ses clients.
texts.en:
D. Brigitte W. was born on 10th October 1970 in Ouidah, a town which is renowned for voodooism. Brigitte settled in the Dodomey district of Allada, a town in the "département" (administrative division) of Atlantique, 20 years ago. Married to Luc GBEDOLO, a driver, Brigitte has three children, all of whom are at school. She lives with her husband and children. The couple cover the household expenses between them. Brigitte has never been to school. In order to provide for her needs, she sells food and fritters from her home. Brigitte has 20 years of experience in this domain and gets her supplies in Houégbo. She has already had a loan from ALIDé which she repaid without incident. She is applying for another loan from ALIDé in order to strengthen her business and better satisfy customer demand.

Translated from French by Alison Le Bras, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of rice and condiments

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: The plank business is very lucrative in Nigeria. Esther is very happy in this plank business because of the one-on-one interaction that she has with her customers. Her greatest challenge in her business is funds and she hopes to overcome this challenge. She hopes to expand her business. She has a good relationship with LAPO (Lift Above Poverty Organization), which is committed to improving lives in Nigeria and elsewhere in Africa. She hopes for a loan of NGN 150,000 to purchase more planks to sell. She is 52 years old and married with four children. Her husband also sells planks to support their home. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more planks to sell

loans.name: Lidia Del Carmen

texts.es: Lidia del Carmen M. D. R. D. 33 años D. edad, resiD. en La Herradura, ubicado en el departamento D. La Paz. Vive junto a su esposo el cual posee un trabajo como albañil, y vive junto a sus dos hijos D. 12 y 7 años D. edad, los cuales se dedican a estudiar. Lidia posee una tienda D. productos perecederos y D. primera necesidad para el hogar. DesD. hace dos años atrás que inicio su negocio con la esperanza D. poder forjarse un mejor futuro y D. esta manera tener una mejor calidad D. vida tanto para ella, su esposo pero sobre todo para sus hijos. El negocio esta ubicado en su casa D. habitación, en donD. sus hijos le ayudan por la tarD. a atender el negocio. Lidia solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda obtener el dinero necesario para surtir su negocio, con productos como embutidos, pan, detergente, medicinas y otros más. Así mismo Lidia posee un listado D. los productos que sus clientes piden y que ella aún no posee, esto le facilitara el poder comprar productos los cuales son muy necesarios para que su negocio crezca y pueda obtener mayores ganancias.
texts.en:
Lidia del Carmen M. D. R., 33, lives in La Herradura, La Paz department with her husband, who is a bricklayer, and their two children, who are 12- and 7-year-old students. Lidia has a grocery store. She started her business two years ago hoping to forge a better future and have a better quality of life for herself and her husband but, most of all, for her children. The store is in her home and her children help her out in the afternoons. Lidia is asking for funding to buy stock items that her customers require and that she does not currently stock. This will make it easier for her to get these products which are very necessary so that her business can grow and she can earn higher profits.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy perishables.

location.town: La Herradura,  departamento de La Paz

loans.name: Christine

texts.fr: S. Christine est née le 5 mars 1962 à Zè. Mariée à DAGNIHOUN Parfait, un enseignant, elle habite au quartier Gbégamey à Allada, dans le département de l’Atlantique. Christine est mère d’un enfant et a deux autres enfants à sa charge. Tous les enfants sont scolarisés. Christine vit ensemble avec son mari et les enfants. Le couple assure ensemble les charges de la famille. Christine a fréquenté l’école jusqu’au cours primaire. Il y a dix ans, Christine s’est mise dans la vente de mèches, produits de beauté, et de fagots de bois au marché de Allada. Christine est une ancienne cliente de ALIDé, ayant déjà bénéficié de trois crédits auprès de l’institution. Christine a bien remboursé les trois crédits qu’elle a obtenus de ALIDé. Christine sollicite un quatrième crédit auprès de ALIDé, afin d’accroître son activité et de mieux satisfaire la demande des clients.
texts.en:
Christine S. was born on 5th March 1962 in Zé. Married to Parfait DAGMIHOUN, a teacher, she lives in the Gbégamey district of Allada, a town in the "département" (administrative division) of Atlantique. Christine has one child of her own and two others in her care. All the children are at school. Christine lives with her husband and children. The couple cover the household expenses between them. Christine went to school up until primary level. Ten years ago she started selling hairpieces, beauty products and bundles of firewood at the market in Allada. Christine is an old client of ALIDé, having already benefited from three loans from the company. She has repaid all three loans without incident. She is applying for a fourth loan from ALIDé in order to expand her business and to satisfy better customer demand.

Translated from French by Alison Le Bras, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of hairpieces and beauty products

loans.name: Edison

texts.en:
Edison was born in 1987 and is single. He resides in the Gasabo district of Kigali, the capital of Rwanda, in the village called Nyarutarama where his business is located.

Edison owns a small shop which is located in the residential region where they need to buy products from the shop. He sells clothes for men. His business is very organized and he employs one person as a helper so that his business runs smoothly. This is his third year of successful operation in business. The hours of his shop are from eight in the morning to eight in the evening, every day except Sunday.

Edison is now requesting a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company in order to expand his business. He plans to purchase various style of clothes for men and women which will help him to obtain more profits. With these profits he will try to save money for the future which will help him to get married.

loans.use: To buy additional clothes to sell

loans.name: Bose

texts.en:
Bose is 45 years old and married with two children. She sells planks and her husband also works to support their home. Plank business is very lucrative in Nigeria and Bose is very happy in this plank business because of the one-on-one interaction that she has with her customers. Her greatest challenge in her business is a lack of funds and she hopes to overcome this challenge and grow her business.

She has a good relationship with Lift Above Poverty Organization and LAPO is committed to improving lives in Nigeria and elsewhere in Africa. She hopes for a loan amount of NGN 150,000 to purchase more planks to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more planks to sell.

loans.name: Ana De Jesús

texts.es: Ana de Jesús A. de 50 años de edad, reside en el departamento de La Paz. Vive junto a su madre de 80 años de edad, la cual se encarga de realizar todos los quehaceres del hogar, mientras que Ana sale cada día a ganarse el sustento diario. Ana posee una venta de agua de cocos, los cuales ella misma pela para que sus clientes puedan disfrutar de esta refrescante agua. Su lugar de ubicación es muy clave, ya que se encuentra sobre la autopista que conduce hacia el Aeropuerto Nacional de El Salvador, lugar en el cual cuenta con mucha competencia, lo cual no desanima a Ana, en esta carretera muchas personas se detienen con sus automóviles a comprar cocos, esto se da sobretodo con las personas que van fuera del país o regresan del extranjero. Es por esta razón que solicita un préstamo para poder comprar cocos por mayor, de manera que pueda obtenerlos a menor precio y de esta manera percibir mayores ganancias lo cual beneficie a su familia. Ana es una mujer muy humilde y trabajadora, la cual posee muy buenas referencias por parte de sus Vecinas.
texts.en:
Ana de Jesús A., 50, lives in La Paz department with her 80-year-old mother, who does all the household chores while Ana goes out daily to try to earn their living. Ana sells coconuts which she, herself, dehusks so that her customers can enjoy the refreshing coconut milk. Her location is key: she is located along the freeway that leads to the El Salvador National Airport. She has a lot of competition but Ana is not discouraged by this. Many people stop along this freeway to buy coconuts, especially those leaving the country or returning from abroad. For this reason, Ana is asking for funding to buy coconuts at wholesale so that she can get them at a better price and produce higher profits that will benefit her family. Ana is a very humble, hard-working woman, who is highly recommended by her neighbors.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy coconuts at wholesale

loans.name: Zainab

texts.en: Zainab learned her hairdressing and beauty salon skills in a beauty academy. Upon graduation, she opened a small beauty salon to begin her new career and to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She started with a small business operation, concerned that she was new in the market. Today, Zainab is asking to borrow $1,000 to modify and enlarge her shop to receive more clients because she's planning to have a bigger and improved salon and to be known in this field in order to earn more income.

loans.use: To modify and enlarge her shop

loans.name: Bukola

texts.en:
Bukola is 33 years old and married with two children. She sells planks at retail prices to her customers and her husband also sells planks to support their home. Plank sales are very lucrative in Nigeria and Bukola is very happy in this business because of the one-on-one interaction that she has with her customers. Her greatest challenge in her business is a lack of funds and she hopes to overcome this challenge and expand the business.

She has a good relationship with Lift Above Poverty Organization and LAPO is committed to improving lives in Nigeria and elsewhere in Africa. She hopes for a loan in the amount of NGN 150,000 to purchase more planks to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more planks to sell.

loans.name: Rosa Maria

texts.es:
La Señora Rosa Maria A. N., tiene una fritanga en su casa de habitación en el barrio Roberto González, y a la vez la señora A. hace enchiladas (enfrijoladas) que las elabora y las entrega a las escuelas el crédito la señora lo utilizo para comprar una mesa en donde pueda colocar las enchiladas fritas esto con el fin que su trabajo se le haga más fácil y mas cómodo para ella.
Ella antes trabajaba como domestica en una casa y luego ella decidio tener su propio negocio sacando a vender enchiladitas en su casa con C$ 200.00 que fueron ahorro.
Su negocio empieza a la 5 de la tarde hasta las 10 y media de la noche, compra por las mañanas y frie a partir de las 12 del día tiene 3 hijos viven con ella pero ninguno a su cargo pero si le ayuda en lo que puede a dos nietesitos, tiene 4 años y medio de trabajar con ceprodel, financiamientos que le han ayudado a acondicionar su fritanga y su casa.
texts.en:
Señora Rosa Maria A. N. has a fritanga (a stand that sells fried food) in her home in the Roberto González neighborhood, and at the same time, Señora A. makes enchiladas (with beans), which she prepares and delivers to schools. She will use the loan to buy a table where she can place the fried enchiladas, with the goal that her work will be easier and more comfortable for her. She used to work as a domestic worker in a house, and then she decided to have her own business, selling enchiladas in her house with C$200.00 (Nicaraguan cordobas) which she had saved. Her business begins at 5 in the afternoon and goes until 10:30 at night. She shops in the mornings and fries after 12 noon. She has 3 children. They live with her, but she does not support them. But she helps her two grandchildren with what she can. She has worked for four and a half years with CEPRODEL, obtaining loans that have helped her arrange her fritanga and her house.

Translated from Spanish by Pam McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy oil, bananas, yucca, and a table

loans.name: Victoire

texts.fr: S. Victoire est née le 1 janvier 1970 à So-Ava mais habite maintenant au quartier Dogoudo à Allada, ville dans le département de l’Atlantique du Bénin.  Mariée à GANDJI Nestor, un instituteur, Victoire est mère de quatre enfants, tous scolarisés et tous à sa charge.  Victoire vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants et le couple assure ensemble les charges de la famille.
