Il y a huit ans Victoire s’est mise dans la vente d’oignons, d’épices, et de maïs aux marchés de Allada, de Sékou, et de Avakpa.  C’est à Glazoué et à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin à Cotonou, que Victoire s’approvisionne.  Victoire a déjà bénéficié d’un crédit auprès de ALIDé.  Victoire sollicite un deuxième crédit pour renforcer son activité et pour augmenter son profit.
texts.en:
Victoire S. was born on 1st January 1970 in So-Ava, but now lives in the Dogoudo district of Allada, a town in the "département" (administrative division) of Atlantique in Bénin. Married to Nestor GANDJI, a primary school teacher, Victoire has four children, all of whom are at school and in her care. She lives with her husband and children, and the couple cover the household expenses between them. Eight years ago Victoire started selling onions, spices and corn on the markets in Allada, Sékou and Avakpa. She gets her supplies in Glazoué and in Dantokpa, Bénin's international market in Cotonou. Victoire has already had one loan from ALIDé. She is applying for a second loan to strengthen her business and increase her profits.

Translated from French by Alison Le Bras, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of corn and onions

loans.name: Cesar Apolonio

texts.es: Cesar tiene 37 años de edad, casado, cuenta con dos hijos  un barón y una mujer, se dedica a prestar servicio de lavado de autos y parqueo, su esposa se dedica a cuidar la casa y los hijos, solicita un crédito a ASDIR para comprar una aspiradora que le servirá para mejorar el servicio. Anteriormente ha trabajado créditos y las ha pagado bien, es una persona que tiene muchos deseas de superar.
texts.en:
Cesar, 37, is married and has two children: one boy and one girl. He provides parking and auto-washing services; his wife takes care of the home and the children. He is asking ASDIR for funds to buy a vacuum cleaner that will make it possible for him to improve his service. He has managed loans previously and he has repaid on time; he is a person who wants to succeed.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a vacuum cleaner.

loans.name: Florence

texts.fr: N. Florence est née vers 1978. Il y a 6 ans que Florence s’est installée au quartier Dodji Dangban à Allada, ville dans le département de l’Atlantique. Mariée à CODJIA Ulrich, un brodeur, Florence est mère de cinq enfants, tous à sa charge. Florence n’a jamais fréquenté l’école, mais tous ses enfants sont scolarisés. Florence vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Le couple assure ensemble les charges de la famille. Florence est une couturière. Florence vend également dans son atelier de couture, des articles de mercerie (fils à coudre, des fermetures, des boutons, etc.). Florence a trois ans d’expérience dans ce domaine et s’approvisionne à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Florence est à son deuxième crédit à ALIDé. Elle a bien remboursé le premier crédit et sollicite un autre crédit pour renforcer son activité et pour augmenter son profit.
texts.en:
Florence N. was born around 1978. Six years ago she settled down in the Dodji Dangban district of Allada, a town in the "département" (administrative division) of Atlantique. Married to Ulrich CODJA, an embroiderer, Florence has five children, all of whom are in her care. Florence has never been to school but all her children attend school. She lives with her husband and children. The couple cover the household expenses between them. In order to provide for her needs, Florence sells haberdashery supplies at the market in Sékou. At the same time she is also a seamstress. Florence has three years of experience in this domain and gets her supplies in Cotonou, the economic capital of Bénin. She is on her second loan from ALIDé. She repaid the first loan without incident and is applying for another loan to strengthen her business and increase her profits.

Translated from French by Alison Le Bras, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase sewing supplies, zippers, button, etc.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is 54 years old and married with eight children. Three of her children go to school. The family resides in and owns a four-room house where she stays with five people and Jane takes care of additional family members. The family has no access to electricity or piped water at home but they do have three meals a day. Her greatest monthly expenses include paying utility bills, school fees for the children, medication, and feeding the family.

Jane has a stall selling second-hand shoes in Kasubi market on a retail basis. She buys the shoes from Owino market in Kampala city and so she incurs little transport costs to and from shopping. She has an average of ten customers a day and has been in this business for over seven years. Besides the shoe business, she also sells grounded groundnuts in the same market. Her main challenges are defaulters, the rainy season (because she works from a muddy place), and ever-increasing prices of second-hand shoes.

She has been with MCDT for over six years and is servicing her twelfth loan. She's worked all this time with the same groupmates. She wants to use this loan to buy more bales of second-hand shoes and a sock of groundnuts. She is aspiring to see her business grow bigger and start selling by wholesale only.

loans.use: To buy more bales of second-hand shoes and a sock of groundnuts.

loans.name: Mayra Del Socorro

texts.es: La señora Mayra es maestra de educación primaria es muy trabajadora, ya que después de dar clases haces trabajos labores en casa, ella está solicitando el crédito ya que su mama está muy grave y va ser operada y por lo que le conviene ese dinero.
texts.en:
Mrs. Mayra is a primary school teacher and is very hardworking - after she has given her classes she does chores at home. She is asking for this loan as her mother is very ill - the money is to pay for her operation.

Translated from Spanish by Lara Francis, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: The loan is to pay for her mother's operation

loans.name: Mohamad

texts.en: Mohamad is a 19-year-old single man. He stopped his education when he was too young and started working as a furniture painter in 2005. He chose to leave his education and go to work to help his father in the household and to raise his four unemployed brothers. He paints all kinds of furniture and he has a good number of clients. Mohamad is asking to borrow $1,200 to buy additional paint, supplies and tools to satisfy the heavy demand of the market and make more profit.

loans.use: To buy additional paints, supplies and tools

loans.name: Nelly

texts.en:
Nelly was born in 1969 and is married with four children aged between 2 and 15. She and her husband reside in the Gasabo district of Kigali, the capital of Rwanda, in a village called Gatsata.

Nelly owns a small shop in the market called Nyabugogo which sells various styles of clothes. She has an experience of sixteen years in this field. The hours of her business are normally from 8 a.m. to 5 p.m. every day except Sunday.

Nelly’s business is not well-known simply because she sells in the market where the customers do not care about someone who sells but only what she sells -  is it good quality or not.

This is the reason why Nelly is now requesting a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company in order to expand her business through purchasing more bales of clothes for men and women. 

With this loan Nelly expects to obtain more profits which will allow her to purchase more bales of clothes. With the profits Nelly will be able to save money for the future of her children.

loans.use: To purchase additional clothes to sell

loans.name: Adilia Del Socorro

texts.es: Adilia Del Socorro tiene 51 años de edad, su actividad económica es la compra y venta de cerdos. Hace más de 13 años que se dedica a este negocio, a ella le gusta su actividad, por lo que ella labora con este negocio para incrementar sus ingresos ya que poco a poco ha mejorado su vivienda y además que todos en su comarca la conocen, pues el servicio que ofrece es el mejor y la comunicación con sus clientes es la mejor. Algunas veces Adilia tiene que viajar a otros departamentos en donde hay comarcas que le ofrecen los cerdos mucho más favorable. Es por eso que solicita este financiamiento que es para capital de trabajo y comprar cerdos y pago de transporte. Adilia sueña con proporcionarle mejoras a su vivienda pues su techo tiene algunos agujeros y le gustaría repararla antes del invierno.
texts.en:
Adilia Del Socorro, 51, raises pigs for sale. She has been in this line of work for over 13 years and she enjoys it very much. She works at this to increase her income and, little by little, she has made improvements to her dwelling. Besides, she is very well-known in her area because she offers the best service and her communication with her customers is the best. Sometimes, Adilia has to travel to other departments where pigs are available for sale at more favorable prices. This is why she needs funding: to buy pigs and to pay tranportation costs. Adilia dreams with making improvements on her dwelling because the roof has many holes in it and she would like to repair it before Winter.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy pigs and pay transportation costs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a lot.

loans.name: Reyna María

texts.es:
La señora B. S. tiene 4 años de trabajar con ceprodel es Madre soltera con dos hijos a su cargo en edad escolar, esta señora antes era ama de casa pero su esposo le regaló cinco mil córdobas para que ella se ayudara decidio venirse a vender al mercado en el callejon de las verduras frente al sector cerdo.
Ella empezo su negocio con poca mercaderia poco a poco he salido adelante ahora tengo una ventesita en mi casa que esa la administra mi hija la mayor y ahora solo podemos constar con estos dos negocio ya que se quedo viuda hace poco.
texts.en:
B. S. has collaborated with Ceprodel for 4 years. She is a single mother with two, school age children under her care. She used to be a housewife but her husband gave her five-thousand córdobas so that she could help herself out; she decided to become a vegetable merchant in the market; she's located in the vegetable section across from the pork section. She started her business with little merchandise but gradually has been getting ahead and now "I have a small sales operation at home that my oldest daughter runs" They rely on both these businesses because she was recently widowed.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy vegetables:  yucca, quiquisque (a popular Central American tuber), cabbage, raddish, carrots.

loans.name: Teddy

texts.en:
Teddy is 62 years of age and widowed with 10 children between the ages of 16 and 36. Two of her children go to school. The family resides in and owns a four-roomed house, where she stays with 12 people. She takes care of additional family members. The family has access to electricity but no piped water at home. The family has three meals a day. Her greatest monthly expenses include utility bills, school fees for the children, medication and feeding the family. 

Teddy owns a store (wooden), selling charcoal and firewood in Busega. She buys sacks of charcoal from delivery trucks that come from the villages, so doesn’t incur transport costs. She receives an average of 40 customers a day. She has done this business for over 20 years. Her main challenges are  transportation, the rainy season (because she works from a muddy place) and the ever increasing price of charcoal. She sells on a retail basis only. 

She has been with MCDT, a Kiva partner, for over 10 years, six with the same group mates. She wants to use this loan to buy more sacks of charcoal and more firewood. She aspires to see her business grow bigger and to start selling only on a wholesale basis.

loans.use: To buy more sacks of charcoal and firewood

loans.name: United Group

texts.en:
United Group is a group of five borrowers led by Mary B.. Mary is 38 years old and married with three children, ages 3-13 years old and she also cares for a sibling. Her children's educational levels are between 1st and 4th grade. Mary could not continue her education through junior high due to poverty.

For 12 years, Mary has been selling foodstuffs like rice and oil at the Red Light Market, which is the largest market in Liberia. Mary sells good quality food products to her customers. She also keeps a good business relationship with her customers to encourage them to continue buying from her. Mary will use this loan to purchase more bags of rice and more gallons of oil. She dreams of seeing her children continue to be educated.

In the photo that accompanies this profile, Mary is the one holding the sign.

About LEAP:

The Local Enterprise Assistance Program (LEAP) is Liberia's largest and oldest continuously operating microfinance institution with 13 branches across the country. Founded in 1994, the non-profit organization has survived periods of civil war and severe socio-economic hardship. LEAP seeks to help rebuild post-conflict Liberia through its group and individual loans to micro- and small-scale entrepreneurs, and puts emphasis on lending to women.

loans.use: To purchase more rice and oil.

loans.name: Ramoni

texts.en:
Ramoni is a business man. He is married with two children. His eldest child is 10 years old and the youngest is 7 years old. His children attend school and this makes him happy. To support her husband, Ramoni’s wife is a teacher.

Ramoni sells drinks and juice at wholesale and retail prices to his customers. He loves this business because he does not sell on credit and so he does not incur debt in his business. He hopes to own a juice company in the future. He would like a loan for NGN 100,000 to purchase more drinks and juice to sell. He says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks and juice to sell.

loans.name: Janepher

texts.en:
Janepher is 36 years of age and married with four children between the ages of 4 and 10. All her children go to school. The family resides in and rents a two-roomed house, where she stays with seven people. She takes care of additional family members. The family has access to electricity but no piped water at home. The family has three meals a day. Her greatest monthly expenses include utility bills, school fees for the children, medication and feeding the family. 

Janepher has a stall selling plastics in the Owino market. She buys these plastics from shops on Nabugabo road in Kampala city and so incurs little  transport costs to and from shopping. She receives an average of 30 customers a day. She has done this business for over 20 years. Her main challenges are defaulters, the rainy season (because she works from a muddy place) and the ever increasing price of plastics due to a government ban. She sells on a retail basis only. 

She has been with Kiva's partner MCDT for over two years and is servicing her fourth loan, working all this time with the same group mates. She wants to use this loan to buy more bundles of plastics like cups, basins, buckets, mugs and plates. She aspires to see her business grow bigger and to start selling only on a wholesale basis.
.

loans.use: To buy more plastics like cups, mugs, buckets, basins and plates

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Gie Batuyaay Group

texts.fr: je suis Florence D., responsable du GIE Batuyaay de l'écovillage de Mlomp, en Casamance, Sénégal; Je suis mariée et mère de cinq enfant qui vont tous à l'école. nous venons avec mes amies, demander un financement auprès de Kiva, pour mener des activités génératrices de revenus dans notre écovillage, qui il faut le dire, a déja eu des groupes qui ont reçu un financement de votre institution. Nous voulons commercialiser les produits qui sont exploités dans nos forets et qui sont très recherchés dans les grandes villes comme par exemple l'huiles de myrrhe, de palmiste et de palme, des fruits sauvages qui sont aussi bien consommés dans les villes et surtout des poissons et crevettes séchés qui sont produits par nos maris qui sont des pêcheurs. Nous pensons qu'avec les bénéfices, nous pourront soutenir nos enfants qui sont entrain d'étudier dans les grandes villes.
texts.en:
I am Florence D., responsible for the Batuyaay GIE (Groupement d’Intérêt Economique) of Casamance in Sénégal. I am married and the mother of five children, all going to school. My friends and I are requesting a loan from Kiva, to conduct revenue-generating activities in our eco-village. I should mention that other groups in our village have already been granted loans by your institution. We want to commercialise products from our forests which are in high demand in large towns, for example: myrrh oil, palm oil, palm kernel oil, wild fruit that are also popular in towns, and above all the dried fish and shrimp produced by our fishermen husbands. We believe that with the earnings obtained, we will be able to support our children who are attending big city schools.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy forest and seafood products

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is 46 years of age and married with four children between the ages of 6 and 12. All her children go to school. The family resides in and owns a four-roomed house, where she stays with six people. She takes care of additional family members. The family has access to electricity but no piped water at home. The family has three meals a day. Her greatest monthly expenses include paying utility bills, school fees for the children, medication and feeding the family. 

Margaret has a stall selling second-hand clothes. She buys these second-hand clothes from Owino Market, one of the busiest markets in Kampala city, and so incurs transport costs to and from buying her wares. She receives an average of 40 customers a day. She has done this business for over 20 years. Her main challenges are defaulters, the rainy season (because she works from a muddy place) and the ever increasing price of used clothes. She sells on a retail basis only.

She has been with Kiva's partner MCDT for over 10 years and is servicing her 30th loan, working all this time with the same group mates. She wants to use this loan to buy more bales of second-hand clothes. She is aspiring to see her business grow bigger and to start selling on a wholesale basis only. 
.

loans.use: To buy more bales of second-hand clothes

loans.name: Luvinda

texts.es:
La señora Luvinda M. S. tiene una pulpería en su casa de habitación en el barrio la libertad desde hace 4 años tiene dos hijos pero ninguno a su cargo.
La señora M. S. solicito este financiamiento con el fin de surtir su negocio con mercaderia para la misma venta, antes de tener su negocio era domestica y empezo vendiendo hielo, frescos  y caramelos  con un capital de C$ 800.00 que ella los ahorro.
La señora abre su negocio a las siete de la mañana y los cierra de tres de la tarde a cuatro para ella hacer las compras para el negocio y despues lo abre de nuevo para cerrarlo a las ocho de la noche diario tiene 4 años de trabajar con ceprodel en el transcurso de este tiempo ella ha salido adelante ya que a incrementado su negocio
texts.en:
Luvinda Macareno S. has been operating a grocery store from her home for the past 4 years. It is located in the La Libertad district. She has two children but neither one is in her care. Mrs. Macareno S. requests this loan so that she might restock her business with merchandise for resale. Before she had her business she was a maintenance worker and sold ice, soft drinks and caramels on the side. She managed to save C$800 as start up capital. She starts her day at seven in the morning and closes for one hour from three to four in the afternoon to do shopping for her business, but she keeps the business open until 8 in the evening every night. For the past 4 years she has been a member f Ceprodel (Kiva Field Partner) and during that time she has seen success and she has managed to make her business grow.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase products for resale.

loans.name: C2137 Abakundana Group

texts.en:
Francoise is 19 years old and single. She lives in a village called Kabuga, in the Gasabo district of the Kigali province.  Kabuga is not far from the Rwanda International Airport.

Francoise owns a small business selling foods such as beans, sorghum, and so on. Even though she has her own business Francoise is also a group representative of the ABAKUNDANA group; this group contains eight people: six women and two men. 

Francoise has chosen the business of selling foods because in her region it is needed. Her business is well organized as well as known in the region, this is very helpful for her because it is a good way to get more customers from her community; Francoise employs one of her neighbors as an assistant. 

Her business is open from 6 in the morning to 6 in the evening even during the weekends. Right now Francoise is requesting a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company in order to purchase more sorghum and beans to sell. This loan will allow her to earn more profits which will be reinvested in her business.

loans.use: To buy beans and sorghum for resale

loans.name: Allah Malayah Group

texts.en: Allah Malayah is a group of five borrowers led by Saah J.. He is 36 years old, single and has no children. Saah could not continue his education past 8th grade due poverty. For seven years, Saah has been selling belts on Randall Street in downtown Monrovia, Liberia. He buys a wide variety of belts, which is appealing to his customers. He would eventually like to move his business into a shop. Saah will use this loan to purchase more belts. In the photo that accompanies this profile, Saah is the one holding the sign. About LEAP: The Local Enterprise Assistance Program (LEAP) is Liberia's largest and oldest continuously operating microfinance institution, with 13 branches across the country. Founded in 1994, the non-profit organization has survived periods of civil war and severe socio-economic hardship. LEAP seeks to help rebuild post-conflict Liberia through its group and individual loans to micro- and small-scale entrepreneurs, and puts emphasis on lending to women.

loans.use: To purchase more belts

loans.name: Khodor

texts.en: Khodor is a 20-year-old single man living with his parents. He started working as an aluminum worker eight years ago, and in 2007, after having a good experience, he opened his own aluminum shop. He produces all kind of aluminum works and on the orders of the clients. He is satisfied with his business income and he always tries to meet his clients’ needs. Today, Khodor is asking to borrow $1,200 to buy more aluminum rolls and tools.

loans.use: To buy more aluminum rolls and tools

loans.name: Gabril Gertrudis

texts.es: Gabriel Gertrudis tiene 57 años, por lo que este hombre tiene más de 5 créditos con Fundación León 2000, por lo que está muy agradecido por la confianza brindada con este financiamiento. Don Gabriel se dedica a ofrecer el servicio de restaurante, por lo que siempre su establecimiento se mantiene con ciertos clientes. Hace más de 16 años que tiene esta actividad, por lo que tiene una gran experiencia a pesar de tener mucha competencia ningún otro establecimiento ofrece  su carisma. El solicita este financiamiento para la compra de materia prima como verduras, granos básicos, jugos, gaseosas, carnes y comprar ciertas sillas y mesas. Su deseo es mejorar sus condiciones de vida por medio de este trabajo.
texts.en:
Gabriel Gertrudis, 57, has had over 5 loans with Fundación León 2000, for which he is very grateful. Gabriel has a restaurant that is supported by regular customers. He has been in this line of work for over 16 years so he has a lot of experience. Despite a lot of competition, no other establishment offers his particular charisma. He is asking for funding to buy raw materials like: vegetables, basic grains, juices, soft-drinks, meats. He also wants to buy tables and chairs. His wish is to improve his living conditions through this work.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy ingredients and supplies.

loans.name: Aida

texts.fr: Madame Aida D. est une femme mariée qui habite a Camberene et est sociétaire de la caisse de l’U-IMCEC Camberene depuis octobre 2005. Elle a déjà bénéficie d’un prêt antérieur.  Elle est mère de 4 enfants. Elle est couturière de profession depuis plus de cinq ans et dispose d’un atelier qu’elle gère dans la localité. Sa particularité est qu’elle reçoit beaucoup de commande. Elle sollicite un crédit de 100 000 frs pour acheter des tissus et du matériel qui vont lui permettre d’accroitre son activité. L’augmentation de ses bénéfices lui permet de contribuer à la dépense quotidienne.
texts.en:
Mrs. Aida D. is a married woman who lives in Camberene and has been a member of the U-IMCEC of Camberene since October of 2005. She has already benefited from a previous loan. She is the mother of four children. She has been a dressmaker by trade for five years and has a workshop which she manages in the vicinity. She stands out because she is very much in demand. She is requesting a loan of 100,000 FRS to buy fabric and materials which will allow her to grow her business. Increasing her profits will enable her to contribute to daily expenses.

Translated from French by Shannon Arnold, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to increase working capital

loans.name: Fidele

texts.en:
Fidele was born in 1980 and is married with three children aged between 3 and 8 years. He also takes care of two dependents who are relatives, the first one being 13 and the last one 17 years of age. Fidele and his big family live in Nyabihu district in the Western Province of Rwanda approximately three hours drive from the capital city of Kigali.

Fidele owns a small business selling Irish potatoes; he chose this business because he lives in a region where they are cultivated. His business is very profitable because the businessmen and businesswomen come from Kigali city to purchase Irish potatoes in large quantities. Fidele employs two people in his business as helpers. His business is open from seven in the morning to seven in the evening, every day except Saturday.

Fidele has an experience of three years in this field and is requesting a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company in order to purchase more Irish potatoes to sell wholesale. This business will help him to earn more profits and increase the number of employees in his business.

loans.use: To buy more Irish potatoes to sell

loans.name: Jalia

texts.en:
Jalia is 30 years of age and married with five children between the ages of 6 and 14. All her children go to school. The family resides in and owns a four-roomed house, where she stays with five people. She takes care of additional family members. The family has no access to electricity or piped water at home. The family has three meals a day. Her greatest monthly expenses include bills, school fees for the children, medication and feeding the family. 

Jalia has a retail shop selling stationery. She buys her wares from shops on Nkrumah road in Kampala city and so incurs little transport costs to and from purchasing her products. She receives an average of 10 customers a day. She has done this business for over five years. Her main challenges are defaulters, the rainy season (because she works from a muddy place) and the ever increasing price of stationery. She sells on a retail basis only.

She has been with Kiva's partner MCDT for over three years and is servicing her ninth loan, working all this time with the same group mates. She wants to use this loan to buy more boxes of stationery, like reams of paper, dozens of books and boxes of pens. She is aspiring to see her business grow bigger and to own a big stationery shop. 
.

loans.use: To buy more boxes of books, reams of paper and pens

loans.name: Carmenza

texts.es:
La señora Carmenza B. P. es comerciante del mercado Santa Ana, tiene un negocio de venta de productos ferreteros, tiene 20 años que se dedica a este tipo de negocio.
Anteriormente ella era ama de casa el negocio lo administra con la ayuda de su esposo el ve el negocio por las mañana mientras ella cocina y despues del medio día lo ve ella tienen tres hijos pero ninguno a su cargo, este financiamiento lo solicito para comprar productos de los cuales ya no tenia en existencia como llaves, candados, alicates, clavos y martillos al contado.
texts.en:
Carmenza has been selling hardware in the Santa Ana market for 20 years. She used to be a housekeeper. She runs her current business with her husband’s help. He watches the business in the morning, while she cooks, then she watches it in the afternoon. They have three adult children. She is asking for this loan in order to buy more items which she didn’t have very many of, such as keys, locks, nails, pliers and hammers.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Inventory

loans.name: Georgina Mercedes

texts.es: Doña Georgina Mercedes D. León Sánchez cuenta con 39  años D. edad,  casada con seis hijos, actualmente se dedica al comercio entregando todo tipo cosméticos para damas y caballeros el cual diariamente tiene demanda sus productos  para entregar cosméticos diferentes lugares D. su comunidad, se acerco a la Asociación ASDIR  por un préstamo,  debido a la falta D. capital D. su negocio, ya que no cuenta con el efectivo necesario para cubrir la demanda, el cual tuvo un encargo mayor y como consecuencia no pueD. cubrir la demanda D. sus clientes en su actividad por las misma razón necesita D. más capital  para  su negocio como también poder seguir mejorando sus fuentes D. ingresos y poder darle a su familia una vida mejor.
texts.en:
Georgina Mercedes D. León Sánchez, 39, is married and has 6 children. She sells all kinds of very populr cosmetics for men and women, she delivers all over her community. She called upon Asociación ASDIR to request funding because, lacking working capital, she does not have the cash to stock enough product to meet all her demand. She got a large order and is unable to meet demand of her other customers. She needs funds, therefore, to increase stock and to continue to improve her source of income thereby giving her family a better life.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cosmetics.

loans.name: Alexandra Guadalupe

texts.es: La señora Alexandra Guadalupe, ella había solicitado un financiamiento anteriormente pues fue de gran ayuda. Por lo que su actividad económica es la venta de ropa, ya que deseaba incrementar las ventas de sus productos y por sobre todas las cosas desea diversificar y no vender solamente un producto. Alexandra nos cuenta, que gracias a los esfuerzos y al apoyo que siempre le ha brindado Fundación León 2000 y Kiva cuenta con este medio para realzar las compras de sus productos. Actualmente solicita este financiamiento para la compra de materia prima.  Ella sueña siempre tener una tienda grande ubicada en el mercado, que brinde estabilidad económica a ella, su mama y su familia en general.
texts.en:
Alexandra Guadalupe previously requested a loan which was of great help to her. Her economic activity is the sale of clothing. She hopes to increase the sale of her products and above all she hopes to diversify and not only sell one type of product. Alexandra tells us that thanks to her efforts, to the support that Fundación León 2000 has always provided her and to Kiva, she has been able to rely on this medium to enhace the purchase of her products. She is currently requesting a loan to purchase staples for her business. Alexandra always dreams of having a large store in the market to provide her, her mother and her family in general with economic stability.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Manzo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital.

loans.name: Betzabe

texts.es:
Betzabé, de 60 años, vive en su casa propia en compañía de su esposo Enrique (59) y su hijo Ricardo (24), sus otros 5 hijos se han independizado y tienen sus propias familias.

Hace 3 años instaló una pequeña y bien surtida tienda de comestibles en su vivienda, al principio sentía temor de no tener buenas ganancias, pero sus ganas de ayudar a su esposo en los gastos del hogar hicieron que empiece con el negocio, tiempo después se dio cuenta que le daba buenas ganancias y amplió el local de su bodega. A Betzabé le gusta mucho su trabajo porque es tranquilo y en algunas oportunidades una de sus hijas la ayuda, sobretodo cuando tiene que salir, pues no le gusta cerrarla porque es una perdida. Aunque a su edad la mayoría de personas piensan en descansar después de toda una vida de trabajo, ella piensa en mejorar las instalaciones de su tienda y ofrecer mayor variedad de productos.

Este  es el 4to préstamo que tiene con MFP y está muy agradecida con todas aquellas personas que hacen posible su crédito para seguir trabajando en lo que le gusta. Además está muy contenta con el trabajo de su grupo, ya que todos son muy puntuales en los pagos de sus cuotas. Betzabé invertirá el dinero que solicita en la compra de mayor cantidad de mercadería para abastecer su tienda y ofrecer mayor variedad de productos.
texts.en:
Betzabe, 60, lives in her own home accompanied by her husband Enrique, 59, and her son Ricardo, 24. Her other 5 children are independent and live with their own families. Three years ago she set up a small and well-stocked food store in her home. At first she feared she would not have good earnings, but her desire to help her husband with the household expenses led her to start the business. She later realized that the store would give her good earnings and so she expanded the store site. Betzabe likes her work very much because it is quiet. At times one of her daughters helps her, especially when she has to go out, because she does not like to close the store and lose the income. Although at her age the majority of people think of resting after a lifetime of work, she is thinking about improving the facilities of her store and offering a greater variety of products. This is her 4th loan with MFP, and she is very grateful to all of the people who have made her loans possible so that she can continue doing the work that she enjoys. Also, she is very pleased to work with her group, since everyone is very punctual with their payments. Betzabe will invest the money that she requests in the purchase of a greater quantity of merchandise to restock her store and offer a greater variety of products.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to increase merchandise

loans.name: Justine

texts.en:
Justine is 60 years old and married, with eight children between 16 and 34 years old. All of her children go to school. Justine owns and lives in a four-room house where she stays with five other people, taking care of additional family members. 

The family has three meals a day, but has no access to electricity or piped water at home.  Justine's greatest monthly expenses include utility bills, school fees for children, medication and food for the family. 

Justine makes a living by selling charcoal at her home, a business she has been in for more than 15 years. She buys sacks of charcoal at home, avoiding transportation expenses.  She receives an average of 50 customers a day. Her main challenges are defaulters, the ever-increasing price of charcoal, and the rainy season -- her workplace can become muddy. She sells on a retail basis, to all categories of people. 

Justine has been with MCDT for more than 13 years.  She is servicing her 29th loan. She wants to use this loan to buy more sacks of charcoal.  Her goal is to expand the business and switch to selling wholesale, rather than retail.

loans.use: To buy more charcoal

loans.name: Jessica

texts.es:
Jessica, de 23 años, es soltera y vive en la casa de sus padres, en compañía de ellos y de sus 7 hermanos.

Desde muy joven, mientras trabajaba en una panadería, aprendió a preparar diferentes tipos de panes, pero desde hace 6 meses pudo invertir el dinero de sus ahorros en su propia panadería. Aunque es joven tiene muchas ganas de salir adelante para ayudar a su familia, ahora administra el negocio y cuenta con la ayuda de dos de sus hermanos. A ella le gusta mucho el trabajo porque es bastante rentable y no hay otra panadería cerca de esa zona, sin embargo lo que le desagrada es levantarse al amanecer todos los días, pero sabe que todo sacrificio tiene su recompensa. Para el futuro tiene pensado instalar una cadena de pequeños restaurantes donde ofrezca diversidad de comestibles y bebidas.

Este es el tercer préstamo que tiene con MFP y está muy agradecida con todas las personas que hacen su crédito para salir adelante y seguir trabajando. Jessica tiene pensado invertir el dinero que solicita en la compra de ingredientes para la panadería (manteca y harina). También quiere comprar gaseosas para empezar a vender estas bebidas en su local.
texts.en:
Jessica, 23, is single and lives with her parents and her 7 brothers in her parents' house. From the time when she was very young, while she worked in a bakery, she learned to prepare different types of bread. Six months ago she was able to invest money that she saved to open her own bakery. Although she is young, she has a strong desire to get ahead so that she can help her family. Now she runs the business along with the help of 2 of her brothers. She likes the work very much because it is sufficiently profitable, as there is no other bakery near this area. While she dislikes having to get up at dawn each day, she knows that her sacrifice will be rewarded. For the future she is thinking about establishing a chain of small restaurants where she can offer a diversity of food and drink. This is her 3rd loan with MFP, and she is very grateful to all of the people who have made her loans to get ahead and continue working. Jessica is planning to use the money she requests to buy ingredients for the bakery (butter and flour.) In addition, she wants to buy soft drinks to begin to sell these drinks from her business site.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy ingredients to make bread

loans.name: El Laural Group

texts.es:
El grupo el Laural está integrado por cuatro mujeres trabajadoras, esforzadas y emprendedoras. La coordinadora del grupo es la señora Marlene del Socorro M. Silvia quien desde el 2000 empezó a vender ropa este en un comienzo era poca pero según comento M. gracias a los prestamos ha podido invertir y mejorar su negocio.

Las otras integrantes del grupo son Jilma del Carmen E. A. la cual se dedica a realizar comidas y fritangas desde hace diez, Yalila Damaris M. Pérez comercializa ropa usada y zapatos, Darling María Venegas García tiene una pequeña librería y fotocopiadora la cual es muy buena porque es la única en el barrio.
texts.en:
Laural's group is formed by four women workers, strong and enterprising. The coordinator of the group is Señora Marlene del Socorro M. Silvia who since 2000 started selling clothing. To start of with it was small, but subsquently M., thanks to the loans, has been able to invest and better her business. The other members of the group are Jilma del Carmen E. A., who has worked making food and fried snacks since she was ten, Yalila Damaris M. Pérez, who sells used clothes and shoes, Darling María Venegas García, who has a small bookstore and photocopier which is very good because it's the only one in the neighborhood.

Translated from Spanish by Lois Parshley, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy clothing merchandise

loans.name: Gerardo Faustino

texts.es: Gerardo Faustino C. T.  cuenta con 22 años de edad, Soltero, viven con su familia materna, en la actualidad  se dedica al oficio de Mecánica Automotriz “Reparación de vehículos” se acerco a la asociación ASDIR para  un pequeño préstamo para poder comprar unas herramientas para su trabajo ya que según nos comenta que le hace falta algunas herramientas para poder reparar vehículos, ya que con las herramientas que cuenta le es un poco difícil de trabajar ya que  requiere de más herramientas  para poder ser eficiente en la reparación de vehículos, brindándole esta pequeña ayuda el podrá mejorar su producción, como también mejorará sus ingresos y así  podrá mejorar su  condición de vida.
texts.en:
Gerardo Faustino C. T. is 22 years old. He is single and lives with his family on his mother's side. He currently works as an auto mechanic repairing vehicles. He approached the ASDIR Association for a small loan to buy tools for his work because, as he says, he needs some tools to be able to repair vehicles, since with the tools he has it is a bit difficult to work and he needs more tools to be efficient in repairing vehicles. By providing this small help he will be able to improve his production, and also increase his income and in this way have a better quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to purchase tools

loans.name: Octavia

texts.es:
Octavia, de 49 años, vive en su casa propia en compañía de su esposo Manuel (52), quien es albañil y de su hijo Romario (14).

Cuando se casó, ambos decidieron construir una casa amplia y segura, ya que tenían la idea de alquilar habitaciones porque sabían que era un negocio muy rentable. Ya han pasado 15 años desde entonces y Octavia es la que se encarga de administrar los alquileres, de esta manera  ayuda con los gastos a su esposo, quien trabaja en diversas obras de construcción.
Para el futuro, tienen pensado implementar las habitaciones que alquilan con muebles para ofrecer un mejor hospedaje a sus inquilinos, quienes muchas veces vienen de otras ciudades a quedarse en su casa.

Este es el tercer préstamo que tiene con MFP y está muy agradecida con todas aquellas personas que hacen posible su crédito para que pueda progresar y seguir trabajando. A su vez, está muy satisfecha con el trabajo de su grupo, ya que todos son muy puntuales con el pago de sus cuotas. Octavia tiene pensado invertir el dinero que ahora solicita en la mejora de las habitaciones que alquila, ya que con el tiempo se han ido deteriorando.
texts.en:
Octavia is 49 years old and lives in her own house together with her husband Manuel (52), who is a mason, and her son Romario (14). When they got married, the couple decided to build a large and sturdy house, since they had the idea of renting out rooms, knowing that this is a quite profitable business. Since then, 15 years have passed, and Octavia is the one in charge of administering the rentals. In this way, she helps her husband, who works on various construction projects, with the expenses. For the future, they are thinking about equipping the rooms they rent with furniture, so that they can offer better hospitality to their tenants, many of whom come from other cities to stay in their home. This is Octavia's third loan with MFP, and she is very grateful to all of the people who make this financing possible, so that she can keep working and making progress. She is also very satisfied with the work of her group, since all of the members are very punctual in making their payments. Octavia plans to invest the funds she is now requesting in improving the rooms she rents, since they have been deteriorating over time.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Fixing up the rooms she rents out

loans.name: Susana

texts.es:
Susana, de 60 años, vive en su casa propia al lado de su esposo Fernando (72) y su última hija, Rosario (20), ya que sus otros 4 hijos son mayores y ya se han independizado.

Desde hace un año instaló en la sala de su vivienda una pequeña tienda de comestibles, ya que por la zona donde vive no tiene competencia. Atiende durante todo el día desde las 10 de la mañana hasta las 10 de la noche. Su esposo (en la foto) se dedica a las labores agrícolas, pero en algunas oportunidades le ayuda con la atención de la bodega. A Susana le gusta mucho su trabajo, pues es tranquilo y puede interactuar con sus vecinos y conocidos. En la actualidad vende de todo un poco en productos de primera necesidad, también gaseosas y cervezas, las que tienen bastante salida durante los fines de semana.
Y siendo una mujer muy trabajadora tiene planeado para el futuro ampliar las instalaciones de su tienda y colocar unas mesas y sillas para la comodidad de sus clientes cuando desean tomar alguna bebida.

Este es el 13avo préstamo que tiene con MFP y está muy agradecida con todas las personas que hacen posible su crédito, con el cual podrá seguir trabajando para salir adelante. A su vez, está muy contenta con el trabajo de su grupo porque está integrado por personas muy responsables y puntuales en sus pagos. Susana tiene planeado invertir el dinero que ahora solicita en la compra de mayor cantidad de mercadería para su tienda, ya que quiere surtirla con mayor variedad de productos para ofrecer lo mejor a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Susana, 60, lives in her own home along with her husband Fernando, 72, and her youngest daughter Rosario, 20. Her other 4 children are adults and are already independent. One year ago she set up a small food store in a room of her house, since in the neighborhood where she lives there is no competition. She attends to the store from 10 in the morning until 10 at night. Her husband (in the photo) works in agriculture, but at times he helps her attend to the store. Susana likes her work very much, since it is quiet and she can interact with her neighbors and acquaintances. She currently sells a little bit of everything, from basic necessities to soft drinks and beer, which she sells a lot of during the weekends. And, being a hardworking woman, she has plans for the future to expand the facilities of her store and put in some tables and chairs for the comfort of her customers when they want something to drink. This is her 13th loan with MFP and she is very grateful to all of the people who have made her loan possible so that she can continue working to get ahead. At the same time she is very content with the work of her group because it is made up of people who are very responsible and punctual in their payments. Susana plans to use the money she now requests to buy a greater quantity of merchandise for her store, since she wants to restock it with a greater variety of products to offer the best to her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to increase merchandise

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy cola nuts

loans.name: Maria Auxiliadora Group

texts.es:
En grupo María Auxiliadora está conformado por tres mujeres emprendedoras una de ellas es Walesca del Rosario R. V. quien es la coordinadora del grupo. Esta joven como muchos nicaragüenses que desean estudiar y superarse pero sus condiciones económicas no se los permite. Es entonces que decide empezar a vender zapatos para así costear sus estudios que gracias a Dios está culminando.

Las otras integrantes son María Elena V. quien tiene una mini pulpería en su casa de habitación desde hace 10 años y María Mercedes Hernández describe su comercio como mercadería en general; ya que ella comercializa desde ropa, joyería, zapatos y cosméticos.
texts.en:
The María Auxiliadora group was formed by three enterprising women. Walesca del Rosario R. V. is the coordinator of the group. This young woman, like many Nicaraguans, wishes to study and better herself, but her economic conditions do not allow it. She has decided to start selling shoes in order to pay for her studies that, thanks to God, are concluding. The other members are Maria Elena V., who has had a tiny store in her house for 10 years, and Maria Mercedes Hernández who describes her trade as general merchandise as she sells clothes, jewelry, shoes and cosmetics.

Translated from Spanish by Patrick Clarke, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy shoes

loans.name: Isidora Del Socorro

texts.es: La señora Isidora Del Socorro ella tiene 45 años de edad, es casada. La señora brinda el servicio de costura localizado en su casa de habitación, en el cual elabora pantalones, vestidos, camisas. Ella empezó con este negocio desde hace nueve años, cabe señalarse a ella le enseño su madre a coser, y nunca pensó que se dedicaría a esta actividad algún día. Ella empezó con este negocio como una búsqueda alternativa de una fuente de ingresos que le permitiera obtener ingresos adicionales además de los de su esposo y brindara estabilidad económica. Con el tiempo ha ido haciendo muchos clientes, los cuales la buscan mucho ya que aducen que trabaja bien y cobra barato. Su préstamo era invertido en la compra de telas variadas para hacer ropa. Ella siempre ha soñado con tener algún día un taller industrial y que pueda brindar trabajo a otras personas y tener mayores ingresos que los que posee ahora.
texts.en:
Isidora Del Socorro is 45 years old and married. She works as a tailor from her house, where she makes pants, dresses and shirts. She started this business nine years ago. She was taught to sew by her mother, but she never thought she would work in this activity some day. She started her business as an alternative source of income that would provide additional income from that of her husband, to bring them financial stability. Over time she has gained many customers, who ask for her a lot since they know she works well and doesn't charge too much. Her loan will be invested in purchasing a variety of fabric to make clothing. She has always dreamed of some day having an industrial shop that can give work to other people and to have more income than she already earns.

Translated from Spanish by Esteban Riojas, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: working capital: cloth

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a fast-food cart.

loans.name: Anne

texts.en: Being from a family of musicians, Anne always knew she'd become a professional musician. She studied jazz at an East Coast music school and became a singer, pianist, and songwriter. Inspired to action by 9/11, Anne did her first demo recording soon after. She then took the most popular track from her initial demo and used it as the base for her latest project, a full-length CD. While her bank wouldn't finance a musical endeavor, the loan officer who reviewed Anne's loan application referred her to ACCION USA. Compared to the credit cards Anne used to start her project, she's relieved to have a low interest ACCION USA loan. Now Anne can concentrate on promoting her work! About U.S. Microfinance and ACCION USA: Have you ever thought about how the cute new café on your corner or the salon you frequent every month got the financial resources to start their business? Chances are, they drummed up support from their friends and family, dipped into their personal savings, used a high-interest credit card, or all of the above. An estimated ten million small businesses in the U.S. face difficulty obtaining loans from traditional banks, even prior to the current “credit crisis”. Microfinance institutions, like ACCION USA, support these “unbanked” small businesses by giving them access to fairly-priced capital and business education. Small businesses also help stabilize low- to moderate-income neighborhoods and rebuild our economy through income growth and job creation. Self-employment provides workers with a way to increase their incomes, support their families, and strengthen their communities. As unemployment rises in the U.S., more and more people are turning to self-employment and start-up enterprises as a way to take control of their economic futures and provide employment opportunities in their communities. The need for support of small businesses in the U.S. is great, and it is one that ACCION USA has been striving to meet since 1991.

loans.use: To use for her music album production and promotion

loans.name: Paulina

texts.es:
Nuestra socia Paulina pertenece al Banco Comunal “Qory Orcco” de la Asociación Arariwa, tiene 45 años, es casada y tiene dos hijos. Paulina se dedica a la venta de leche, ella es proveedora principal de leche de la familia Aguilar, Paulina vende el litro de leche a 1.50 soles, vende aproximadamente de 40 a 45 litros de leche por día. Ya son 10 años que se dedica al negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. La socia Paulina también se dedica a la crianza de animales menores como cuyes y pollos. Paulina requiere el préstamo para comprar 40 cuyes y 20 pollos.   

La socia se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.

(La ciudad de Pucyura es distrito de la ciudad de Anta del Departamento del Cusco, Pucyura se encuentra ubicada a 40 minutos de la ciudad de Cusco).
texts.en:
Paulina, 45, is a member of Asociación Arariwa's "Qory Orcco" communal bank. She is married and has two children. Paulina is a dairy merchant; she is the Aguilar family's main milk provider. She sells a liter of milk for 1.50 soles and sells approximately 40-45 liters a day. She has been in this line of work for 10 years and she does well thanks to the effort she puts into her work. Paulina also raises small farm animals like guinea pigs and chickens. She needs financing to buy 40 guinea pigs and 20 chickens. She is grateful for the opportunity granted by this means and pledges to repay in a timely fashion. (The city of Pucyura is a district of the city of Anta in Cusco department; Pucyura is 40 minutes away from Cusco)

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy 40 guinea pigs and 20 chickens.

loans.name: Marta Yolanda

texts.es: La señora Marta Yolanda T. T. cuenta con 21 años, soltera vive con sus familia materna, en la actualidad ella se dedica a la sastrería “elaboración de sudaderos y pants” se acerco a la asociación ASDIR para  un pequeño préstamo para poder comprar una Aserradora de cortes de tela,  los encargos que se le hace requiere de maquinaria especial para sacar productos realmente sofisticados en sus labores diariamente, brindándole esta pequeña ayuda ella podrá mejorar su producción, como  en su trabajo la eficiencia para sacar cortes exactos y así  podrá mejorar su  condición de vida.
texts.en:
Marta Yolanda T. T., 21, lives with her maternal relatives; she is a seamstress "sweat-shirts and pants making." She called upon Asociación ASDIR to request a small loan to buy a pattern cutter. The work orders she takes on require specialized machinery to produce really sophisticated product daily. This small help will make it possible for her to improve her production allowing for her to cut exact pattern pieces thus improving her living conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a fabric pattern cutter.

loans.name: Las Rachoquelenses Group

texts.es: Son personas que residen a una distancia de 20 kilómetros de la ciudad de Momostenango, las integrantes del grupo se dedican mayormente al comercio y a la venta de ropa, también a la crianza de cerdos, cuentan con ganados bovinos, y se dedican a la compra y venta de canastas regionales y típicas, actualmente quieren incrementar el negocio con la que cuentan ya que en estos tiempos las ventas han bajado considerablemente, debido a que existe competencia sobre el mismo oficio, necesitan un préstamo para que puedan aumentar de capital para poder surtir su mercancía, y de esa manera poder incrementar sus ventar como también los ingresos económicos, esto contribuye a que las familias de cada una de ellas mejore sus condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
They are persons who live 20 kilometers away from the city of Momostenango. The members of the group are, for the most part, in clothing sales and commerce. Some raise pigs and cattle, others are regional and typical basket merchants. They all seek to help their businesses grow and at this time, when sales have declined considerably due to competition in the same areas, they need funding to stock merchandise so that they can increase sales and profits. This contributes to the improvement of each of their families.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy stock inventory.

loans.name: Francis Group

texts.es:
El grupo Francis está integrado por tres mujeres trabajadoras. La coordinadora del grupo es Francis Carolina G. de 32 años quien comenzó realizando sopas los fines de semana y nacatamales un plato tipo de Nicaragua que consiste en masa, cerdo, chile, chiltoma, cebolla, tomate, papa y arroz previamente preparados que luego se agregan a la masa que es cubierta con hoja de chagüite y se pone a cocer.

G. actualmente además realizar estos platillos comercializa ropa usada como una forma de generar más ingresos. Mientras las otras integrantes del grupo son Margarita Alvares quien vende perfumes, frijoles cocidos y sopa los fines de semana y Zaida O. quien vende cosméticos y con el ultimo préstamo invirtió en ropa.

Ellas invertirán el préstamo en sus negocios para mejorarlos y comercializar mayor cantidad.
texts.en:
The Francis group is made up of three, hard-working women. The group coordinator is Francis Carolina G., 32, who began selling soups on weekends; she also sells nacatamales (a typical Nicaraguan dish consisting of corn dough stuffed with pork, chilies, peppers, onions, tomatoes, potatoes and rice that have been previously prepared; they are then added to the dough, wrapped in banana leaves and cooked). In addition to merchandising these dishes, she also sells used clothing as a way to generate additional income. The other members of the group are: Margarita Alvares, who sells perfumes, cooked beans and soup on weekends and Zaida O., who sells cosmetics; she used the previous loan to buy clothing. They will invest the loan funds in their various businesses to improve them and sell more.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy ingredients for soup and nacatamales as well as to buy clothing.

loans.name: Mariela

texts.es:
Mariela, de 36 años, vive en su casa propia al lado de su esposo Willy (39), que es comerciante, y de sus 3 hijos; Angelie (13), Kimberly (10) y Cristian (8).

Cuando sus hijos crecieron quiso empezar trabajar apara apoyar a su esposo en los múltiples gastos del hogar, pensó en una bodega, pero se dio cuenta que había mucha competencia en la zona. Es así que su madre le dio la idea de instalar un pequeño restaurante y le dijo que ella podría ayudarla en la cocina y desde hace 4 años empezó en este negocio, donde le ha ido muy bien, ya que ambas tienen muy buena sazón y se han hecho de múltiples fieles clientes.
A Mariela le gusta mucho cocinar y a parte de su madre tiene una ayudante para la atención, que es de lunes a domingo; desde muy temprano ofrece desayunos, en la tarde almuerzos y por la noche termina el día con la cena. Siendo una mujer muy trabajadora, para el futuro está pensando ampliar su negocio para atender a mayor número de comensales.

Este es el 5to préstamo que tiene con MFP y agradece a todas aquellas personas que hacen posible que pueda acceder al crédito para seguir con su negocio. Con el dinero que ahora solicita tiene pensado comprar gaseosas para ofrecer en su negocio, además de ollas nuevas, ya que las que tiene están deterioradas.
texts.en:
Mariela is 36 years old and lives in her own house with her husband Willy (age 39), who is a merchant, and their three children; Angelie (age 13), Kimberly (age 10), and Christian (age 8).

As her children grew up she began to want to start working in order to help her husband with the many household expenses. She thought about a small store, but realized there would be too much competition in the area. Then her mother gave her the idea of starting a small restaurant and offered to help her in the kitchen. Now its been four years since she started this business which is going very well and both of them enjoy. They have acquired many loyal customers.

Mariela enjoys cooking very much and in addition to her mother she has another woman who helps with the restaurant. The restaurant is open seven days a work; starting very early in the morning they serve breakfast, in the afternoon, lunch, and at night they finish the evening serving dinner. Being a very hard working woman, in the future Mariela would like to expand her business to accommodate a larger number of diners.

This will be her fifth loan with MFP and she is grateful to all of the people who have made it possible for her to receive loans to continue her business. With the money from this loan she will buy sodas to offer at her business and new pots to cook with since hers have deteriorated.

Translated from Spanish by Cathy Coffman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: buying beverages and new pots for her restaurant

loans.name: Productoras Group

texts.es:
La asociación comunal de “Productoras”, está en su primer ciclo en el centro focal de Panamericana, son ocho mujeres que se dedican a trabajos como: venta de comida, mantillas, zapatos, pescado,ventanas metálicas, costura de todo tipo de prendas. 

Rosemery Q. T., socia de 25 años de edad, casada con una pequeña niña, lleva adelante el negocio de elaboración de chamarras, poleras y cargadores de bebés. Ella comparte el negocio con su esposo, que se encarga de vender lo producido.  Ahora ella está trabajando con la ayuda de un par de personas.  Sus materiales son comprados de los distribuidores de la “Ceja”, Ciudad de El Alto o de Galerías de Tela que se encuentran en la Ciudad de La Paz.

Cuando se le preguntó que le gustaría aprender, ella dijo sonriendo:  “quiero aprender a  hacer polleras”, las que usan las cholitas
texts.en:
The "Productoras" communal bank is in its first loan cycle within Panamericana focal center; they are 8 women who are involved in various lines of work like: food sales, sale of mantillas, shoe sales, fish sales, aluminum window sales and clothes-making. Rosemery Q. T., 25, is married and has a small daughter. She makes jackets, skirts and baby carriers. She shares the work with her husband who is the one in charge of sales. She now has a couple of assistants to help her, too. She buys her supplies from distributors in La Ceja, in El Alto or in Galerias de Tela, in La Paz. When she was asked what she would like to learn, she said with a smile: "I want to learn how to make skirts like the ones the native women wear."

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fabric, zippers, clasps.

loans.name: Manuel De Jesus

texts.es: Manuel De Jesús es un hombre joven además siempre le ha gustado trabajar y ser una persona independiente. Su actividad económica es la venta de perfumes y ropa nueva, el inicio este negocio hace 4 años que se dedica a este negocio por lo que él se moviliza con una bicicleta para visitar a sus diferentes clientes, para ofrecerles sus productos y además el mismo se encarga de entregarlos. Por lo que se prepara todos los días con una chaqueta de lona para soportar el calor inmenso que recibe todos los días pues él tiene que ganarse todos los días el pan de cada día. El financiamiento que está solicitando es para la compra de perfumes, cremas, ropa interior, lápiz labial, maquillaje y ropa nueva. El desea establecer una mini tienda en su vivienda.
texts.en:
Manuel De Jesús is a young man who has always liked to work and be independent. He sells perfume and new clothing. He started this business 4 years ago and he gets around to visit his customers, both to offer his wares and to make deliveries, on his bicycle. He prepares himeself every day with a canvas jacket that helps him withstand the intense heat he works in every day because he has to earn his daily bread. He is asking for funds to buy perfumes, creams, underwear, lipsticks, make-up and new clothing. He wants to set up a small store in his home.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy perfumes, creams, underwear, lipstick, make-up and new clothing.

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.en:
Mercedes L. V. lives in San Francisco de Heredia, located in the central valley of Costa Rica. She has worked for the past two years selling various products such as kitchen appliances, including microwaves, refrigerators and ovens, as well as perfumes.

Mercedes profits from price differences for her products purchased in Panama as compared to Costa Rica. This loan will be used to finance the purchase of kitchen appliances and perfumes from Panama, to be sold in the community of San Francisco de Heredia.

Mercedes visits her clients in the provinces of Alajuela, San Jose and Heredia on a weekly basis to both deliver orders and to collect payments. She is happy with her business. Her work has offered her an opportunity to provide a better life for herself and family. Her goal is to expand her business, seek out new clients and keep on working.

Mercedes does not have a fixed work schedule. Her workday and workweek are subject to change based on the needs of her clients. She says her business is going well and she has no major obstacles. Refering to her business, she says: ¨I haven’t had a bad month yet.¨

loans.use: To purchase kitchen appliances and perfumes

loans.name: Reiman Arturo

texts.es:
Reiman Arturo J. C., tiene la edad de 22 años, está soltero, y no tiene hijos.Vive con el papá, la madrastra y dos hermanos. El crédito lo quiere para la compra de algunos terneros y su alimentación. Desea darle el adecuado mantenimiento al ganado para obtener el mayor ingreso posible cuando se vendan. También desea aumentar el número de animales y poder mantenerlos en mejores condiciones, cuenta con un área de pasto idónea para el mantenimiento y cría del ganado. Es la primera vez que realiza un crédito con FUDECOSUR y está muy contento con las facilidades que se le brindaron. Don Reiman tiene varios años dedicado al ganado. El espera en un futuro brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida y una mayor estabilidad económica, y de poder seguir creciendo como persona y como productor.

About FUDECOSUR:
The Foundation for the Development of Southern Communities is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing credit and capacitating programs to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Southern Costa Rica. You can obtain more information on FUDECOSUR from the website: FUDECOSUR.org
texts.en:
Reiman Arturo J. C., 22, is single and doesn't have any children. He lives with his father, step-mother and two siblings. He is asking for funds to buy a few calves and to buy feed for them. He wants to provide his cattle with adequate care so that he can get the highest possible sale price. He also wants to increase the number of animals and to be able to keep them in proper conditions. He has an ideal pasturage area suitable for cattle raising. This is his first loan with FUDECOSUR and he is very happy with the loan terms that he got. Reiman has been dedicated to cattle raising for several years. He hopes, in the future, to offer his family a better quality of life and better economic stability; he also hopes to continue to grow as a person and as a producer.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cattle.

loans.name: Maxima Maria

texts.es: Doña Maxima María Ordoñez Lacán cuenta con 43 años de edad, es casada de oficios Artesana, “Elaboración de Fajas Típicas” cuenta con un taller, habita junto a sus 5 hijos conjuntamente con su esposo, Ella y su esposo se dedican al mismo oficio cuentan con dos empleados para la misma actividad, lleva 4 años de laborar Fajas Típicas  en su residencia que se encuentra en el Paraje Xeatzam, Cantón Nimapá, del departamento de Totonicapán, Guatemala,  actualmente la demanda de su clientela a crecido, pero las condiciones económicas en que se encuentra no son suficientes para que ella pueda aumentar su capital, por tal razón acudió a la Asociación ASDIR, a solicitar un préstamo, con la intención de comprar materia prima y de esa manera poder aumentar sus ventas, esperando también poder sacar adelante a sus hijos, y que tengan mejores condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Maxima María Ordoñez Lacán, 43, is a married craftsperson, who lives with her husband and 5 children. She has a workshop where she makes typical sashes. She and her husband are in the same line of work and they employ two workers. She has made typical sashes for 4 years in her home, which is located in Paraje Xeatzam, Cantón Nimapá, Totonicapán, Guatemala. Demand has risen lately but her economic situation does not permit her to increase her production. For this reason, she called upon Asociación ASDIR to request funds to buy raw materials so that she can increase sales thereby hoping to move her children ahead in life and that they have better living conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy crafts supplies.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy a moto-taxi

loans.name: Rafael Santos

texts.es: Don Rafael Santos B. B. cuenta con 54 años de edad, es casado de oficios Artesano, “Elaboración de Cortes Típicos” cuenta con un taller, habita junto a sus 10 hijos conjuntamente con su esposa, El y su esposa se dedican al mismo oficio cuentan con dos empleados para la misma actividad, lleva 30 años de laborar Cortes Típicos  en su residencia que se encuentra en el Paraje Chipar, Cantón Juchanep, del departamento de Totonicapán, Guatemala,  actualmente la demanda de su clientela a crecido, pero las condiciones económicas en que se encuentra no son suficientes para que el pueda aumentar su capital, por tal razón acudió a la Asociación ASDIR, a solicitar un préstamo, con la intención de comprar materia prima y de esa manera poder aumentar sus ventas, esperando también poder sacar adelante a sus hijos, y que tengan mejores condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Rafael Santos B. B., 54, is a married craftsperson; he lives with his wife and 10 children. He and his wife, with the help of two employees, make typical articles of clothing. He has been in this line of work for 30 years. His shop is located in his home, which is in Paraje Chipar, Juchanep Cantón, Totonicapán department, Guatemala. Demand for his products has increased lately but his economic situation does not permit him to increase production. For this reason, he has called upon Asociación ASDIR to request funds to buy raw materials so that sales can increase thereby allowing him to move his children ahead in life and providing better living conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy crafts supplies.

loans.name: Fátima Del Rosario

texts.es:
La Señora Fátima del Rosario R. tiene una pulpería en su casa de habitación en el reparto Abraham Rugama de la 12 de Septiembre, lleva 6 años con este negocio trabajando de lunes a domingo de seis de la mañana a nueve de la noche, ella utilizo el crédito para comprar mercaderia para la pulpería como: meneítos, tortillitas, jugos, gaseosas, galletas leña, productos lácteos.
Fátima R. es casada tiene 6 hijos, tres de ellos a su cargo y en edad escolar, antes de tener su negocio echaba tortillas de maíz  luchando fuertemente para el bienestar y preparación de sus hijos en el negocio por las mañanas le ayudan sus hijos o su esposo ya que ella sale a vender por las mañanas verduras con un carretón de mano en las calles de los barrios cercanas de su casa.
Tiene tres años de trabajar con ceprodel y ellas manifestó que se siente muy agradecida con la institución ya que le hemos ayudado bastante y ha podido salir adelante con su familia y en sus negocios
texts.en:
Fatima del Rosario Ramirez runs a store from her home in the Abraham Rugama neighbourhood. It has been six years since Fatima started her business. She works seven days a week, from 6:00 AM - 9:00 PM. Fatima will use this loan to increase her merchandise. She plans to buy cheezies, tortillas, juice, sodas, biscuits and dairy products. Fatima is married. Of her six children, three are school age, and she cares for the other three at home. Before she opened her store, she sold corn tortillas, and had to work extremely hard just to make ends meet and care for her children. Now that she has this business, her husband and children can help out in the mornings, while she sells vegetables in nearby neighbourhoods. Fatima has been working with CEPRODEL for three years, and she's grateful for their help, which has helped her look after her family and her business.

Translated from Spanish by Corinne Gilroy, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying store merchandise

loans.name: Albertina

texts.es:
Nuestra socia Albertina pertenece al Banco Comunal “Qory Orcco” D. la Asociación Arariwa, tiene 56 años, es casada y tiene cuatro hijos. Albertina alterna sus actividades del hogar con la atención D. su molinera.  La socia nos cuenta como es su trabajo cotidiano, ella compra los días domingos D. la ciudad D. Izcuchaca granos como maíz, cebada y trigo y después los lleva a su molinera y los muele luego ella venD. los granos molidos a precios económicos a sus vecinos D. Pucyura. La socia requiere el crédito para aumentar su capital D. negocio, específicamente ella comprara trigo, cebada y maíz.        

Albertina es socia fundadora del banco comunal “”Qory Orcco”  hace 3 años, pero por motivos D. negocios se fue a la ciudad D. Puerto Maldonado donD. se dedico a la venta D. comida en el mercado. Albertina actualmente regreso a la ciudad D. Pucyura a retomar sus negocios.     

La socia se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.

(La ciudad D. Pucyura es distrito D. la ciudad D. Anta del Departamento del Cusco, Pucyura se encuentra ubicada a 40 minutos D. la ciudad D. Cusco).
texts.en:
Albertina, 56, is a member of Asociación Arariwa's "Qory Orcco" communal bank. She is married and has four children. Albertina sees both to her domestic chores and to tending her mill. She described her daily routine for us: Every Sunday she buys grains like corn, barley and wheat in the city of Izcuchaca. Then, she takes the grain to her mill and grinds it. She then sells the ground product at affordable prices to her neighbors in Pucyura. She needs funding to buy wheat, barley and corn. Albertina was a founding member of the "Qory Orcco" communal bank three years ago. However, due to business needs, she moved to Puerto Maldonado where she sold food in the market. Currently, however, Albertina has returned to Pucyura to retake her business here. She is grateful with the opportunity provided by this means and pledges to repay in a timely fashion. (The city of Pucyura is a district in the city of Anta, Cusco department; it is 40 minutes away from Cusco)

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy wheat, barley and corn.

loans.name: Rosario Florinda

texts.es: Doña Rosario Florinda T. Gutiérrez cuenta con 30 años de edad, es casada de oficios Comerciante, “Compra y Venta de Blusas Típicas”  habita junto a sus 3 hijos conjuntamente con su esposo, Ella y su esposo se dedican al mismo oficio, lleva 8 años de Vender en su negocio que se encuentra en el Paraje Xolcajá, Cantón Poxlajuj, del departamento de Totonicapán, Guatemala,  actualmente la demanda de su clientela a crecido, pero las condiciones económicas en que se encuentra no son suficientes para que ella pueda aumentar su capital, por tal razón acudió a la Asociación ASDIR, a solicitar un préstamo, con la intención de comprar materia prima y de esa manera poder aumentar sus ventas, esperando también poder sacar adelante a sus hijos, y que tengan mejores condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Doña Rosario Florinda T. Gutiérrez is 30 years old and is married. She is a businesswoman who buys and sells traditional blouses. She lives with her husband and 3 children. Rosario and her husband work in the same business and have been selling for 8 years. The business is located in Paraje Xolcajá, Cantón Poxlajuj, Totonicapán Department, Guatemala. The demand from her clientele has grown, but her economic situation isn't sufficient to be able to expand her capital. For this reason she is went to Asociación ASDIR to seek a loan with the intention of purchasing primary material and in this way way be able to increase her sales. She is hoping to move her sons' lives forward, and that they have an improved standard of living.

Translated from Spanish by Jane McCrory, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Teresa De Jesús

texts.es:
La Señora Teresa de Jesús H. tiene un negocio de venta de ropa para niños y ropa interior en el mercado central de Chinandega de la iglesia el calvario cuadra y media al oeste en la acera de una casa. La señora H. solicito el crédito par surtir su negocio ya que nesecitaba surtirlo para poder tener ventas.
Abre su negocio a las siete de la mañana y lo cierra a las cinco de la tarde de lunes a domingo se esfuerza bastante para poder llevar el sustento a su casa es madre soltera de 3 hijos a su cargo anteriormente ella era doméstica pero se aburrió y decidió poner su propio negocio con  un capital de C$ 500.00 capital propio y vendiendo ambulante ya tiene 16 años de tenerlo en un punto fijo.
Tiene cinco años de trabajar con ceprodel y siempre estos financiamientos les saca provecho ya que a incrementado su negocio y su casita la ha mejorado poco a poco
texts.en:
Teresa de Jesús H. has a business selling children’s clothes and underwear in the central market of Chinandega. It is a block and a half west of the Calvario church on the sidewalk of a house. Mrs. H. is requesting a loan to stock her business because she needs to be able to have sales. She opens her business Monday through Sunday at seven in the morning, and she closes it at five in the afternoon. She works so hard in order to be able to support her household. She is a single mother, and she has three children under her care. She worked previously as a domestic employee, but she got bored. She decided to set up her own business. She used 500,000 NIO of her own money, and she was a traveling salesperson. She has had a fixed location for 16 years. She has worked with Ceprodel for five years. These loans have always been beneficial. She has expanded her business, and little by little she has improved her house.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy underwear for children and adults

loans.name: Concepción Del Carmen

texts.es:
La señora Concepción del Carmen B. S., tiene 45 años vive en el Barrio San Antonio Sur, es madre soltera de un hijo mayor de 20 años, él cual actualmente trabaja y apoya en los quehaceres del hogar.
Dentro de los planes de la familia esta el continuar con las remodelaciones en su hogar, gracias a los fondos Kiva a hecho posible el reconstruir su hogar, ahora solicita nuevamente de un prestamo para continuar con las reparaciones, con el credito compraría materiales de construcción, para reconstruir su habitacion personal, esto le traería mejores comodidades y condiciones de vida para ella y para su hijo que esta en ua etapa de independencia.
texts.en:
Señora Concepción del Carmen B. S. is 45 years old and lives in the suburb of San Antonio Sur. She is a single mother to her 20 year old son, who works and supports her with the household chores.
