Among her plans for the family is to continue remodelling her home. Thanks to the finances from Kiva it has been possible to reconstruct her home. Now she is seeking a new loan to continue with the repairs. With the loan she will buy construction materials to rebuild her bedroom, which will give her better comfort and living conditions for her and her son, who is on the brink of independence.

Translated from Spanish by Jane McCrory, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Remodel house

loans.name: Catarina

texts.es: Doña Catarina Z. Gutiérrez cuenta con 54 años de edad, es casada de oficios Comerciante, “Compra y Venta de  Ropa Típica”  habita junto a sus 2 hijos conjuntamente con su esposo, Ella y su esposo se dedican al mismo oficio, lleva 8 años de Vender en su negocio que se encuentra en el Paraje Xolcajá, Cantón Poxlajuj, del departamento de Totonicapán, Guatemala,  actualmente la demanda de su clientela a crecido, pero las condiciones económicas en que se encuentra no son suficientes para que ella pueda aumentar su capital, por tal razón acudió a la Asociación ASDIR, a solicitar un préstamo, con la intención de comprar materia prima y de esa manera poder aumentar sus ventas, esperando también poder sacar adelante a sus hijos, y que tengan mejores condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Doña Catarina Z. Gutiérrez is 54 years old, is married and lives together with her husband and 2 children. She is a businesswoman who buys and sells traditional clothing. She and her husband work in the same business, and have sold clothes for 8 years. Their business is found in Paraje Xolcajá, Cantón Poxlajuj, Totonicapán Department, Guatemala. Her clientele's demand has increased but she doesn't have the economic conditions to increase her working capital. For this reason she went to Asociación ASDIR to seek a loan with the intention of buying materials and in this way increase her sales. She is also hoping to help her sons progress and give them better living standards.

Translated from Spanish by Jane McCrory, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Massan

texts.en: Massan H. is 56 years old. She works in the Adidogomé district of Lomé, Togo selling charcoal. Since the age of 16, Mrs. H. helped her mother sell charcoal. She now has 40 years experience selling charcoal and runs her own business.  No doubt, this product is very popular. Many Togolese families use charcoal to cook their daily meals ensuring that demand for the product remains high. This will be Mrs. H.’s first loan with WAGES, which she will use to resupply her stock of charcoal. This loan will help her support her business, her husband, and her three children.

loans.use: To purchase charcoal for resale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy kitchen utensils

loans.name: Juana Rebeca

texts.es: Doña Juana Rebeca B. Velásquez  cuenta con 36 años de edad, es casada de oficios Artesana, “Elaboración de Cortes Típicos” cuenta con un taller  habita junto a sus 2 hijos conjuntamente con su esposo, Ella y su esposo se dedican al mismo oficio, lleva 10 años de Elaborar Cortes Típicos en su negocio que se encuentra en el Paraje Pacoc Siguán, Cantón Poxlajuj, del departamento de Totonicapán, Guatemala,  actualmente la demanda de su clientela a crecido, pero las condiciones económicas en que se encuentra no son suficientes para que ella pueda aumentar su capital, por tal razón acudió a la Asociación ASDIR, a solicitar un préstamo, con la intención de comprar materia prima y de esa manera poder aumentar sus ventas, esperando también poder sacar adelante a sus hijos, y que tengan mejores condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Doña Juana Rebeca B. Velásquez is married and lives with her husband and 2 children.. She is an artesan who makes traditional carvings in her own workshop. She and her husband work in the same business, and have been making traditional carvings for 10 years. Her business is found in Paraje Pacoc Siguán, Cantón Poxlajuj, Totonicapán Department, Guatemala. Demand from her clientele has increased but she doesn't have sufficient economic resources to increase her capital. For this reason she went to Asociación ASDIR to seek a loan with the intention of purchasing material and in this way increase her sales. She hopes to also help her children progress and have a better standard of living.

Translated from Spanish by Jane McCrory, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Petrona Crecencia

texts.es: Doña Petrona Crecencia Velásquez López cuenta con 52 años de edad, es casada de oficios Artesana, “Elaboración de Cortes Típicos”  cuanta con un taller habita junto a sus 2 hijos conjuntamente con su esposo, Ella y su esposo se dedican al mismo oficio, lleva 15 años de Elaborar Cortes Típicos  que se encuentra en el Paraje Pacoc Siguán, Cantón Poxlajuj, del departamento de Totonicapán, Guatemala,  actualmente la demanda de su clientela a crecido, pero las condiciones económicas en que se encuentra no son suficientes para que ella pueda aumentar su capital, por tal razón acudió a la Asociación ASDIR, a solicitar un préstamo, con la intención de comprar materia prima y de esa manera poder aumentar sus ventas, esperando también poder sacar adelante a sus hijos, y que tengan mejores condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Doña Petrona Crecencia Velásquez López is 52 years old and lives together with her husband and 2 children. She is an artesan who creates traditional crafts in her own workshop. She and her husband have worked together in the business for 15 years. The business is located in Paraje Pacoc Siguán, Cantón Poxlajuj, Totonicapán Department, Guatemala. The demand from her customers has increased but her economic conditions aren't sufficient to allow her to increase her working capital. For this reason she went to Asociación ASDIR to seek a loan with the intention of purchasing material and in this way increase her sales. She also hopes to help her children progress and give them better living conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Jane McCrory, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Mercedes Del Socorro

texts.es:
La señora Mercedes del Socorro Z. posee un tramo en el merado central de Chinandega de venta de refrescos desayunos y almuerzos, su financiamiento lo ocupo para terminar de remodelar su negocio ya que dio a hacer un portón para su tramo y lo dio a pintar.

La señora Z. es comerciante desde hace 40 años viene al mercado a las seis y media de la mañana y se va a las cuatro de la tarde siempre la viene a dejar su esposo y tiene una sobrina que le ayuda en su negocio.

Ella inicio su negocio con capital propio  de C$ 5,000.00 con una cuenta de ahorro que tenia en el banco popular antes ella era ama de casa  es casada, tiene cuatro años y medio de trabajar con ceprodel, doña Mercedita dijo que se sentía muy agradecida con estos créditos por que le han ayudado a crecer su negocio
texts.en:
Mercedes del Socorro Z. has a stall in the central market of Chinandega. She sells soft drinks, breakfast, and lunch. She used the loan to finish remodeling her business. She had a door made for her stall and she painted. Mrs. Z. has been a merchant for 40 years. She arrives at the market at six thirty in the morning, and she leaves at four in the afternoon. Her husband always drops her off, and she has a niece who helps her in the business. She started her business with 5,000 NIO, which she had in a savings account in a popular bank. Before that she was a housewife. She is married. She has been working with Ceprodel for four and a half years. Mercedita said that she is very grateful for these loans because they have helped her business grow.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Remodel her business and buy sugar

loans.name: N'taa

texts.en: N’taa K. is 46 years old. She works in the Adidogomé district of Lomé, Togo, selling a local beverage called tchoukoutou made from fermented millet. She began this business in 2006 and is now asking for her first loan from WAGES. She will use these funds to purchase the necessary ingredients to make this drink and sell to her community. Ms. K. is not married and does not have children. Please help her keep her customers happy and hydrated.

loans.use: Purchase of ingredients to make a local beverage

loans.name: María Hilda

texts.es: María Hilda C. M. de 49 años de edad, reside en el departamento de Chalatenango. Vive en compañía de su esposo y de un nieto el cual se encuentra a cuidado de ella, y que se dedica a estudiar. María posee un molino, el cual esta ubicado en su casa de habitación,  en el cual las personas acude a moler maíz, frijoles, arroz, tomates, y otros productos más. Así mismo este negocio ha demostrado ser muy rentable para María, ya que cuenta con mucha clientela, sobre todo aquellas personas que poseen tortillerías, ya que estas llegan a diario a  moler el maíz. Ella cuenta con muy buena ubicación en su negocio, así mismo no posee competencia, ya que es el único molino que se encuentra en el lugar. María solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda darle mantenimiento a los molinos, así mismo comprarles nuevos motores los cuales trabajen con gasolina para mayor eficiencia de estos. Todo esto lo hace con el fin de poder mejorar su servicio y las condiciones de su negocio, ya que ella necesita mucho de las ganancias obtenidas, debido a que son la mayor fuente de ingresos que posee. María desea salir adelante y poder contar con una vida mejor.
texts.en:
María Hilda C. M., 49, lives in the department of Chalatenango. She lives with her husband and a grandson who is in her care and who goes to school. Maria has a mill, which is located in her house. People come to her mill to grind corn, beans, rice, tomatoes and other products. This business has proved to be very profitable for Mary since she has many customers, especially those who own tortilla shops as they come daily to grind the corn. Maria has a very good location for her business; there is no competition since she has the only mill in the area. Maria requests a loan to use for maintenance of her mills and she also wants to buy new gasoline motors to make them more efficient. All of this will be with the aim of improving her service and the conditions of her business, since she really needs the earnings it provides as this is her main source of income. Maria hopes to succeed and be able to have a better life.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy new motors for her mills

loans.name: Alusine D.'s Group

texts.en:
Pictured here are teachers from a primary school in Waterloo, a small town about 26 miles away from Freetown, Sierra Leone’s capital city.  This school was established in 1996. Currently, the school has 14 staff members. Out of the 14, eight have applied for a loan of SLL 5,600,000 from SMT/Kiva lenders. 

This is the first loan this school is accessing from Kiva through SMT.  School staff from this institution, like many other schools' staff within SMT’s operational areas, come to SMT to apply for loans. With the help of these loans, they can accomplish certain tasks that they would otherwise not be able to accomplish with their mere salaries alone. But with the help of this loan, some can pay school fees for their children; others can use the loan to buy pieces of furniture, a plot of land, house-building materials, or invest in business. At the end of each month, these teachers can repay the loan out of their monthly salaries. The institution’s bursar is directly responsible for deducting the repayment and pays SMT on their behalf.

43-year-old Alusine D. C. is the head of this group. Alusine was born in Kambia district, northern Sierra Leone. He is single with 2 children. Alusine has applied for a loan of SLL 1,000,000 from SMT, a partner of Shine on Sierra Leone in Waterloo, in order to buy house-building materials like bags of cement, iron, corrugated zinc, boards, and poles. 

(Attached on the photo are some group members who were not present for the group snapshot.)

loans.use: Buy house-building materials

loans.name: Abdulai's Group

texts.en:
These are teachers at a secondary school in Tombo village, near Freetown, Sierra Leone’s capital city. This school was established in 1993 and it currently has 20 teachers on its payroll. Eight out of the 20 have applied for a loan of SLL 8,200,000 from SMT (a partner of Shine on Sierra Leone in Waterloo)/Kiva lenders in order to meet their immediate financial challenges. 

School staff from this institution, like many other schools' staff within SMT’s operational areas, come to SMT to apply for loans. With the help of these loans, they can accomplish certain tasks that they would otherwise have not been able to accomplish with their mere salaries alone. But with the help of this loan, some can pay school fees for their children; others can use the loan to buy pieces of furniture, a plot of land, house-building materials, or invest in business. At the end of each month, these teachers can repay the loan out of their monthly salaries. The institution’s bursar is directly responsible for deducting the repayment and pays SMT on their behalf.

Forty-three-year-old Abdulai J. (first row, first from left) is the Acting Vice Principal at the school.  He was born in Tombo village, is married to a businesswoman, and they have 4 children. Mr. J. has been a teacher for 14 years now. With his share of this loan, he will buy house-building materials – cement, bundles of corrugated zinc, etc. 

(Attached to the photo are other group members who were not present for the group snapshot.)

loans.use: Buy house-building materials

loans.name: Alice's Group

texts.en:
Pictured here are teachers at a primary school in Benguma Barracks, near Freetown, Sierra Leone’s capital city. This school was established in 1974 to educate children of military personnel. Teachers at this school have applied for a loan of SLL 6,600,000 from SMT (a partner of Shine on Sierra Leone in Waterloo)/Kiva lenders in order to meet their immediate financial challenges. 

School staff from this institution, like many other schools' staff within SMT’s operational areas, comes to SMT to apply for loans. With the help of these loans, they can accomplish certain tasks that they would otherwise not have been able to accomplish with their mere salaries alone. But with the help of this loan, some can pay school fees for their children; others can use the loan to buy pieces of furniture, a plot of land, house-building materials, or invest in business. At the end of each month, these teachers can repay the loan out of their monthly salaries. The institution’s bursar is directly responsible for deducting the repayment and pays SMT on their behalf.

Forty-eight-year-old Alice W. (pictured on the left) is the head teacher at the school and leader of this group.  She was born in Freetown, is married and has 2 children. For 2 years now, Alice has backed her teaching profession with some trading. She sells flour and oil. With her share of this loan, she will buy bags of flour and gallons of oil to add to her business stock.

loans.use: Buy bags of flour and gallons of oil to add to her business

loans.name: María Irene

texts.es: María Irene C. D. P. D. 52 años D. edad, resiD. en el departamento D. La Paz. Vive junto a su esposo y dos nietos D. 17 y 15 años D. edad, los cuales se dedican a estudiar gracias al extraordinario trabajo y esfuerzo D. sus abuelos. La señora María se dedica a la compra D. cerdos D. granja, los cuales alimenta y cría para posteriormente vender o destazar para vender la carne. Así mismo se encarga D. procesar leche D. vaca la cual posteriormente sale a vender por las calles del departamento D. La Paz. DesD. hace 5 años que María tuvo la iniciativa D. emprender su propio negocio el cual le permitiera obtener ganancias extras y poder mejorar la estabilidad económica D. su familia. Es por esta razón que decidió utilizar el espacio con el que cuenta en el patio D. su casa y poner una pequeña granja D. cerdos. María solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda comprar mayor cantidad D. comida para cerdo, así mismo comprar más cerdos, los cuales pueda criar D. la mejor manera para luego vender a sus clientes. María posee una gran necesidad D. las ganancias D. este negocio, es por ello que cuenta con el deseo D. poder mejorarlo y seguir adelante con este.
texts.en:
María Irene C. D. P., 52, lives in La Paz department with her husband and two grandsons, who are 17 and 15 years of age; they can focus on being students thanks to the extraordinary efforts of their grandparents. María raises domestic pigs that she later either sells or butchers to sell the meat. She also processes cow's milk that she peddles along La Paz department's streets. It was five years ago that María took the initiative to start her own business that would make it possible for her to have extra income and be able to improve her family's economic stability. For this reason, she decided to use the space available in her yard to set up a small pig farm. María is asking for funding to buy more pig feed as well as more pigs to raise for subsequent sale to her customers. María's need for the profits from these sales is great, thus her desire to improve them and get ahead in life through them.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy pigs and pig feed.

loans.name: Future For Life Group

texts.en:
Pictured here are members of the 'Future for Life' group from the small town of Waterloo, about 26 miles away from Freetown, Sierra Leone’s capital city. They are small-scale businesspeople who want a loan of SLL 3,000,000 in order to expand their business, make more sales, and consequently improve their standard of living.

Mohamed B. K. is the head and leader of this group of entrepreneurs. The 27-year-old was born in Kabala, northern Sierra Leone. He is married to a businesswoman and they have 2 children. For more than 10 years now, Mohamed has been selling phone accessories. With his share of this loan, he will buy phone accessories like batteries, chargers, ear-phones, phone covers, etc.

loans.use: Buy phone accessories such as batteries, chargers, ear-phones, phone covers, etc.

loans.name: Eduarda

texts.es:
Nuestra socia Eduarda pertenece al Banco Comunal “Qory Orcco” de la Asociación Arariwa, tiene 46 años, es casada y tiene cuatro hijos dos independientes y dos dependen de ella todavía (Mariluz de 11 años y Miguel Ángel de 10 años). Eduarda alterna sus actividades del hogar con sus pequeños negocios. La socia nos cuenta como es su trabajo cotidiano, ella los días viernes lleva comida como trucha frita a la ciudad de Inquilpalta, los días sábados lleva verduras a vender a la feria del mercado de Huancaro de la Ciudad del Cusco y los días lunes y domingos lleva comida a la plaza de armas de la ciudad de Pucyura. Eduarda también se dedica a la venta animales como ovejas, ella requiere el préstamo de los 800 soles para comprar 6 ovejas.    

La socia se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.

(La ciudad de Pucyura es distrito de la ciudad de Anta del Departamento del Cusco, Pucyura se encuentra ubicada a 40 minutos de la ciudad de Cusco).
texts.en:
Eduarda, 46, is a member of Asociación Arariwa's “Qory Orcco” communal bank. She is married and has four children, two who are independent and two (Mariluz, 11 and Miguel Ángel, 10) who still depend on her. Eduarda alternates her domestic chores with small businesses. She relates her daily work routine: Every Friday she takes food, like fried trout, to to sell to the city of Inquilpalta. On Saturdays she takes vegetables to sell in Cusco's Huancaro market. On Mondays and Sundays she takes food to Pucyura's main square to sell. Eduarda also raises small farm animals, like sheep, to sell. She is asking for 800 soles to buy 6 sheep. She is grateful for the opportunity offered by this means and pledges to repay in a timely fashion. (The city of Pucyura is a district of the city of Anta, Cusco department; it is 40 minutes from Cusco)

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy 6 sheep.

loans.name: Aura Mercedes

texts.es:
La señora Aura Mercedes T. tiene su negocio en su casa  de habitación vende ropa nueva y usada, sus financiamientos los ocupa para comprar ropa ya que ella entrega conforme a pedido.
Tiene dos hijas ambas en edad escolar, trabaja de lunes a domingo buscando pedido en su clientes sus hijas le ayudan a vender a ella, anteriormente ella era doméstica y vendía ambulante manzanas y uvas dentro del mercado siempre hemos luchado mi esposo me ayuda con lo de la casa  tiene cuatro años de trabajar con ceprodel y nos dijo que le hemos ayudado mucho porque gracias a Dios y  a la institución a sacado adelante su negocio y preparar a sus hijas a poco a poco.
texts.en:
Aura Mercedes T. sells new and used clothing from home; she uses her loans to buy clothing since she delivers based on prior orders. She has two, school-age daughters. She works Monday to Sunday taking orders from her customers. Her daughters help her sell. She used to work as a domestic and sold apples and grapes in the market. "My husband and I have always struggled; he helps me with household expenses." She has collaborated with Ceprodel for four years and she told us that we have helped her much because, thanks be to God, the institution has made it possible for her business to succeed and has helped her to prepare her daughters little by little.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To fill orders for men's and women's clothing.

loans.name: Abdul Deen's Group

texts.en:
Pictured here are teachers at a secondary school in Waterloo, a small town near Freetown, Sierra Leone’s capital city. This school was established in 2002. The school is staffed with 25 teachers; 12 of them have come together to apply for a loan of SLL 7,500,000 from SMT (a partner of Shine on Sierra Leone in Waterloo)/Kiva lenders in order to meet their immediate financial challenges. 

School staff from this institution, like many other schools' staff within SMT’s operational areas, come to SMT to apply for loans. With the help of these loans, they can accomplish certain tasks that they would otherwise not have been able to accomplish with their mere salaries alone. But with the help of this loan, some can pay school fees for their children; others can use the loan to buy pieces of furniture, a plot of land, house-building materials, or invest in business. At the end of each month, these teachers can repay the loan out of their monthly salaries. The institution’s bursar is directly responsible for deducting the repayment and pays SMT on their behalf.

Forty-seven-year-old Abdul Deen T. is the leader of this group of teachers. He was born in Bo, southern Sierra Leone. He is married to a teacher and they have 3 children. Mr. T. has applied for a loan of SLL 500,000 in order to buy house-building materials. 

(Attached to the photo are some group members who were not present for the group snapshot.)

loans.use: Buy house-building materials

loans.name: María Leonor

texts.es: María Leonor C. D. R. D. 44 años D. edad, resiD. en Ilopango, ubicado en el departamento D. San Salvador.  Vive en casa propia junto a su esposo y tres hijos menores D. edad, los cuales se dedican a estudiar. María posee una tortillería en la cual se dedica a hacer y vender tortillas en su propia casa, así mismo se dedica a la venta D. perfumes, maquillajes y otros tipos D. cosméticos más los cuales comercializa D. forma ambulante, visitando casa por casa a sus vecinos y amigos. Ella es una mujer muy trabajadora la cual siempre se ha esforzado por salir adelante, sobre todo en esos momentos difíciles en los cuales su esposo a carecido D. trabajo, ha sido ella a través D. sus negocios como ha logrado solventar todos los gastos del hogar y las necesidades D. sus hijos. Ella solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda contar con el dinero necesario para comprar maíz por mayor, así mismo comprar más cosméticos, los cuales venD. a crédito pero que ella debe pagar al contado, es por esto que es muy importante que cuente con el dinero necesario para seguir adelante con su negocio, el cual le ha permitido poseer  todo lo necesario para vivir.
texts.en:
María Leonor C. D. R., 44, lives in Ilopango, San Salvador department, in her own house with her husband and three children, who are students. María has a tortilla shop in her home where she makes and sells tortilllas. In addition, she sells perfumes, make-up and other kinds of cosmetics door-to-door. She is a very hard-working woman who has always maD. the effort to get ahead in life, especially during these hard times, when her husband hasn't had much work, it has been through her efforts that the family has been able to meet their expenses and fulfill the needs of the children. She is asking for funding to buy corn at wholesale as well as more cosmetics, which she sells on credit but she must pay cash. It is important for her to have enough money that she can count on so that her business, which has provided everything needed to survive, can continue moving forward.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy corn and cosmetics.

loans.name: Nelly Rafaela

texts.es:
La señora Nelly Rafaela O. C., tienen 36 años de edad, es casada y con su familia viven en el Reparto Juan Ramon Padilla, ellos tienen un hijo de 11 años el cual cursa la escuela primaria.

Ella pertenece a un club nutricional, en el cual desde hace 1 años compra por catalogo suplementos que vende de forma ambulante, y dentro de las principales problemas que ha tenido es que no cuenta con los recursos economicos para aumentar la capacidad de compra y por ende el volumen de las ventas, ella inicio su pequeño negocio gracias al apoyo que le brinda incondicionalmente su esposo, pero dentro de sus posibilidades económicas, ellos son una familia modesta pero trabajadora que solicitan de un prestamo para la compra de un inventario mayor de productos. Esto les ayudaria economicamente y les brindaria las posibilidades de emprenderse a nuevos negocios y/o mejores comodidades de vida para todos los miembros de la familia.
texts.en:
Nelly Rafaela O. C., 36, is married and has an 11-year-old son, who is in elementary school; they live in Reparto Juan Ramon Padilla. She belongs to a nutritional club in which, for the last year, she has bought catalogue dietary supplements that she then sells from door to door. One of the main obstacles she has faced is not having enough economic resources to increase her inventory; as a result, her sales are low. She started her small business thanks to her husband's unconditional support. However, their purchasing power is small - they are a family of modest means but they are very hard-working. She is asking for funding to buy a larger inventory of products which will help them economically and provide the opportunity to go into new enterprising areas and/or better living conditions for all family members.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy Herbalife products.

loans.name: Dellys Andrea

texts.es:
El banco comunal Divino Niño Jesús lo conforman un grupo de mujeres muy alegres, luchadoras y carismáticas que buscan en el día a día la superación personal, familiar y en sus  trabajos siempre con optimismo  y visión de un mejor presente y futuro para todos los miembros de sus  familias, éste banco se encuentra en la ciudad de Cuenca tercera  más importante del Ecuador ubicada en la región centro sur del país que goza de clima frío permitiendo a su población dedicarse al cultivo de diferentes frutas y verduras  para abastecer tanto su mercado local como para el resto del país.  
 

Para nuestra socia  Dellys V. fue de gran ayuda formar parte del banco comunal por los creditos recibidos  que le permitieron estabilizarse económocamente y ésto fue gracias a su amiga otra socia del banco que la invito a formar parte del mismo, ella es una socia que cautiva por su carisma y amabilidad vive en las afueras de la ciudad de Cuenca por la vía a Nulti  con su pareja en  unión libre  y su única hija de 14 años, su  esposo trabaja en su propio taller de mecánica industrial  ubicado en su casa propia ahorrandose el gasto de arriendo.

Dellys es comerciante de ropa y  calzado, lleva varios años en esta actividad recorriendo  todos los pueblos de la ciudad de lunes a viernes y sobre todo los días feriados, gracias  a su trabajo tiene  muchos conocidos y clientes fijos a quienes les deja a crédito su mercadería.  Nos comenta que se encuentra dos años trabajando con  los préstamos obtenidos junto a su banco comunal y con el dinero del credito solicitado va a comprar pantalones, camisas, sacos, blusas, calzado deportivo y casual para damas, caballeros y niños para ofrecer un stock surtido para su exigente clientela e incrementar su negocio.

Tiene como  meta terminar  de construir su casa ya que le faltan algunos acabados.
texts.en:
The Divino Niño Jesús communal bank is made up of cheerful, hard-working, charismatic women, who daily seek to become better both as individuals and as workers, always with optimism and a view toward a better present and future for their families. This bank is in the city of Cuenca, Ecuador’s third most important. Cuenca is located in the south-central part of the country and its climate is cold, which permits its inhabitants to farm various fruits and vegetables both for the local market and for the rest of the country. To be part of the communal bank was a great help to our member, Dellys V., because of the loans received that helped her to stabilize economically. This was thanks to her friend who, as another member of the bank, invited her to become a member. She is a member that enchants other with her charisma and kindness. She lives in Cuenca’s outskirts, along Vía a Nulti, with her life partner and their only, 14-year-old daughter. Her husband has his own machine shop that is located in their home, thus saving on rental costs. Dellys is a clothing and footwear merchant; she has been in this line of work for several years. She goes to all the city’s neighborhoods from Monday through Friday but especially on holidays. Thanks to her work, she has many acquaintances and regular customers to whom she sells her merchandise on credit. She relates to us that she has worked with communal bank loans for two years now. She will use the funds requested on this occasion to buy pants, shirts, coats, blouses, sports and casual shoes for women, men and children so that she can have a varied stock available for her demanding customers, thereby increasing her business. Her goal is to finish building her house because it’s still lacking a few finishing touches.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy pants, shirts, coats, blouses, sports and casual shoes for the entire family.

loans.name: Leona Feliciana

texts.es: Doña Leona Feliciana Ordoñez P. cuenta con 30 años de edad, es casada de oficios Artesana, “Elaboración de Cortes Típicos” cuenta con un taller, habita junto a sus 2 hijos conjuntamente con su esposo, Ella y su esposo se dedican al mismo oficio cuentan con dos empleados para la misma actividad, lleva 15 años de laborar Cortes Tipicos  en su residencia que se encuentra en el Caserío la Libertad, de la Aldea Vásquez, del departamento de Totonicapán, Guatemala,  actualmente la demanda de su clientela a crecido, pero las condiciones económicas en que se encuentra no son suficientes para que ella pueda aumentar su capital, por tal razón acudió a la Asociación ASDIR, a solicitar un préstamo, con la intención de comprar materia prima y de esa manera poder aumentar sus ventas, esperando también poder sacar adelante a sus hijos, y que tengan mejores condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Mrs. Leona Feliciana Ordoñez P. is 30 years old, is married, and she works as an artisan in “Elaboración de Cortes Típicos” (Elaborating Typical Cuts). She has a workshop and lives with her 2 children and husband. Mrs. Ordoñes and her husband have the same occupation and they have 2 employees, they have worked for 15 years in Cortes Tipicos in their home which is located in Caserío, La Libertad, in Aldea Vásquez, the department of Totonicapán, Guatemala. At present, the demand from their customers has increased, but their current economic condition is not enough for her to increase her income, it is for this reason that she went to Asociación ASDIR (Kiva’s field partner) for a loan, with the intention to buy raw materials so that she can increase her sales. She also hopes to give her children a good start in life and that they have better living conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Duque, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Work capital

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Lorenzana

texts.es: Lorenzana L. de 51 años de edad, reside en Tonacatepeque, ubicado en el departamento de San Salvador. Vive junto a su esposo y dos hijas menores de edad, la cuales asisten a la escuela del lugar. Lorenzana posee una venta de verduras, la cual esta ubicada en las afueras de su hogar, así mismo vende granos básicos como: arroz, frijoles, y otros más. Su negocio esta sobre un pasaje en el cual transitan muchas personas y debido a que el mercado se encuentra bastante retirado de este lugar, ella cuenta con mucho clientes los cuales compran a diario su producto. Lorenzana solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda comprar mayor cantidad y variedad de verduras, de manera que pueda atender todos los pedidos de sus clientes, ya que esto la beneficia en gran manera debido a que obtiene mayores ganancias. Así mismo desea comprar mayor cantidad de granos básicos ya que son estos unos de los productos que poseen mayor demanda. Lorenzana cuenta con la esperanza de poder ampliar su negocio, aumentando la cantidad de productos que posee, ya que esto sería muy bueno para la estabilidad económica de su familia.
texts.en:
Lorenzana L. is 51 years old, lives in Tonacatepeque located in the department of San Salvador. She lives with her husband and 2 underage daughters who go to school in the area. Lorenzana sells vegetables, outside of her home and also sells basic grains like: rice, beans, and other goods. Her business is over a crossing where there are a lot of passersby since the market is located very far from that area. She has a lot of customers that buy products from her daily. Lorenzana needs a loan so that she can buy a greater quantity and variety of vegetables, this way she can meet the demands of her customers, this would help her a great deal since she would get greater profits. She also wishes to buy a greater quantity of basic grains since they are in great demand. Lorenzana hopes to expand her business by increasing the quantity of products she offers to her customers since that would be very good for the economic stability of her family.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Duque, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy vegetables and basic grains.

loans.name: Katumu

texts.en:
Katumu M. is a trader selling at the heart of the Central Market Building in Bo. She is married to an Agro-Forestry worker and has two kids and six other dependents.

She has been in the business of selling cooking condiments for the past eleven years. Katumu intends to expand her business through wholesale purchasing and selling. She has a very good credit history in her group loan. 

She hope to use the proceeds of the loan to pay her children’s school fees.

loans.use: To buy more food ingredients to sell

loans.name: Fátima Auxiliadora

texts.es:
La señora Fátima Auxiliadora H. P. es comerciante del barrio Santa Ana, tiene un cafetin que lo administra en una escuela, en el cual ella lo atiende desde las seis de la mañana hasta las doce del día y por las tardes ella realiza compras para el negocio.
Ella solicito financiamiento para surtir su negocio, antes de tener este negocio ella vendía repostería ambulante ya tiene ocho años de ser comerciante por si sola, porque antes ella trabajaba para una panadería y decidio empezar a vender ella sola, tiene cuatro hijos es madre soltera, ella se esfuerza mucho para sacar adelante a sus hijos con sus estudios tiene cinco años de ser cliente de nuestra institución y me dijo que con estos créditos ella ha salido adelante con su negocio y su casa la ha acondicionado un poco.
texts.en:
Fátima Auxiliadora H. P. is a merchant in Santa Ana neighborhood; she has a small snack bar in a school. She's open for business from 6am until noon; she spends the afternoons shopping for her business. She asked for funding to stock her snack bar. Prior to having this business, she sold pastries door-to-door. She has been an independent merchant for 8 years because she used to be employed by a bakery and she decided to sell on her own. She's a single mother of four children. She makes the effort to get her children ahead with their schooling. She has been a client of our institution for 5 years and she told me that these loans have made it possible for her business to get ahead and they have made it possible for her to make some home improvements too.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy supplies for her snack bar:  sweets, cookies, juices, soft-drinks.

loans.name: Evangelina

texts.es: Evangelina B. de 52 años de edad, reside en Ilopango, ubicado en el departamento de San Salvador. Vive junto a sus tres hijos de 28, 11 y 6 años de edad, de los cuales el mayor se dedica a trabajar como taxista, y los dos menores a estudiar, así mismo vive junto a una sobrina la cual es discapacitada, lo cual le impide trabajar, pero le ayuda a su tía con el negocio. Evangelina posee una tienda en la cual comercializa productos perecederos y de primera necesidad para el hogar. Dicho negocio lo posee desde hace 13 años, razón por la cual es muy conocida en el lugar, ya que siempre se ha destacado por ser una señora muy trabajadora, quien ha aprovechado cada situación en la vida para seguir adelante y brindarles una mejor vida a sus hijos y su sobrina. Evangelina solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda surtir su tienda con muchos más productos alimenticios, así mismo comprar productos nuevos. Ella cuenta con toda la ilusión de poder mejorar su negocio, lo cual le permitirá mejorar su estabilidad económica.
texts.en:
Evangelina B. is 52 years old; she lives in Ilopango, located in the department of San Salvador. She lives with her 3 children of 28, 11, and 6 years of age. The eldest is a taxi driver and the 2 youngest are in school, her niece also lives with her and is disabled which prevents her from working but she helps her aunt in her business. Evangelina has a store where she sells perishable goods and basic household items. She has had her business for 13 years, and is very well-known in the area since she is recognized as being a hardworking woman that has taken advantage of each situation in her life to keep going and to give her children and niece a better life. Evangelina needs the loan to stock her store with more food products as well as buying new products. She has the dream of expanding her business which will allow her to improve her economic stability.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Duque, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy perishable goods.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more clothing to sell

loans.name: Emiliano

texts.es:
Nuestro socio Emiliano, pertenece al banco comunal  “CAPAC QOYA”, nuestro socio está ubicado en el distrito de Coya- Pisac a 50 minutos de la ciudad del Cusco.

Nuestro socio tiene 33 años de edad él es  conviviente y tiene 1 hijo de 6 años, nuestro socio es artesano y transportista, el socio trabaja con la venta de artesanía, nuestro socio a su vez trabaja como transportista, el brinda servicio en la ruta Pisac Calca, nuestro socio ahora que las inundaciones afectaron el distrito de Coya en Pisac, se ven afectado porque disminuyo el turismo y las artesanías no se venden igualmente el transporte ahora está bajo las personas no circulan por estos lares a causa de que muchos de ellos cerraron sus pequeñas tiendas destinadas al turismo. Nuestro socio requiere el préstamo para mejorar su taller de artesanía, para cuando la temporada empiece. 

Nuestro socio agradece  la oportunidad brindada y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus diferentes cuotas en los plazos establecidos.
texts.en:
Our member is Emiliano, he belongs to the “CAPAC QOYA” communal bank, and he lives in the district of Coya- Pisac, 50 minutes from the city of Cusco.

Our member is 33 years old and he lives with his partner and has a six-year-old son. Emiliano is an artisan and a salaried worker in the transportation sector in the Pisac Calca route. Our member has been affected by the flooding in the district of Coya in Pisac, since tourism has decreased and the handicrafts are not sold and transportation has decreased since people don’t frequent the area as much and many have closed their small stores dedicated to tourism. Our member needs the loan to make improvements to his workshop for when the new season starts.

Our member is happy for the opportunity given to him and is committed to meet the payments of his quotas in the time set.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Duque, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Our member needs the loan to make improvements to his workshop.

loans.name: Felicia

texts.en: After being laid-off from a newswire agency in 2004, Felicia, originally from Guyana, decided to start-up her own public relations agency. She runs her business out of her home, and works primarily on public relations in the Caribbean. On occasion, Felicia also writes for a daily newspaper in New York. The turning point in her business was being contacted by an India-based company to do their ad placements in the Caribbean, Africa, and Latin America. She has successfully serviced their account for several years. In addition, she has recently been inundated with all the newswire hits on Haiti. Felicia contacted ACCION USA to provide her with the funds needed to hire a new staff member. She hit some struggles with her business during the economic downturn in 2008, but since then she has been doing her best to build her business. Her current staff of part- and full-time employees needs to be expanded to continue to successfully grow her business. About U.S. Microfinance and ACCION USA: Have you ever thought about how the cute new café on your corner or the salon you frequent every month got the financial resources to start their business? Chances are, they drummed up support from their friends and family, dipped into their personal savings, used a high-interest credit card, or all of the above. An estimated ten million small businesses in the U.S. face difficulty obtaining loans from traditional banks, even prior to the current “credit crisis”. Microfinance institutions, like ACCION USA, support these “unbanked” small businesses by giving them access to fairly-priced capital and business education. Small businesses also help stabilize low- to moderate-income neighborhoods and rebuild our economy through income growth and job creation. Self-employment provides workers with a way to increase their incomes, support their families, and strengthen their communities. As unemployment rises in the U.S., more and more people are turning to self-employment and start-up enterprises as a way to take control of their economic futures and provide employment opportunities in their communities. The need for support of small businesses in the U.S. is great, and it is one that ACCION USA has been striving to meet since 1991.

loans.use: To hire an employee

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy soft drinks

loans.name: Emilce Catalina

texts.es:
Emilce C. D. M. vive en el barrio Galán D. la ciudad D. Barranquilla. Está casada con cuatro hijos, todos mayores D. cuarentena años y vive con su esposo, un hijo y tres nietos. Tiene un negocio D. confecciones D. ajuar D. bebé y ahora solicita un crédito D. $2.000.000 que quiere invertir en la compra D. telas e insumos y adornos para elaborar ropa y elementos para bebe.
Emilce es una clienta D. largo plazo con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, que inició su negocio hace alrededor D. 20 años por medio D. una amiga que le sugirió vincularse a esta organización mediante   un grupo solidario; allì le prestaron por primera vez $15.000, así fue como compró sus primeras telas y fue avanzado su negocio desD. ese momento. Mientras estaba en grupo solidario, ellas se ayudaban mutuamente, pero ahora recibe crédito individual, es decir por su propia cuenta. A lo largo D. los años con la Fundación, su negocio ha consistido tanto en hacer ajuar D. bebé, sábanas, toldos, decoraciones D. canastos, como en vender comida frita. Ahora se dedica más a las confecciones D. ropa D. bebé y por ello una gran parte D. sus clientes se compone D. mujeres embarazadas, pero también tiene como clientes a misceláneas que le otorgan espacio en sus negocios para exhibir los productos que ella elabora.
Mediante su negocio ha conseguido, alquilar un espacio donD. venden minutos D. celular, una peluquería y un apartamento que tambien arrienda y son parte D. sus ingresos adicionales. Dice que siempre escoge bien a sus inquilinos y que ahora sueña con adquirir su propio apartamento, para tener un espacio personal para ella sola al final del camino.
texts.en:
Emilce C. D. M. lives in the Galán neighborhood in the city of Barranquilla. She is married with 4 children, all over 40 years of age and she lives with her husband, a son and 3 grandchildren. She has a business where she makes layettes and needs a loan of $2.000.000 (pesos), that she will use to buy fabrics, materials and decorations to make clothing and items for babies.

Emilce is a long-term customer with the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation (Kiva’s field partner) that started its business some 20 years ago because a friend recommended her to be a part of this organization in a group loan. There they lent her $15.000 (pesos), for the first time and that is how she bought her first fabrics and developed her business from that moment. While she was in the group loan, they helped each other mutually but now she has an individual loan. Throughout the years with the foundation, her business has consisted of selling layettes, sheets, awnings, decorations for baskets, as well as fried food. Now she is more into making baby clothing and a big part of her customers are pregnant women but she also has others that exhibit the products she makes in their businesses.

Through her business, she has been able to rent a room where they sell cell-phone minutes, a barbershop and an apartment that is rented and all are part of her current income. She says that she chooses her tenants very carefully and now dreams of having her own apartment to have a personal space for her at the end of her life.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Duque, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fabrics, materials, and decorations to make clothing and layettes for babies.

loans.name: Jhonny

texts.es:
Nuestro socio Jhonny, pertenece al banco comunal  “CAPAC QOYA”, nuestro socio está ubicado en el distrito de Coya- Pisac a 50 minutos de la ciudad del Cusco.

Nuestro socio tiene 43 años de edad él es  casado y tiene 3 hijos de 21, 14, 6 años, nuestro socio trabaja independientemente,  el  tiene su propio negocio, en casa el puso una fotocopiadora, también realizan trabajaos en computadora,  hace ti peos, fotocopias, impresiones y todo en computadoras, nuestro socio tiene su negocio en plena pista principal camino de Pisac a Calca; nuestro socio requiere el préstamo para implementar su pequeño negocio y comprar algunos materiales para implementar. 

Nuestro socio agradece  la oportunidad brindada y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus diferentes cuotas en los plazos establecidos.
texts.en:
Our partner, Jhonny, belongs to the community bank "Capac Qoya." He is located in the Coya-Pisac district, fifty minutes outside the city of Cusco. He is 43 years old and married with three children, who are 21, 14, and 6 years old. Jhonny works independently in his own business. He installed a photocopier in his house. He also does work on computers. He does typing, photocopies, printing, and the like on computers. Jhonny has his business in plain sight on the main street from Pisac to Calca. He needs the loan to set up his little business and buy some necessary materials for it. Jhonny apprecaites the opportunity given to him and promises to fulfill his repayments within the established time periods.

Translated from Spanish by Lydia Brantley, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Set up printing and photocopying business

loans.name: Las Sirenas Group

texts.es:
El grupo Las Sirenas tiene 10 integrantres.  Ellas se reúnen cada semana  para realizar sus pagos se consideran unas señoras emprendedoras y trabajadoras.  Este grupo está ubicado en Tierra Blanca VeraC..  

L. representante del grupo se llama C. Maria Gómez AndraD. tiene 34 años D. edad, y tiene  2 hijos.  ElL. se dedica a L. venta D. colchas D. hilo que trae con gran esfuerzo del Estado D.  Oaxaca y necesita el préstamo para surtirse nuevamente ya que dice que le va muy bien.  El sueño D. doña C. Maria es  poner una tienda D. ropa para seguir ayudando a su esposo en L. economía del hogar y darles mejor calidad D. vida a sus hijos.

Los integrantes son: Verónica A. López elL. venD. ropa, Consuelo López D. L. C. elL. venD. ropa,   Maria Del carmen T. A. elL. venD. comida,   Juana R. M. elL. venD. ropa y perfumes, Jacqueline M. V. elL. renta sillas para fiesta, Milagros Gómez AndraD. elL. venD. comida, Yoshelin Gómez AndraD. elL. venD. manualidades, C. Maria Gómez AndraD. elL. venD. colchas, Consuelo V. V. elL. venD. ropa, Ciria O. Hernández elL. venD. zapatos.
texts.en:
The group "Las Sirenas" ("The Mermaids") has ten members. The women get together every week to make their payments. They consider themselves entrepreneurial and hard-working. The group is based in Tierra Blanca VeraC.. The group's representative is C. Maria Gómez AndraD.. She is 34 years old and has two children. She works selling bedspreads, which take great effort to bring from the state of Oaxaca. She needs the loan to get a new supply, because she says she is doing very well. Mrs. C. Maria's dream is to have a clothing store, so that she can continue helping her husband with their household costs and give her children a better quality of life. The members of the group are: Verónica A. López, who sells clothes; Consuelo López D. L. C., who sells clothes; Maria Del Carmen T. A., who sells foods; Juana R. M., who sells clothes and perfume; Jacqueline M. V., who rents chairs for parties; Milagros Gómez AndraD., who sells food; Yoshelin Gómez AndraD., who sells handicrafts; C. Maria Gómez AndraD., who sells bedspreads; Consuelo V. V., who sells clothes; and Ciria O. Hernández, who sells shoes.

Translated from Spanish by Lydia Brantley, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase supply of clothes and bedspreads

loans.name: Virginia

texts.es: Virginia tiene 53 años, por lo que su actividad económica es la venta de zapatos. Hace más de 3 años que se dedica a este negocio, ya que sus hijos le ayudan en lo que más pueden, pues trabajan de manera independiente pero siempre están al pendiente de su Madre. Ella inicio hace 3 años con este negocio por lo que siempre ha luchado por mejorar su condición económica. Por lo que no quiere perder su medio de trabajo por este motivo solicita este financiamiento para capital de trabajo y comprar diferentes estilos de calzado. Su deseo es remodelar su vivienda para dejárselas a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Virginia is 53 years old, and her work is selling shoes. She has dedicated herself to this business for more than 3 years, and her children help her whenever they can, working independently but still depending on their mother. She began the business three years ago because she has always worked hard to improve her economic situation. She does not want to lose her means of making a living, so she is requesting a loan to provide working capital and to buy different styles of shoes. Her desire is to remodel her home so that she can leave it to her children.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Evangelina

texts.es:
Nuestra socia Evangelina, pertenece al banco comunal  “CAPAC QOYA”, nuestra socia está ubicada en el distrito de Coya- Pisac a 50 minutos de la ciudad del Cusco.

Nuestra socia tiene 45 años de edad nuestra socia es soltera  y tiene 2 hijos de 21, 14 años de edad, nuestra socia alterna sus actividades con el comercio minorista, compra y vende animales, nuestra socia tiene cuyes, chanchos, pollos; La socia tiene un pequeño terreno en el cual hizo su casa y su espacio para criar animales menores, cuando logran el tiempo de madurez ella vende a su animalitos y en el caso de reproducción de sus animales vende los mayores luego de un tiempo y cría a los bebes, ese es el negocio de nuestra socia, ella solicita el préstamo para comprar otra nueva camada de animales variados para aumentar su negocio.

Nuestra socia agradece  la oportunidad brindada y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus diferentes cuotas en los plazos establecidos.
texts.en:
Evangelina belongs to the “CAPAC QOYA” communal bank. She lives in the Coya-Pisac district, 50 minutes from the city of Cusco. She is 45 years old and single, with 2 children aged 21 and 14. She divides her time between her household activities and her retail sales business, in which she buys and sells animals. She has guinea pigs, pigs and chickens. Evangelina has a small plot of land on which she built her house and set up a space to raise small animals. When the animals reach maturity, she sells them. Sometimes she breeds the animals, selling the older ones after a while and raising the babies. This is her work, and she is requesting the loan to buy a new supply of various animals to expand her business. Evangelina is grateful for the opportunity provided to her, and she is committed to making all of her payments on time.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing small animals to sell

loans.name: Gertrudys De Los Angeles

texts.es: Doña Gertrudys es una mujer, trabajadora, tiene 42 años de edad, vive en el barrio Laureano Mairena, con tres hijos que procreo, pero solo uno esta con ella el cual esta cursando sus estudio, con su esposo se separo desde hace varios años el cual, se ha dedicado a trabajar para apoyar a sus hijos, estudio y se recibió en banca y finanzas,  ha laborado en varias empresas buscando un mejor ingreso. Tiene diez años de trabajar en una cooperativa dos de Agosto  como contador general. pues gracias a Dios tiene su casa es toda de concreto, que avenido haciendo mejoras con sus ahorros, pero aun le falta repellar las paredes, poner cerámica al porche, pintar y embaldosar una parte del patio ya que en invierno se hace mucho lodo lo que atrae al mosquito y desea mejorar para una mejor higiene y poder estar en mejores condiciones,  es por eso opto al financiamiento ya que todo esta caro y no logra avanzar y así hará todo lo cual ya compro arena, piedrin, cerámica, cemento y pintura para comenzar la obra.
texts.en:
Gertrudys is a hard-working woman of 42 who lives in the Laureano Mairena neighborhood. She has three children, but only one is still with her and in school. She and her husband separated some years ago, and she has dedicated herself to working to support her children. She has studied and received a qualification in the area of banking and finance, and she has worked in various companies in search of a better income. For the past ten years, she has worked in a cooperative called Dos de Agosto (August 2) as general accountant. Thus, thanks to the Lord, she has a house that is built completely from concrete, and she has been able to add to her savings. However, she still needs to plaster the walls, add ceramic tiles to the porch, paint, and tile a part of the patio, since in winter there is a lot of mud which attracts mosquitoes. She would like to renovate her house in order to improve its condition and provide better hygiene. For this reason, she chose to request financing, because everything is expensive and she has not been able to make progress. With this loan, she will be able to finish everything. She has already purchased sand, stones, ceramic tile, cement and paint to begin the project.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing construction materials to plaster walls, tile the porch and paint her home

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mercy K. is married and has five dependents. She has a senior high school education.  

Mercy sells bread at Elmina. She has been doing this for some time now. Her husband is a farmer.  Mercy uses her income to help her husband in the payment of school fees and utility bills.  

She will use the loan to purchase more bread to sell. With the new profits from her expanded business, Mercy plans to save to educate her children.

loans.use: To purchase more bread to sell

loans.name: Hilda De Los Angeles

texts.es:
El banco comunal Divino Niño Jesús lo conforma un grupo de mujeres muy alegres, luchadoras y carismáticas que buscan en el día a día la superación personal, familiar y en sus  trabajos siempre con optimismo  y visión de un mejor presente y futuro para todo los miembros de sus  familias, éste banco se encuentra en la ciudad de Cuenca tercera ciudad más importante del Ecuador ubicada en el centro sur del país que goza de clima frío permitiendo a su población dedicarse al cultivo de diferentes frutas y legumbres  para abastecer tanto el mercado local como para el resto del país.  

Hilda R. vive en la urbe cuencana en la ciudadela Los Eucaliptos con su esposo y sus tres hijos de 15, 13 y 6 años, su cónyuge es empleado de EMAC (Empresa municipal de Agua Potable y Alcantarillado),  aun no tienen casa propia y viven en la de un familiar.

Hilda tiene dos profesiones  Auxiliar  Contable y   Enfermera particular,  debido a la poca demanda de estas actividades, hace un año  inició su propio negocio de elaboración y venta de artesanías en su taller ubicado en su domicilio compartiendo con las actividades del hogar y dedicando más tiempo a sus hijos.

Se encuentra en su sexto ciclo y fue una socia del  banco quien la incentivo a participar de éste equipo de mujeres visionarias para que acceda a  todos los beneficios que la Fundación entrega a sus socias, el dinero del préstamo lo va utilizar en la compra de un horno para preparar la masa de sus artesanías,  su meta de llegar a tener sucursales de su negocio  y dar empleo a más mujeres de su sector.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank “Divino Niño Jesús” (Divine Christ Child) is a group of cheerful, determined, and charismatic women who are looking to improve themselves, their families, and their businesses. They are always optimistic and envision making both the present and future better for every member of their families. This Communal Bank meets in the city of Cuenca, which is the third largest city in Ecuador and located in the southern part of the country that encounters cold weather. The residents grow different fruits and vegetables to supply the local markets as well as the rest of the country.

Hilda R. lives in the area of Cuenca called Los Eucaliptos with her husband and three children (ages 15, 13, and 6). Her husband is employed by EMAC (“Empresa Municipal de Agua Potable y Alcantarillado”, which is the local water utility). They do not own a home and currently live with a relative.

Hilda works two jobs, as an assistant bookkeeper and as a nurse. Since there is less demand for her services, she started her own business a year ago making and selling crafts. Her shop is located at home, which enables her to perform her household duties and spend more time with her children.

Hilda is participating in her sixth loan cycle. She was invited to participate in this team of visionary women so that she could partake in all of the benefits the Foundation provides to its members. The loan she is requesting will be used to purchase a kiln for preparing the clay used in her handicrafts. Her goal is to branch out her business and create jobs for more women.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a kiln

loans.name: German Gustavo

texts.es:
Germán Gustavo  Garzón  Rodríguez, es un joven de 26 años que vive con su esposa en  la localidad San Cristóbal de Bogotá, la capital de Colombia. Desde sus 13 años mostró su inclinación hacia las artes plásticas, haciendo trabajos en arcilla, madera y cerámica, para ya a  los 16 años iniciarse en la pintura al óleo, acrílico, de abstracción y figuras humanas femeninas;  lo cierto es que  Germán conoce perfectamente las técnicas escultóricas y es admirable deleitar la vista con sus creaciones que expresan formas abstractas, puras que no identifican imágenes existentes, pues su creación está guiada por la imaginación y la fantasía de su espíritu de artista. Aunque  su formación ha sido muy autodidacta, estudió un básico preparatorio en artes plástica donde aprendió dibujo, escultura en formas abstractas y tridimensionales. 
En la actualidad, Germán Garzón tiene un taller  donde se dedica a la  escultura en madera, piedra, pintura artística y además elabora y vende productos artesanales como lámparas en madera, pergamino, y cuero, para lo cual necesita comprar  materiales, como  bloques para tallaje en madera, unidades de oleos y gubias por tallaje; este es precisamente  el propósito del financiamiento al que aplica por valor de $ 1.500.000 para seguir expresando su estilo.
Sueña con consolidar y posicionar su trabajo, abrir mercados a nivel latinoamericano y ganar reconocimiento  en algunas galerías a nivel nacional. Su mayor desafío  es poder acceder  a la educación profesional, pues dice que es difícil la tramitologia y la aplicación de pruebas que no son acordes a las artes plásticas. Vive en un barrio atractivo, con  entorno geográfico y visión al lado de cerros que inspiran su imaginación y desarrollan todos los dias su potencial creativo.
texts.en:
Germán Gustavo Garzón Rodríguez is a young man who is 26 years of age and lives with his wife in the community of San Cristóbal in Bogotá, the capital of Colombia. Since he was 13 years old, he has demonstrated an inclination for the visual arts – creating works made of clay, wood, and ceramics. By the time he was 16, he started painting abstract designs and female figures in oil and acrylic. What is true about Germán is that he knows perfect sculpturing techniques and has a wonderful eye for expressing abstract forms in his creations. They are pure, yet cannot be identified through existing images. Each creation is guided by the imagination and fantasy of the artist’s spirit. Although his experience has been mostly self-taught, Germán has received basic preparatory training in visual art in which he learned drawing, abstract sculpture, and three-dimensional shapes.

At the moment, Germán has a studio dedicated to sculptures made of wood and stone, as well as his artistic paintings. He also produces and sells handicrafts such as lamps made of wood, parchment, and leather. For this reason, he is requesting a loan worth 1,500,000 COP to buy materials such as wooden blocks of different sizes, containers of oil-based paint, and chisels in different sizes. The works he will create will allow him to continue expressing his own style.

Germán dreams of consolidating his work and positioning himself for other opportunities, such as opening markets in Latin America and achieving recognition at a few galleries on a national level. His greatest challenge is getting access to professional education. He says the application and testing processes are difficult and do not correlate to his knowledge of the visual arts. German lives in an attractive neighborhood with a nice location that contains a view of the hills to inspire his imagination and develop his creative potential.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase materials such as wood blocks, oil-based paints, and chisels

loans.name: Celia

texts.es:
Nuestra socia  Celia, pertenece al banco comunal  “CAPAC QOYA”, nuestra socia está ubicada en el distrito de Coya- Pisac a 50 minutos de la ciudad del Cusco.

Nuestra socia tiene 77 años de edad Nuestra socia es viuda y tiene 8 hijos de los cuales ella tiene viviendo en su casa a su hijo el menor de ellos que tiene 53 años de edad, nuestra socia es una mujer muy cariñosa y dedicada a su hogar, ella tiene un espíritu optimista y es muy dulce, nuestra socia tiene su pequeño negocio en su casa, ella vende chicha de jora, es la bebida de los inkas, (elaborada a base de maíz fermentado), también la socia teje chompas muy lindas y las vende a sus amigas y a los parientes de sus amigas, nuestra socia solicita el préstamo para comprar maíz y lana para hacer chompas que tiene pedidas.

Nuestra socia agradece  la oportunidad brindada y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus diferentes cuotas en los plazos establecidos.
texts.en:
Celia is a member of the Communal Bank “Capac Qoya” and lives in the District of Coya-Pisac, which is located 50 minutes outside of the city of Cusco.

She is 77 years old, widowed, and has eight children. Celia lives in the home of her youngest son, who is 53 years old. She possesses an optimistic and extremely sweet spirit. She manages a small business from home selling “chicha de jora”, which is an Incan beverage made of fermented corn. Celia also knits beautiful sweaters and sells them to friends and their relatives. She is requesting a loan to buy corn and wool for making sweaters that have been requested.

Celia is grateful for this opportunity and promises to complete her payments on time.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase wool for knitting sweaters & corn for making "chicha"

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma A. is married and has two children. She has a junior high school education.  

She sells onions in large quantities at Elmina. She has been doing this for some time now.  Emma uses her income to help her husband in the payment of school fees and bills.  

Emma will use the loan to purchase more bags of onions to sell. She plans to save her new profits to reinvest into her expanded business.

loans.use: To purchase more bags of onions to sell.

loans.name: Esi

texts.en:
Esi A. is single and has five dependents. She has received a senior high school education.  

Esi sells plastic containers as a hawker (moving from place to place) at Elmina. She has been doing this for some time now.  Esi uses her income to pay school fees and utility bills.  

She will use the loan to purchase more plastic products for resale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Esi plans to further her children’s education.

loans.use: To purchase more plastic products for resale.

loans.name: Amanda

texts.en:
Amanda C. M. is a 47-year-old woman living in La Aurora, Heredia, located in the Central Valley of Costa Rica.

Amanda is involved in the income generating activity of renting out an apartment. She plans to use this loan to invest in the upkeep of her apartment by purchasing two electricity generators. An obstacle for Amanda has been an increase in competition which has forced her to search for clients in new areas.

Amanda’s life goal, in addition to the expansion of her business, is to learn English. She plans to take classes from the ¨Centro Canadiense¨ which translates as the Canadian Center, an organization offering in-house English classes.

Amanda is a very positive person who recognizes the importance of seizing each day and enjoying life to the fullest with her family.

loans.use: To purchase two electricity generators for an apartment

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary A. is married and has three children. She has received no formal education.  

Mary sells tomatoes, peppers, onions and so on at Elmina. She has been doing this for some time now. Her husband is a farmer.  Mary uses her income to help her husband in the payment of school fees and bills.  

She will use the loan to purchase more foodstuffs to sell. Mary plans to save the new profits from her expanded business to educate her children.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs to sell.

loans.name: Violetas 3 Group

texts.en:
Yane is the coordinator of her group Violetas (Violets), and her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients generally. (Many Haitians recently emigrated to the Dominican Republic.) Her group is located in Los Alcarrizos, a dusty, industrial area where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. She makes her home here in a simple structure with her husband and four children.

Yane is excited to be taking her third loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loan and grown her business. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business running a "fansasia (fantasy)" which is a sort of variety store for women and girls. She will invest in her business by purchasing skirts, underwear, jeans, stencils and arts and crafts supplies to sell in her store. She will use the profits to save towards sending her children to the university when they are of age. Yane thanks all of you for your support.

loans.use: To buy skirts, underwear, jeans, stencils, arts and crafts to sell

loans.name: Nana Adjoa

texts.en:
Nana adjoa E. sells smoked fish at Elmina. She has received no formal education. She is married and has four children. Her husband is a farmer. 

Nana adjoa has been selling smoked fish for some time now. She helps her husband pay school fees, bills and other family expenses. Her loan will be used to buy more fish to process (smoking the fish) for resale. She hopes to save the new profits from her business to educate her children.

loans.use: To buy more fish to process (smoking the fish) for resale.

loans.name: Isaac

texts.en:
Isaac B. repairs fans, blenders and other electrical appliances at Elmina.  He has been an electrical appliance repairman for some time now. 

He is married and has five dependents. His wife is a trader. He is responsible for paying school fees and utility bills. 

Isaac's loan will be used to buy electrical parts to aid him in his repair work. He hopes to save the new profits from his business for his children's education.

loans.use: To buy electrical parts to aid him in his repair work.

loans.name: Douglas Antonio

texts.es: Don Douglas tiene 50 años de edad, vive en el barrio Healeah, junto a su esposa e hijos, trabaja como conductor desde hace varios años en una empresa Mi Familia, lo cual ha mejorado su vivienda que ha sido lo primordial para lograr un techo digno, lo que desea hacer es envergar la parte de enfrente en donde tiene un muro que aun no ha terminado por completo por falta de capital, quiere levantar mas el muro y ponerle verjas. Ya que en el barrio hay mucha delincuencia lo cual cuando hay enfrentamiento con vagos las piedras llegan hasta adentro es por eso la necesidad de poder levantar mas la tapia para una mejor seguridad de su familia, lo cual agradece a la institución por hacer posible el financiamiento lo cual comprara materiales de construcción como: piedra, arena, cemento, soldadura, verjas y comenzar.
texts.en:
Don Douglas is 50 years old and lives in the neighborhood of Healeah with his wife and children. He has been working several years as driver for a business called “Mi Familia”. In order to improve his home, he wants to make it more dignified. He wants to complete the front part of his house where a wall currently exists, but he cannot finish it because of a lack of capital. He wants the wall raised so that he can install gates. There is already a lot of crime in the neighborhood and he has already had an encounter with vagrants trying to make their way inside. For this reason, he needs to have the wall raised so that he can provide better security for his family. Douglas thanks the Institution for making this possible by providing a loan that will be used to buy construction materials such as stone, sand, cement, welding supplies, and gates. The work can finally begin.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase construction materials for installing a security gate

loans.name: Anthony

texts.en:
Anthony B. is single and has one child. He has received a junior high education.

Anthony sells water; people buy with containers and he charges them for it per bucket or gallon. He then uses the income to pay the water bills. It is a good business for him and the people in his community since his pipe-borne water is the only good source of water in the area. He has been dong this for some time now. Anthony uses his income to pay school fees and other family expenses.

Anthony will use this loan to purchase a poly tank that will serve as a reservoir so that there will be constant water supply for his customers even when the tap stops flowing. With the new profits from his expanded business, Anthony plans to save to reinvest into the business.

loans.use: To purchase a poly tank to use a reservoir

loans.name: Lucia Evarista

texts.es:
La señora Lucia Evarista M. Matute está ubicado en la comarca sabana la villa municipio Achuapa donde se dedica a la actividad  ganadera por medio de la crianza de ganado.
Esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de una vaquilla y un semental para mejorar su hato ganadero y extraer la leche de la vaquilla para comercializarla y beneficiar a su familia.
texts.en:
Lucia is located in the savannah area of the Achuapa municipality, where she earns a living in livestock by raising cattle.

She is requesting a loan to buy a heifer and a stud to improve her heard and to milk the cow and sell it to benefit her family.

Translated from Spanish by Alison Hynd, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a heifer

loans.name: Mildred Maria

texts.es:
Mildred María P. es propietaria del negocio “Peluquería Unisex Mildred María” ubicado en el  barrio Abajo de Barranquilla, sector de gran tradición carnavalera pues allí surgió la comparsa más antigua de un disfraz insigne del Carnaval “La Marimonda”. Ella tiene un hijo de 21 años que estudia en la Universidad y es su máxima motivación que la lleva a dedicarse con esmero y profesionalismo en su trabajo como peluquera, esta actividad la inició tiempo después de haber estado empleada en una peluquería, donde adquirió gran parte de su experiencia que plasmó en un negocio propio y que hoy ha perfeccionando con estudios y actualización permanente.  
Para Mildred la peluquería es un buen negocio porque genera ingresos inmediatos y es el lugar donde puede expresar su vocación de servicio y ofrecer belleza, glamour e imagen a sus clientes en todas las edades; en su negocio  tiene una vitrina donde exhibe productos cosméticos que sus clientes requieren, como accesorios, champú, ganchos, tratamientos para cabellos. Este es su segundo crédito con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo y está solicitando $1.393.000 para comprar un computador que necesita tanto su hijo como su negocio, pues puede ayudarla a controlar sus cuentas. Con su anterior crédito compró una vitrina, modernizó su  plancha de cabellos y el resto lo invirtió en productos cosméticos que llenaron su nueva vitrina.
Su sueño más adelante es comprar su casa propia y convertir su peluquería en un centro de atención estética, por eso siempre está pendiente de los cursos que tiene el Sena y dispuesta a hacer los esfuerzos para actualizar sus conocimientos, porque ante los retos y las dificultades nunca se ha dado por vencida.
texts.en:
Mildred María P. is the owner of “Peluquería Unisex Mildred María” (Mildred María’s Unisex Salon), which is located in the neighborhood of Abajo de Barranquilla. This area is known for its great Carnival tradition and for being the birthplace of the oldest Carnival troupe that is known for its costumes of “La Marimonda” (a mythical monkey-like creature). Mildred has a 21 year old son who is a university student. He is the motivation that spurs her to work with great care and professionalism in her salon. She started this business after having been employed at another beauty parlor, where she gained most of the experience that she utilizes at her own establishment. Mildred continues to refine her skills through self-study and by modernizing her techniques.

A beauty salon is a good business for Mildred because it generates immediate revenue and gives her a place to demonstrate her commitment to service by offering beauty, glamour, and image advice to customers of all ages. In her business, Mildred also has display cases stocked with beauty products that her customers need such as accessories, shampoos, hair clips, and hair treatments. This is her second loan with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. She is requesting 1,393,000 COP in order to buy a computer for her son. Mildred will also use it to keep track of her business accounts. With her previous loan, she bought a display case, modern curling irons, and beauty products to fill her new display case.

To get ahead, Mildred dreams of buying a house and converting her salon into an aesthetics center. She is always looking for courses offered through SENA (the National Learning Service) so that she can update her knowledge. Mildred has never given up when faced with challenges and difficulties.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a computer

loans.name: Alexei

texts.en:
Alexei is married with two daughters. He raises vegetables--tomatoes and cucumbers--in greenhouses. Alexei has been in this business for 5 years. He has 5 greenhouses located in two different places in the village. This year he was able to rent another piece of land.

Alexei would like to build one more greenhouse to increase his revenue. He needs a loan of 10,000 UAH to purchase seeds and film to cover the new greenhouse. His wife and daughters help Alexei in this business, especially during spring season.

loans.use: To purchase film and seeds for a greenhouse

loans.name: David 3,4 Group

texts.en:
Charlot is the coordinator of her group, David, and her story is representative of her group and generally representative of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients, many of whom recently emigrated to the Dominican Republic from Haiti. Her group is located in the rural areas surrounding La Romana, a community where the economy centers around sugarcane cutting and where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. She makes her home here in a simple structure alone as a widow with grown children.

Charlot is excited to be taking her third loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loans and grown her business. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business of selling a variety of items. She will use the loan to purchase pants, shirts, perfumes, deodorants, and skin creams. She will use the profits to invest in her home by replacing the wooden walls with block walls. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: To buy pants, shirts, creams, deodorants, perfumes and underwear to sell
