loans.name: Margoth

texts.es: La Sra. Margoth vive en el Barrio San Martín de la localidad de El Torno, esta casada y tiene dos hijos  que se encuentra en edad escolar, su actividad es la venta de comida, donde vende almuerzos y tambien platos extras, su esposo se dedica al transporte, es chofer asalariado el destino del crédito solicitado es para invertirlo en su negocio, tiene domicilio propio, el cual le ha costado mucho tenerlo, y sus nuevas metas es llegar a tener un negocio de comida reconocido en la comunidad. Es una persona responsable y muy trabajadora, esta muy agradecida con Emprender y Kiva por la confianza brindada en la otorgacion del credito.
texts.en:
Sra. Margoth lives in the San Martín neighborhood of the town of El Torno. She is married and has two school age children. Her business is the sale of food. She sells lunches and small meals. Her husband is involved in transportation. He is a salaried driver.

The purpose of the loan applied for is to invest in her business. She has her own home which has cost a lot. Her new goal is to have a food business which is recognized in the community. She is a responsible and hardworking person and is very grateful to Emprender and Kiva for the confidence shown her in making the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Richard Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of food

loans.name: Angel Alberto

texts.es:
Ángel A. de 47 años, vive en una zona periurbana en Paraíso de Guayaquil, su casa es de cemento solo cuenta con luz y agua como servicio básico. Su esposa le ayuda en el restaurante con ella tiene 2 hijos.

Inicio el negocio de comidas hace 5 años atrás, junto con su esposa vendían almuerzos solo en las tardes. Poco a poco  compraron sillas y mesas.

Ahora el trabaja desde las 05h00 hasta las 23h00 todos los días, para hacer las comidas tiene que comprar pollo, carne, arroz, granos, verduras. Sus hijos en ocasiones les ayudan. La dificultad que tiene en su negocio  es la delincuencia del sector.

Con el préstamo quiere comprar sillas, mesas, arroz para su negocio. En el futuro quiere tener otro restaurante y que sus hijos sigan estudiando.
texts.en:
Ángel A. is 47 years old and lives in the periurban district of Paraíso in Guayaquil. His house is made of cement and only receives electricity and water and its only basic services. His wife helps him with managing their restaurant. They have two children.

He and his wife started their food business five years ago. Together they sell lunches, but only in the afternoons. Over time, they acquired tables and chairs. He how works from 5am until 11pm every day because he has to buy all the food needed to prepare the meals such as chicken, meat, rice, grains, and vegetables. His children help out occasionally. The main difficulty his business faces is the amount of crime in the area.

With this loan, he will buy another set of chairs and tables, as well as rice for his business. In the future, he wants to open another restaurant and see that his children stay in school.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase tables, chairs, and rice

loans.name: Clara

texts.es:
La Sra Clara vive por la zona de los lotes hace 2 años juntos con sus 2 hijos de 19 y 17 años de edad,  llego a nuestra institucion recomendada por su sobrina Yaneth, La Sra Clara se hace cargo sola de sus hijos los cuales ya trabajan, Ella cuenta con 2 vagonetas  a su nombre las cuales las hace trabajar y recibe una renta diaria de 100 bs por cada vehiculo con lo cual mantiene su hogar . La Sra Clara y sus hijos estan trabajando y ahorrando para poder comprarse una casa propia ya que el alquiler es dinero perdido. El dinero que en este momento requiere es para reparar una de sus vagonetas que se encuentra en el Taller mecanico.

Esta agradecida con Emprender y Kiva por la confianza brindada en la otorgacion del credito.
texts.en:
Clara has been living in the Los Lotes area on the outskirts of Santa Cruz for 2 years, along with her children who are 17 and 19. She heard about the Field Partner through her niece Yaneth, Clara cares for her children by herself, though both are working already. She owns two small station wagons, which she rents out as taxis. She receives a daily payment of 100 bolivianos for each vehicle, and she uses this money to cover her household expenses. Clara and her children are working and saving to buy their own house because their rent money is money lost to them. The money that Clara needs at the moment is to fix one of her wagons which is in a repair shop at the moment. Clara gives her thanks to Emprender [the Field Partner] and Kiva for the trust they have shown in her by giving her the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Catherine Fountain, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Vehicle maintenance

loans.name: Maria Nicolasa

texts.es:
Maria Nicolasa A. C. tiene 24 años de edad, es soltera, y vive con sus padres.  Tiene un hijo de 5 años y una hija de 2 años.

La socia es un miembro de la ventanilla rural "Mushuc Nan", la cual está en Quechua y en español significa "Camino Nuevo".  Es un grupo de 18 mujeres que trabajan en la agricultura.  Pertenecen a la comunidad de Guantug Cruz en el cantón de Guaranda.  Todas tienes buenas ganas de trabajar con créditos para poder salir adelante en su vida.

Maria es agricultora y siembra mora.  Vende el producto en la comunidad cuando vienen los comerciantes.  También cuenta con otros cultivos de maiz y papas y pollos para consumir.  Solicita el crédito para comprar abonos y liquidos para la mora.  Dice que la mora es dificil cultivar por el mantenimiento.

Su sueño es darles los estudios a sus hijos.  En sus tiempos libres, le gusta coser y ver tele.
texts.en:
Maria Nicolasa A. C. is 24 years old, single, and lives with her parents. She has a five year old son and a two year old daughter.

Maria is a member of the Communal Bank “Mushuc Nan”, which means “New Road” in Quechua. The group consists of 18 women who work in agriculture. They live in the community of Guantug Cruz in the canton of Guaranda. All of them have a great desire to work with credit so that they can get ahead in life.

Maria is a blackberry farmer. She sells her product in the community whenever the traders pass through town. Maria also grows other crops, such as corn and potatoes, and raises chickens for personal consumption. She is requesting a loan to buy composts and liquid fertilizers for her blackberry crop. According to Maria, this crop is difficult to cultivate because it requires significant maintenance.

Her dream is to provide her children with an education. In her spare time, she enjoys sewing and watching television.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase compost & liquid fertilizers for her blackberry crop

loans.name: Segunda Rosibel

texts.es:
En el municipio de Somotillo la señora Segunda S. Rosibel, se dedica a la producción de ganado bobino, porcino, y aviar también establece cultivos agrícolas como maíz, ajonjolí y sorgo los que destina para la mantención de sus hijos puesto que tiene tres.
La señora S.  ha dedicado la mayor parte de su vida a realizar estas actividades las cuales son su fuente de ingreso y sostén familiar.
El crédito solicitado será empleado en la compra de alambre para cerca ya que necesita mejorar un tramo de infraestructura de la finca.
texts.en:
In the town of Somotillo, Segunda S. Rosibel raises cattle. pigs and poultry. She also grows corn, sesame and sorghum. These are to support her three children. Mrs. S. has spent most of her life doing these activities and they are her source of income and support for her family. The loan she is asking for will be used to purchase wire for a fence since she needs to improve a part of the infrastructure of the farm.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of wire for a fence.

loans.name: Ana Dolores

texts.es:
Ana Dolores M. R. tiene 25 años, es casada y vive con su esposo y 3 hijos que se llaman Jessica Alexandra, Myra Enes, y Henry Joel.

La socia es un miembro de la ventanilla rural "Mushuc Nan", la cual está en Quechua y en español significa "Camino Nuevo".  Es un grupo de 18 mujeres que trabajan en la agricultura.  Pertenecen a la comunidad de Guantug Cruz en el cantón de Guaranda.  Todas tienes buenas ganas de trabajar con créditos para poder salir adelante en su vida.

Ana se dedica a la agricultura y tiene cultivos de mora, maiz, papas, y habas.  Hace las compras de las semillas y abonos de los distribuidores en Guaranda.  Vende la mora a los comerciantes en la comunidad misma y los otros cultivos en Guaranda.  Solicita el crédito para la mora para comprar abonos y remedios.

Su sueño es obtener terreno y que estudien sus hijos para que sean una profesion.
texts.en:
Ana Dolores M. R. is 25 years old and lives with her husband and three children: Jessica Alexandra, Myra Enes, and Henry Joel.

She is a member of the Communal Bank “Mushuc Nan”, which means “New Road” in Quechua. The group consists of 18 women who work in agriculture. They live in the community of Guantug Cruz in the canton of Guaranda. All of them have a great desire to work with credit so that they can get ahead in life.

Ana is a farmer who grows blackberries, corn, potatoes, and lima beans. She purchases her seeds and organic fertilizers from the distributors in Guaranda. The blackberries she produces are sold to merchants in her community, while her other crops are sold in Guaranda. The loan she is requesting will be used to buy compost and remedies for her blackberry crop.

Among her dreams are to obtain land and see her children pursue an education so that they can become professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase compost & remedies for her blackberry crop

loans.name: Ana Julia

texts.es:
En el municipio de El Sauce habita la Sra. Ana Julia quien se desempeña como Responsable de cocina en el Centro de Estudios donde tiene 23 años de laborar para este centro.
Está solicitando un crédito para hacer invertido en la compra de materiales de construcción tales como ladrillos, cemento, zinc y perlines para el mejoramiento de su vivienda con el objetivo de brindar a sus hijos un techo digno donde vivir.
texts.en:
Mrs. Ana Julia lives in the town of El Sauce. She is in charge of a kitchen in the Centro de Estudios. She has had this job in the center for 23 years. She is asking for a loan to invest in purchasing construction materials such as bricks, cement, zinc roofing and beams to improve her housing in order to offer her children a worthy place to live.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase bricks, beams and cement

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
Maria A. M. tiene 25 años, es casada, y vive con su marido y 3 hijos que se llaman Alex de 8 años, Mercy de 4 años, y Josely de 1.5 años.

La socia es un miembro de la ventanilla rural "Mushuc Nan", la cual está en Quechua y en español significa "Camino Nuevo".  Es un grupo de 18 mujeres que trabajan en la agricultura.  Pertenecen a la comunidad de Guantug Cruz en el cantón de Guaranda.  Todas tienes buenas ganas de trabajar con créditos para poder salir adelante en su vida.

Maria trabaja en la agricultura sembrando mora desde hace 10 años.  Vende la mora semanalmente en la comunidad. Su otra actividad economica es la crianza de animales, actualmente tiene gallinas y vacas.  También tiene cultivos de habas, papas, y maiz para consumir y para alimentación para los animales.  Solicita el crédito para comprar abonos, liquidos, y fertilizantes para mantener el cultivo.

Su sueño es tener una buena casa con terreno para cultivar.  Quiere también que sus hijos estudien y sean profesionales.
texts.en:
Maria A. M. is 25 years old, married, and lives with her husband and three children: Alex (age 8), Mercy (age 4) and Josely (age 1½).

She is a member of the Communal Bank “Mushuc Nan”, which means “New Road” in Quechua. The group consists of 18 women who work in agriculture. They live in the community of Guantug Cruz in the canton of Guaranda. All of them have a great desire to work with credit so that they can get ahead in life.

Maria has been growing blackberries for ten years. She sells the fruit on a weekly basis in her community. Maria also raises animals to earn income, which currently consists of chickens and cows. In addition, she grows lima beans, potatoes, and corn for personal consumption and to use as feed for her animals. She is requesting a loan in order to buy compost and liquid fertilizers to maintain her crops. Her dream is to own a nice house with land for farming. She also wants her children to pursue an education so that they can become professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase composts & fertilizers

loans.name: Saul

texts.es: El Señor  Saul tiene 25 años de edad actualmente vive en Santo Corazon, esta casado y tiene 3 hijos pequeños, el señor es cliente de emprender con sus ateriores creditos que saco a comprado una parcela donde vive y trabaja el siembra sorgo para hacer escobas, poroto y maiz donde el saca sus productos a vender al mercado central de El Torno. El solo mantiene el hogar ya que su esposa es ama de casa, El credito solicitado lo quiere para la siembra de papa un nuevo reto para el, el cliente esta agradecido con la institucion por su apoyo. Es una persona joven y trabajador responsable que paga sus cuotas puntualmente, Un Padre que quiere mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Saul is 25 years old and lives in Santo Corazon. He is married and has three children. He has had previous loans that he used to buy a parcel of land in the neighborhood, where he lives and works. He raises sorghum, to make brooms; and corn and beans, and sells his products in the central market in El Torno. He maintains his home himself, since his wife works as a housekeeper. He is asking for this loan in order to plant potatoes, a new venture for him. He is grateful to our institution for its support. He is a young, hard working man who pays his debts on time, and a father who wants a better life for his family.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Potato raising supplies

loans.name: Maria Soledad

texts.es:
Maria Soledad M. G. tiene 37 años y es casada.  Vive con su marido y sus 7 hijos de 1 año a 17 años de edad.

La socia es un miembro de la ventanilla rural "Mushuc Nan", la cual está en Quechua y en español significa "Camino Nuevo".  Es un grupo de 18 mujeres que trabajan en la agricultura.  Pertenecen a la comunidad de Guantug Cruz en el cantón de Guaranda.  Todas tienes buenas ganas de trabajar con créditos para poder salir adelante en su vida.

Maria trabaja en la agricultura sembrando mora, papas, maiz, habas, y quinua.  La mora vende semanalmente en la comunidad y el resto de los cultivos son para el consumo. También crece animales y tiene 5 vacas, 5 gallinas, y 5 cuyes.  Los animales vende en la plaza en Guaranda.  Además, tiene una pequeña tienda.  Su sueño es aumentar su tienda de viveres y que sus hijos estudien para que no trabajen en el campno.  El desafío principal que enfrenta es fumigar ya que no cuenta con el equipo necesario de protección.

Solicita el crédito para comprar abonos, liquidos, y fertilizantes para el cultivo de mora.
texts.en:
Maria Soledad M. G. is 37 years old and married. She lives with her husband and her seven children who range in age between 1 and 17 years.

She is a member of the Communal Bank “Mushuc Nan”, which means “New Road” in Quechua. The group consists of 18 women who work in agriculture. They live in the community of Guantug Cruz in the canton of Guaranda. All of them have a great desire to work with credit so that they can get ahead in life.

Maria is a farmer who grows blackberries, potatoes, corn, lima beans, and quinoa. She sells blackberries weekly in the community and the other crops are for personal consumption. Maria also raises animals and currently has five cows, five chickens, and five guinea pigs. The animals are sold at the town square in Guaranda. In addition, she has a small grocery store. Her dreams are to expand her shop and for her children to pursue an education so they do not have to work in the fields. The main problem she faces is having to fumigate her crops because she does not have the necessary protective gear.

The loan Maria is requesting will be used to buy compost and liquid fertilizers for her blackberry crop.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase compost & fertilizer

loans.name: Rodolfo

texts.es:
En el municipio de Somotillo, el señor Rodolfo N. se dedica a la producción agropecuaria, dentro de lo que desarrolla una serie de rubros tanto agrícolas como pecuarios y los que mas desarrolla son la crianza de ganado porcino, bovino y ovino también establece cultivos como son sandia, tomate, yuca, ayote, maíz, y algunos pepinos.

El señor Rodolfo se destaca por ser muy trabajador y la mayoría de su producción la comercializa en el mercado local y cuyos ingresos son utilizados para la mantención de su hogar y el estudio de sus hijos.

El crédito solicitado será empleado en la inversión agropecuaria en la compra de herramientas para la mejora de sus cercas de las fincas y animales y la compra de herramientas para mejorar el sistema de riego que posee en sus cultivos.
texts.en:
Rodolfo Antonio N. F.devotes himself to farming production in the Somotillo municipality. He does different work, as much agricultural as raising livestock. What he does the most is raise pigs, cattle, and sheep. He also grows crops like watermelon, tomato, yucca, squash, corn, and some cucumbers. Rodolfo Antonio F.works from six in the morning until one in the afternoon. He sells most of his production in the local market. His income is used to support his household and for his children’s education. The loan he is requesting will be used to improve his fences and to improve the watering system that he has.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Compra de herramientas para mejorar la cerca

loans.name: Maria Flor

texts.es:
Maria Flor S. S. tiene 46 años, es casada, y vive con su esposo y 2 de sus 7 hijos.  Sale uno de sus hijos en la foto.

La socia es un miembro de la ventanilla rural "Mushuc Nan", la cual está en Quechua y en español significa "Camino Nuevo".  Es un grupo de 18 mujeres que trabajan en la agricultura.  Pertenecen a la comunidad de Guantug Cruz en el cantón de Guaranda.  Todas tienes buenas ganas de trabajar con créditos para poder salir adelante en su vida.

Maria se dedica a la agricultura, sembrando mora, papas, maiz, frejol, y habas.  Vende la mora en la comunidad porque vienen unos comerciantes.  Siembra la mora todo el año pero más en el verano.  Solicita el préstamo para comprar abonos, liquidos, y remedios para la mora.

Quiere que estudien los hijos y que estén preparados.  Maria les da ella misma los estudios a sus hijos y es dificil porque le absorbe mucho tiempo.

En sus tiempos libres, le gusta leer y estudiar la Biblia para aprender la palabra de Dios.
texts.en:
Maria Flor S. S. is 46 years old. She is married and lives with her husband and two of her seven children. One of her children appears in the photo. She is a member of the rural service point "Mushuc Nan" which translates to "New Road". It is a group of 18 women that work in farming. They belong to the Guantug Cruz community in the Guaranda cantón (subdivision). They all are eager to work with loans in order to get ahead in their lives. Maria dedicates herself to farming. She plants blackberries, potatoes, corn, beans and lima beans. She sells the blackberries in the community to merchants. She plants the blackberries all year but does so more in the summer. She is requesting this loan to purchase fertilizer, liquids and remedies for the blackberries. She wants her children to study and to be trained. Maria herself teaches her children and she finds this difficult because it takes up a lot of her time. In her free time she likes to read and study the bible to learn the word of God.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Manzo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fertilizers, liquids and remedies for blackberries.

loans.name: Maria Fulgencia

texts.es:
Maria Fulgencia T. A. tiene 29 años y su estado civil es casada.  Vive con su esposo y 7 hijos.  El hijo menor tiene 10 meses y el mayor tiene 13 años.

La socia es un miembro de la ventanilla rural "Mushuc Nan", la cual está en Quechua y en español significa "Camino Nuevo".  Es un grupo de 18 mujeres que trabajan en la agricultura.  Pertenecen a la comunidad de Guantug Cruz en el cantón de Guaranda.  Todas tienes buenas ganas de trabajar con créditos para poder salir adelante en su vida.

Maria se dedica a la agricultura y siembra mora, papas, y maiz.  Sembraron el maiz en diciembre.  Hace las ventas de sus productos en la comunidad mismo cuando vienen los comerciantes. Tiene casi toda su vida en esta actividad y ayudaba a sus padres con los cultivos cuando era niña.  Solicita el préstamo para comprar abonos y remedios para el cultivo de mora.

Le gusta a Maria coser ropa para su familia y ver lo que está estudiando los hijos.
texts.en:
Maria Fulgencia T. A. is 29 years old and is married. She lives with her husband and her seven children. Her youngest son is 10 months old and the oldest is 13 years old. She is a member of the rural service point "Mushuc Nan" which translates to "New Road". It is a group of 18 women that work in farming. They belong to the Guantug Cruz community in the Guaranda cantón (subdivision). They all are eager to work with loans in order to get ahead in their lives. Maria dedicates herself to farming. She plants blackberries, potatoes and corn. She planted corn in December. She sells her products in the community when merchants come by. She has been doing this almost all of her life. She used to help her parents with the harvest when when she was a small girl. She is requesting a loan to purchase fertilizers and remedies for the blackberry harvest. Maria likes to sew clothing for her family and to follow what her children are studying.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Manzo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fertilizers and remedies for the blackberry harvest.

loans.name: Maria Hortencia

texts.es:
Maria Hortencia S. P. es casada y tiene 30 años de edad.  Vive con su esposo y tres hijos que se llaman Rosia (11 años), Jisella (8 años), y Kevin (6 años).  Salen dos de sus hijos en la foto.

La socia es un miembro de la ventanilla rural "Mushuc Nan", la cual está en Quechua y en español significa "Camino Nuevo".  Es un grupo de 18 mujeres que trabajan en la agricultura.  Pertenecen a la comunidad de Guantug Cruz en el cantón de Guaranda.  Todas tienes buenas ganas de trabajar con créditos para poder salir adelante en su vida.

Maria es agricultora y siembra mora y maiz.  La mora solo es para vender a los comerciantes que vienen a la comunidad.  Siembra un poco de maiz para comer.  Hace un año que sembró la mora y ya están grandotes.  Va a cosechar en 6 meses en el verano.  Normalmente, cosecha un año y medio después de la siembra.  Solicita el crédito para comprar liquidos para trabajar en mora.

Maria tiene muchos sueños en la vida, uno de ellos es que sus hijos estudien para que no trabajen con sus padres en el campo.

En sus tiempos libres, le gusta ver tele, coser, y tejer bufandas.
texts.en:
Maria Hortencia S. P. is married and 30 years old. She lives with her husband and three children, Rosia (11 years old), Jisella (8 years old) and Kevin (6 years old). Two of her children are pictured in the photo above. This partner is a member of the communal bank "Mushuc Nan," which is a Quechua term that means "New Path". It is a group of 18 woman who work in agriculture. They belong to the Guantug Cruz community in the canton of of Guaranda. All of them very much want to utilize the loans in order to get ahead in their lives. Maria is a farmer and plants blackberries and corn. She sells the blackberries to the merchants who come to the community. She plants a little bit of corn for food. She planted the blackberries one year ago, and they are already quite big. She is going to pick them in 6 months, in the summer. Normally, the harvest is a year and a half after the planting. She is requesting the loan in order to purchase fertilizer for the blackberries. Maria has many dreams for this life, one of which is that her children study so that they don't have to work with their parents in the fields. In her free time, she likes to watch TV, sew and knit scarves.

Translated from Spanish by Marni Siegal, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer for growing blackberries

loans.name: Maria Estefa

texts.es:
Maria Estefa A. C. tiene 30 años, es casada, y vive con su marido y 5 hijos.  La socia es un miembro de la ventanilla rural "Mushuc Nan", la cual está en Quechua y en español significa "Camino Nuevo".  Es un grupo de 18 mujeres que trabajan en la agricultura.  Pertenecen a la comunidad de Guantug Cruz en el cantón de Guaranda.  Todas tienes buenas ganas de trabajar con créditos para poder salir adelante en su vida.

Maria trabaja en la agricultura en el cultivo de la mora, papas, y maiz.  La mora vende en la comunidad y el resto de los cultivos son para consumir.  El desafío de trabajar en el campo son las fumigaciones porque no tienen los materiales de protección.

También se dedica a la crianza de animales como vacas, gallinas, y cuyes.  Vende las vacas en la plaza en Guaranda y los otros animales para el consumo.  Solicita el crédito para comprar abonos, liquidos, y fertilizantes para el cultivo de mora.

Su sueño para el futuro es que sus hijos estudien para que sean profesionales.
texts.en:
Maria Estefa A. C. is 30 years old and married. She lives with her husband and their five children. She is a member of the Mushuc Nan Communal Bank. In Quechua the name means New Road. This is a group of 18 women who work in agriculture. They belong to the Guantug Cruz community in the Guaranda canton. All of them have a lot of desire to work with loans to be able to get ahead in life. Maria works in agriculture growing blackberries, potatoes, and corn. She sells the blackberries in the community, and the rest of the crops are for personal consumption. The challenge of working in the fields is the fumigation because they do not have protective materials. She also raises animals like cows, chickens, and guinea pigs. She sells the cows in the plaza in Guaranda, and the other animals are for personal consumption. She is asking for a loan to buy compost and liquid fertilizers for the blackberry crop. Her dream for the future is that her children get an education and become professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy compost and liquid fertilizers

loans.name: Maria Andalisa

texts.es:
Maria Andalisa A. T. tiene 30 años, es casada, y vive con su esposo y 5 hijos de 4 a 11 años de edad.  Su marido sale en la foto.

La socia es un miembro de la ventanilla rural "Mushuc Nan", la cual está en Quechua y en español significa "Camino Nuevo".  Es un grupo de 18 mujeres que trabajan en la agricultura.  Pertenecen a la comunidad de Guantug Cruz en el cantón de Guaranda.  Todas tienes buenas ganas de trabajar con créditos para poder salir adelante en su vida.

Maria se dedica a la agricultura sembrando mora y papas.  Tiene otros cultivos que crece solo para el consumo.  Vende la mora en la comunidad cuando vienen los comerciantes.  Vende las papas en el mercado en Guaranda.  El mantenimiento de la mora es muy dura.  Se rasga las espinas y lastima demasiado.  Solicita el crédito para comprar abonos y liquidos para la mora.

Su sueño es que sus hijos estudien si es posible.  Tal vez tengan que trabajar en el campo con sus padres.  En los tiempos libres, le gusta tejer y coser.
texts.en:
Maria Andalisa A. T. is 30 years old. She is married and lives with her husband and her five children ages four to eleven. Her husband appears in the photo. She is a member of the rural service point "Mushuc Nan" which translates to "New Road". It is a group of 18 women that work in farming. They belong to the Guantug Cruz community in the Guaranda cantón (subdivision). They all are eager to work with loans in order to get ahead in their lives. Maria dedicates herself to farming. She plants blackberries and potatoes. She also has other crops which she grows for her own consumption. She sells the blackberries when merchants come by the community. She sells the potatoes at the market in Guaranda. The upkeep of blackberries is very difficult. The thorns tear and it is very painful. She is requesting this loan to purchase fertilizers and liquid manure for the blackberries. Maria's dream is that her children will go to school if it is possible. They may have to work in the fields like their parents. In her free time she likes to knit and sew.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Manzo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fertilizer and liquid manure.

loans.name: Sabana La Marino 1 Group

texts.en:
Sandra is the coordinator of her group, Sabana la Marino (Sabana the Sailor). Her story is representative of her group and generally representative of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients, many of whom recently emigrated to the Dominican Republic from Haiti. Her group is located in a coastal town in the province of Hato Mayor, where the economy is dominated by agriculture and fishing, and where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. She makes her home here in a simple structure with her long-term partner and their four children.

Sandra is excited to be taking her eighth loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loans and grown her business. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business of running a cafeteria by purchasing necessary supplies, such as beans, rice, cooking oil, meats, sugar and fruits. She will use the profits to invest in her short-term goal of improving the home she currently lives in by adding another room to better accommodate her children. She will also save towards her long-term goal of selling her current home and purchasing a larger one. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: To buy supplies for her cafeteria

loans.name: Mercedes Yolanda

texts.es:
Mercedes Yolanda A. M. tiene 21 años de edad, es casada, y vive con sus esposo y hijo de 3 años que se llama Edwin.

La socia es un miembro de la ventanilla rural "Mushuc Nan", la cual está en Quechua y en español significa "Camino Nuevo".  Es un grupo de 18 mujeres que trabajan en la agricultura.  Pertenecen a la comunidad de Guantug Cruz en el cantón de Guaranda.  Todas tienes buenas ganas de trabajar con créditos para poder salir adelante en su vida.

Mercedes se dedica a la agricultura como su fuente principal de ingresos, sembrando mora, papas, y maiz.  Vende la mora en mayores cantidades y los otros cultivos son para el consumo.  Tiene unos 10 gallinas que crece para consumir.

Solicita el crédito para comprar productos para la agricultura como abonos y liquidos.  Su esperanza principal es lograr tener más terreno y sacar su hijo del campo porque es muy duro y quiere que salga adelante.
texts.en:
Mercedes Yolanda A. M. is 21 years old, is married and lives with her husband and her 3-year old son Edwin. She belongs to the solidarity group “Mushuc Nan”, a Qechua name that means “Camino Nuevo” in Spanish (“New Road” in English). This is a group of 18 women that work in agriculture. They belong to the community of Guantug Cruz in the canton of Guaranda. They all have a strong desire to work with loans to get ahead in life. Mercedes works in agriculture which is her main source of income; she grows blackberries, potatoes and corn. She sells the blackberry wholesale, and the other crops as consumables. She has 10 hens that she grows for consumption. She is requesting the loan to buy agricultural products such as fertilizers and liquids. Her main hope is to have more land so she can bring her son out of the hard rural life and he can get ahead in life.

Translated from Spanish by Carlos Morales, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy agricultural products (fetilizers, liquids, etc.)

loans.name: Salome

texts.es: La Sra. Salome vive en la localidad  de la guardia, barrio monte alto, su actividad principal es el comercio, de tabaco, y otro productos dependiendo de la epoca, tambien emprendera  un negocio de abarrotes que tendra como ubicacion su propio domicilio, tiene hacer distintas actividades para incrementar sus ingresos para su familia, ya que es madre soltera y tiene 3 hijos que mantener, el padre de sus hijos no le ayuda suficiente como para sostenerlos, por tal motivo  ha solicitado credito con nuestra institucion por que es muy dificil tener su propio capital para trabajar por su cuenta. El dinero del credito lo utilizara en la compra de abarrotes para poder vender en su nueva tienda y asi poder incrementar su capital de trabajo, esta muy agradecida con Emprender y Kiva por la confianza brindada en la otorgacion del credito.
texts.en:
Salome lives in the town of La Guardia in the Monte Alto neighborhood. Her main activity is selling tobacco and other products, depending on the season. She will also undertake a business selling groceries, which will be in her house. She has to do different activities to increase the income for her family. She is a single mother with three children to support. The father of her children does not help enough to support them. That is the reason she is asking our institution for a loan. It is very difficult to have her own capital in order to work on her own. She will use the money from the loan to buy groceries to be able to sell in her new store. That way she will be able to increase her working capital. She is very grateful to Emprender and Kiva for the confidence given in granting the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase work capital

loans.name: Maria Mercedes

texts.es:
Maria Mercedes M. B. tiene 25 años, es casada, y vive con su esposo y hijo de 7 años que se llama William.

La socia es un miembro de la ventanilla rural "Mushuc Nan", la cual está en Quechua y en español significa "Camino Nuevo".  Es un grupo de 18 mujeres que trabajan en la agricultura.  Pertenecen a la comunidad de Guantug Cruz en el cantón de Guaranda.  Todas tienes buenas ganas de trabajar con créditos para poder salir adelante en su vida.

Maria es agricultora y siembra mora en mayores cantidades, y maiz y papas en menores cantidades.  Vende los productos semanalmente de su carro en las ferias de Guaranda.  Solicita el crédito para la mora para comprar abonos y liquidos.

Su sueño es que su hijo sea profesional y que tenga trabajo.  En sus tiempos libres, le gusta tejer.
texts.en:
Maria Mercedes M. B. is 25 years old, is married and lives with her husband and her 7-year old son William. She belongs to the solidarity group “Mushuc Nan”, a Qechua name that means “Camino Nuevo” in Spanish (“New Road” in English). This is a group of 18 women that work in agriculture. They belong to the community of Guantug Cruz in the canton of Guaranda. They all have a strong desire to work with loans to get ahead in life. Maria works in agriculture and she grows blackberries in big quantities plus corn and potatoes in smaller quantities. She sells her products weekly from a cart in the fairs of Guaranda. She is requesting the loan for her blackberry crop to buy fertilizers and liquids. Her dream is for her son to become a professional with a good job. She likes to knit in her free time.

Translated from Spanish by Carlos Morales, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy fertilizers and liquids

loans.name: Cecilia Alexandra

texts.es:
Cecilia Z. de 45 años, vive en una zona urbana en el Suburbio de Guayaquil, su casa es de cemento solo cuenta con luz y agua como servicio básico. Su esposo trabaja como chofer en una camaronera con el tiene 3 hijos.

Empezó hace 13 años solo vendiendo cuadernos. Cuando a su esposo lo liquidaron de la empresa donde trabajaba empezó en su casa de caña vendiendo cuadernos y plumas.  

Ahora ella tiene una casa de cemento y trabaja desde las 06h00 hasta las 22h00 todos los días. Vende cuadernos, bisutería, regalos, cartulinas etc. Una de las complicaciones que tiene es la delincuencia en el sector. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar cuadernos, plumas y bebidas para sus clientes. En el futuro quiere tener otra papelería.
texts.en:
Cecilia Z. is 45 years old and lives in a suburb of Guayquil. Her house is made of cement and has only lights and water for basic services. Her husband works as a driver for a shrimp producer, and together they have three children. 13 years ago Cecilia started just selling notebooks. When her husband was let go by his employer she started selling notebooks and pens from her house that was made from bamboo. She now owns a concrete house and works from 6 am to 10 pm every day. She sells notebooks, jewelry, gifts, postcards, etc. One of the challenges she faces is the crime in her neighborhood. Cecilia wants to purchase notebooks, pens, and soft drinks for her customers with the loan. In the future, she hopes to open another stationary shop.

Translated from Spanish by David Kaisel, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase notebooks, pens and drinks

loans.name: Mario

texts.es: En el municipio de somotillo, comarca la pavana, el señor Mario G. González, se dedica a la crianza de ganado bobino, porcino y aviar también establece cultivos agrícolas como maíz, ajonjolí y sorgo los que le proveen el sustento de sus cuatro hijas y su esposa quienes también le ayudan en los que haceres diarios, el trabaja de seis a doce del medio día, en conjunto con su familia, el crédito solicitado será empleado para la compra postes, alambre, herbicidas y contratar mano de obra para mejorar su finca la cual es su fuente de ingreso y sostén familiar.
texts.en:
Mario G. G.raises cattle, pigs, and birds in the Somotillo municipality in the La Pavana region. He also grows crops such as corn, sesame, and sorghum. This provides the support for his four daughters and his wife. They also help with the daily chores. He works with his family from six until twelve noon. The loan he is requesting will be used to buy posts, wire, herbicides, and to pay for labor to improve his farm. The farm is his source of income and the family’s means of support.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy posts, wire, and herbicides

loans.name: Maria Rosario

texts.es:
Maria Rosario S. R. tiene 41 años, su estado civil es divorciado, y vive con sus hijos.  Tiene 6 hijos de 4 a 23 años de edad.  Sale uno de sus hijos en la foto.

La socia es un miembro de la ventanilla rural "Mushuc Nan", la cual está en Quechua y en español significa "Camino Nuevo".  Es un grupo de 18 mujeres que trabajan en la agricultura.  Pertenecen a la comunidad de Guantug Cruz en el cantón de Guaranda.  Todas tienes buenas ganas de trabajar con créditos para poder salir adelante en su vida.

Maria mantiene cultivos de mora, hortalizas, habas, papas, y maiz.  También se dedica a la cría de animales menores como gallinas, ovejas, y cerdos.  Vende la mora semanalmente en la comunidad y los animales en la plaza de Guanujo cada 6 meses. Cuenta que el trabajo es muy dificil en invierno porque llueve mucho y el cultivo es complicado de trabajar. Solicita el crédito para la compra de abonos, liquidos, y fertilizantes.

Su sueño es hacer estudiar a los hijos para salir adelante.  Le gusta tejer y coser para hacer su propia ropa y para su familia.
texts.en:
Maria Rosario S. R. is 41 years old, divorced, and lives with her children. She has six children from 4 to 23 years old. One of her children is seen in the photo. Maria is a member of the group loan program "Mushuc Nan", a Quechua word which means "New Road" in Spanish. The group consists of 18 women who work in agriculture. They all belong to the community of Guantug Cruz, in the district of Guaranda. All of them have a strong desire to take out loans in order to further their lives. Maria grows blackberries, vegetables, beans, potatoes and corn. She also raises small livestock such as chickens, sheep and pigs. She sells the blackberries every week in her town, and sells her animals in the square in Guanujo every six months. She says that the work is very hard during the winter because heavy rain makes it difficult to work the crops. She is asking for a loan to purchase manure, pesticide and fertilizer. Her dream is for her children to study and get ahead in life. She enjoys knitting and sewing to make clothes for herself and her family.

Translated from Spanish by David Kaisel, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase manure, pesticides and fertilizer

loans.name: Alla

texts.en:
Alla is a widow. She has a small business located at the central market in Berdyansk town. Alla sells various types of products, including bakery items, tea and coffee, small home products, plastic bags, etc. Alla has been in this business for only two years. High demand for these kinds of products provides Alla with a stable business. Besides this, Alla is very polite and caring with her clients. She's got many repeated customers.

Alla would like to improve her business location. She would like a loan of 9,000 UAH. She believes that better business conditions will attract even more customers and increase her sales.

loans.use: To improve her business location

loans.name: Maria Petrona

texts.es:
Maria Petrona M. B. tiene 51 años, su estado civil es casada y vive con su marido y hijos.  Tiene 9 hijos de 10 a 32 años de edad.  Sale en la foto uno de sus hijos.

La socia es un miembro de la ventanilla rural "Mushuc Nan", la cual está en Quechua y en español significa "Camino Nuevo".  Es un grupo de 18 mujeres que trabajan en la agricultura.  Pertenecen a la comunidad de Guantug Cruz en el cantón de Guaranda.  Todas tienes buenas ganas de trabajar con créditos para poder salir adelante en su vida.

Maria es agricultora y siembra mora en mayores cantidades.  Siembra poquito habas, cebada, maiz, papa, col, y zanahoria para comer.  Ademas, crece gallinas para consumir y vender en el mercado en Guaranda.  Vende las gallinas cada año en Guaranda y vende la mora semanalmente en la comunidad. Solicita el crédito para comprar remedios, abonos, y palitos para la mora.

Su esperanza es que sus hijos estudien y consigan trabajo.  Se encuentra aprendiendo a leer y escribir en sus ratos libres.  Su hijo en la escuela le está ayudando a aprender.  Ella misma también asiste a una escuela para aprender y le dan deberes.
texts.en:
Maria Petrona M. B. is 51 years old, married, and lives with her husband and children. She has 9 children from 10 to 32 years old. One of her children is seen in the foto. She is a member of the rural loan group "Mushuc Nan", a Quechua phrase that means "New Road" in Spanish. The group consists of 18 women who work in agriculture. They all live in the community of Guantug Cruz in the district of Guaranda. Each of them has a strong desire to use the loans in order to further their lives. Maria is a farmer and plants large quantities of blackberries. She plants lesser amounts of beans, barley, corn, potatoes, cabbage and carrots to eat. In addition, she raises hens to eat and sell in the market in Guaranda. She sells the hens every year in Guaranda and sells the blackberries weekly in her community. She seeks a loan to purchase medicine, fertilizer, and stakes for the blackberries. Her hope is that her children are able to study and find work. She can be found learning to read and write during her spare moments. Her son at school is helping her to study. She herself helps out at a school to learn and make a contribution.

Translated from Spanish by David Kaisel, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy medecines, fertilizer and stakes for blackberries.

loans.name: Mujeres Solidarias 7 Group

texts.en: Johanny plans to use this loan to invest in her beauty salon by purchasing a hair dryer as well as a line of hair products to sell to her clients. She is the coordinator of her group Mujeres Solidarias ("Women in Solidarity"), and her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients (many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti) generally. Her group is located in the rural area surrounding Hato Mayor where the economy focuses around agriculture and where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. She makes her home here in a simple rented structure with her long-term partner and their four children. Johanny is excited to be taking out her sixth loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loan and grown her business. She will use the profits to invest in adding electrical service to her home as well as saving towards her long-term goal of owning her own home. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: To buy hair products and a hair dryer

loans.name: Zoila Rosa

texts.es:
Zoila Rosa M. G. tiene 36 años y vive con su esposo y hijos.  Tiene 4 hijos, 3 varones y una mujer.  Sale uno de sus hijos en la foto.

La socia es un miembro de la ventanilla rural "Mushuc Nan", la cual está en Quechua y en español significa "Camino Nuevo".  Es un grupo de 18 mujeres que trabajan en la agricultura.  Pertenecen a la comunidad de Guantug Cruz en el cantón de Guaranda.  Todas tienes buenas ganas de trabajar con créditos para poder salir adelante en su vida.

Zoila se dedica a la agricultura sembrando mora, papas, y maiz.  Tiene un chancho también para vender cuando se gorde.  Va a vender el chancho en la plaza en Guaranda.  Solicita el crédito para trabajar en la mora en la compra de liquidos y remedios.

Quiere que sus hijos hagan algo en la vida y sean una profesión, porque desea que ellos no sufran como ellos ya que trabajar en el campo es bien duro.  Le gustaría viajar a otros paises si es una posibilidad.
texts.en:
Zoila Rosa M. G. is 36 years old and lives with her husband and children. She has 4 children, 3 boys and 1 girl. One of her sons is shown in the picture. She belongs to the solidarity group “Mushuc Nan”, a Qechua name that means “Camino Nuevo” in Spanish (“New Road” in English). This is a group of 18 women that work in agriculture. They belong to the community of Guantug Cruz in the canton of Guaranda. They all have a strong desire to work with loans to get ahead in life. Zoila works in agriculture growing blackberries, potatoes and corn. She has a pig to sale when it fattens up. She will sell the pig in the main square market of Guaranda. She is requesting the loan to work on her blackberry crop and buy liquids and pesticides. She wants her children to do something in life and become professionals; she does not want them to suffer since farm work is very hard. She would like to travel to other countries if it becomes feasible.

Translated from Spanish by Carlos Morales, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy liquids and pesticides to work on blackberry crop

loans.name: Enrique

texts.es: El Señor Enrique nacio el 16 de julio de 1971 en la provincia Carrasco, aproximadamente hace dos años que vive en al barrio Evo Morales el la Localidad de Limoncito el señor tiene sus tierras en la comunidad los Amarillos a 20 kilometros de la carretera entrando por la localidad de Limoncito. El Cliente trabaja con su esposa en la agricultura, el credito solicitado es para la siembra de papa por las epocas que se avecinan, tiene 3 hijos pequeños que se encuentran el edad escolar, el Sr. Enrique es una persona trabajadora y responsable que desea sacar a su familia adelante y mejorar su calidad de vida, esta agradecido con Emprender y Kiva por la confianza brindada en la otorgacion del credito.
texts.en:
Señor Enrique was born on July 16, 1971, in the Carrasco province. He has lived in the Evo Morales neighborhood of the town of Limoncito for about two years. His lands are in the community of Amarillos, about 20 kilometers by road from the town of Limoncito. The client (Enrique) works in agriculture with his wife. The loan he has applied for is for planting potatoes for the coming season. He has three small children who are of school age. Señor Enrique is a hard-working and responsible person who wants to advance his family and improve their quality of life. He is grateful to Emprender and Kiva for the confidence offered in the granting of credit.

Translated from Spanish by Pam McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy seeds to plant potatoes

loans.name: Feliciana Rumiana

texts.es:
Feliciana Rumiana R. M. tiene 46 años y es madre soltera.  Vive con sus 4 hijos que se llaman Angel Pedro de 22 años, Segundo Julian de 12 años, Holgo Piedad de 9 años, y Nancy Veronica de 6 años.

La socia es un miembro de la ventanilla rural "Mushuc Nan", la cual está en Quechua y en español significa "Camino Nuevo".  Es un grupo de 18 mujeres que trabajan en la agricultura.  Pertenecen a la comunidad de Guantug Cruz en el cantón de Guaranda.  Todas tienes buenas ganas de trabajar con créditos para poder salir adelante en su vida.

Feliciana trabaja en el cultivo de mora desde hace unos 20 años atras y siembra mora, maiz, papas, y mellocos.  La mora vende en la comunidad, el resto de los cultivos para el consumo y vende en el mercado en Guaranda.  Solicita el crédito para la compra de abonos, liquidos de fumigación, y fertilizantes.

Su sueño para el futuro es aumentar su terreno.  En sus tiempos libres, le gusta coser ropa y ver tele.
texts.en:
Feliciana Rumiana R. M. is 46 years old and is a single mother. She lives with her 4 children: Angel Pedro is 22, Segundo Julian is 12, Holgo Piedad is 9, and Nancy Veronica is 6. She belongs to the solidarity group “Mushuc Nan”, a Qechua name that means “Camino Nuevo” in Spanish (“New Road” in English). This is a group of 18 women that work in agriculture. They belong to the community of Guantug Cruz in the canton of Guaranda. They all have a strong desire to work with loans to get ahead in life. She has been growing blackberries for 20 years now; she grows blackberries, corn, potatoes and mellocos (a plant grown primarily as a root vegetable, secondarily as a leaf vegetable; it can be cooked like a potato). She sells the blackberry in the community, the rest of the crops are for consumption and sale at market in Guaranda. She is requesting the loan to buy organic and chemical fertilizers plus liquid pesticides to fumigate. Her dream is to have more land in the future. In her free time, she likes to sew and watch TV.

Translated from Spanish by Carlos Morales, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy organic and chemical fertilizers plus liquid pesticides to fumigate.

loans.name: Maria Angelita

texts.es:
Maria Angelita R. R. tiene 32 años de edad, es casada, y vive con su esposo y hijos en su casa propia de madera.  Tienen 5 hijos de 1 año a 11 años de edad.  Sale su marido en la foto.

La socia es un miembro de la ventanilla rural "Mushuc Nan", la cual está en Quechua y en español significa "Camino Nuevo".  Es un grupo de 18 mujeres que trabajan en la agricultura.  Pertenecen a la comunidad de Guantug Cruz en el cantón de Guaranda.  Todas tienes buenas ganas de trabajar con créditos para poder salir adelante en su vida.

Maria siembra papas y mora.  Vende la mora en la comunidad cuando vienen los comerciantes.  Le gusta mucho trabajar en el campo y sembrar la mora.  Solicita el crédito para la mora en la compra de abonos y otros insumos agrícolas.

Su sueño es que estudien los hijos.  En sus tiempos libres, le gusta coser sueteres, abrigos, bufandas, y otra ropa.
texts.en:
Maria Angelita R. R. is 32 years old, is married, and lives with her husband and children in her own home. She has five children ages 1-11. Her husband is in the picture. Maria Angelita is a member of the communal bank "Mushuc Nan," which in Quechua means "new path." The bank has 18 members, all women who work in the field of agriculture. They come from the community of Guantug Cruz in the canton of Guaranda. All the members have the desire to take out loans to improve their lives. Maria plants potatoes and blackberries. She sells the blackberries around town when purchasers come. She really likes working in the fields and planting blackberries. She is requesting her loan to buy fertilizers and other farming supplies. Maria's dream is for her children to get an education. In her free time, Maria loves to make sweaters, coats, scarves, and other clothing items.

Translated from Spanish by Violeta Rubiani, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying fertilizer and other farming supplies

loans.name: Juanita Damaris

texts.es: La señora Juanita Damaris D. es una clienta con 2 años de experiencia con esta institución, donde se le ha financiado para la compra de ganado. En este caso esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de 4 novillos con el objetivo de generar ingresos al final del periodo de invierno y por ende mejorar la economía familiar.
texts.en:
Señora Juanita Damaris D. is a client with two years of experience with this institution, where she has been financed for the purchase of livestock. In this case, she is applying for a loan for the purchase of four young bulls, with the goal of generating income at the end of the rainy season and therefore improving the family economy.

Translated from Spanish by Pam McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy bulls for pasturing

loans.name: Gloria Piedad

texts.es:
Gloria Piedad M. S. tiene 19 años y su estado civil es casada.  Vive con su esposo y hijo Elkin Jeremi de 3 años.

La socia es un miembro de la ventanilla rural "Mushuc Nan", la cual está en Quechua y en español significa "Camino Nuevo".  Es un grupo de 18 mujeres que trabajan en la agricultura.  Pertenecen a la comunidad de Guantug Cruz en el cantón de Guaranda.  Todas tienes buenas ganas de trabajar con créditos para poder salir adelante en su vida.

Gloria trabaja en el cultivo de mora, papas, maiz y en la crianza de gallinas y cerdos.  La mora vende en la comunidad a los comerciantes que vienen y los otros cultivos son para el consumo.  Solicita el crédito para comprar una vaca.  Piensa crecer la vaca y luego la vende en la ciudad de Guanujo.

Su sueño es dar el estudio a los hijos y comprar terrero para el cultivo.  En sus ratos libres le gusta tejer bufandas, leer libros, y oir música.
texts.en:
Gloria Piedad M. S. is 19 years old and is married. She lives with her husband and her 3-year-old son, Elkin Jeremi. Gloria is a member of the communal bank "Mushuc Nan," which in Quechua means "new path." The bank has 18 members, all of whom are women who work in the field of agriculture. They come from the community of Guantug Cruz in the canton of Guaranda. All members have the desire to take out loans to improve their lives. Gloria plants blackberries, potatoes and corn, and raises chickens and pigs. She sells the blackberries to the purchasers who come into town; the other crops are for her own use. She requests the loan to buy a cow, which she wants to fatten and then sell in the town of Guanujo. Her dream is to give her children a good education and to buy land for planting. In her free time, Gloria likes to knit scarves, read books, and listen to music.

Translated from Spanish by Violeta Rubiani, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying a cow

loans.name: Maria Aurora

texts.es:
Maria Aurora M. P. tiene 30 años de edad y es casada.  Vive con su esposo y 5 hijos.

La socia es un miembro de la ventanilla rural "Mushuc Nan", la cual está en Quechua y en español significa "Camino Nuevo".  Es un grupo de 18 mujeres que trabajan en la agricultura.  Pertenecen a la comunidad de Guantug Cruz en el cantón de Guaranda.  Todas tienes buenas ganas de trabajar con créditos para poder salir adelante en su vida.

Maria es agricultora y siembra mora y pocos papas y maiz.  Siembra todo el año con el fin de mantener a sus hijos.  Cultivar la mora es duro porque la lancha afecta los cultivos por las lluvias.  Vende la mora a los comerciantes que vienen a la comunidad.  Solicita el crédito para la mora en la compra de abonos y liquidos.

Su esperanza para el futuro es lograr tener su casita propia y que estudien los hijos.
texts.en:
Maria Aurora M. P. is 30 years old, is married, and lives with her husband and five children. Maria Aurora is a member of the communal bank "Mushuc Nan," which in Quechua means "new path." The bank has 18 members, all of whom are women who work in the field of agriculture. They come from the community of Guantug Cruz in the canton of Guaranda. All members have the desire to take out loans to improve their lives. Maria plants blackberries and some potatoes and corn. She plants all year in order to support her children. Planting blackberries is difficult because after it rains, the "lancha" fungus affects the crops. Maria sells the blackberries to the purchasers who come into town. She is requesting this loan to buy liquid fertilizer for her blackberries. Maria's hope for the future is to buy a little house for herself and to give her children an education.

Translated from Spanish by Violeta Rubiani, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying fertilizer

loans.name: Pablo

texts.es: EL SR. PABLO ESTA CASADO Y TIENE HIJOS MAYORES EL CREDITO QUE SOLICITA EL SR. PABLO ES PARA LA ESPOSA QUIEN SE DEDICA A VENTA DE COMIDA EN ACHUMANI SU ESPOSO LE AYUDA CON LA VENTA DE COMIDA, ACTIVIDAD QUE SE EVALUA ,YA QUE LA SEÑORA NO PUDE ACCEDER A UN CREDITO POR SER DE EDAD AVANZADA, CON ESTA ACTIVIDAD MANTIENEN A SU HOGAR Y DEMOSTRARON TODO ESTE TIEMPO RESPONSABILIDAD Y PUNTUALIDAD EN SUS PAGOS PESE A LOS SEÑORES YA SON DE EDAD AVANZADA PERO AUN SE LES NOTA CON MUCHA FUERZA, ES POR ESO QUE SE DECIDIO DARLES LA TAZA KIVA.  EL DINERO DEL CREDITO SERA UTILIZADO EN TRAMITES PARA SU DOMICILIO, ESTA MUY AGRADECIDO COM EMPRENDER Y KIVA POR LA CONFIANZA BRINDADA EN LA OTORGACION DEL CREDITO.
texts.en:
Sr. Pablo is married and has grown children. The loan he is applying for is for his wife, who sells food in Achumani, since she cannot consent to a loan because she is of advanced age. Her husband helps her with the sale of food, the business activity that is being evaluated. With this activity, they maintain their home, and they have always showed responsibility and punctuality in their payments, in spite of their being of advanced age. But it's clear that they still have much strength, and it was for this reason that it was decided to give them the Kiva rate. The loan money will be used for the formalities for their home. Sr. Pablo is very grateful to Emprender and Kiva for the confidence shown in granting the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Pam McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Correcting the documents for their home

loans.name: Daniel Bolivar

texts.en:
Mr. Daniel Bolivar is 58 and married. He and his wife live in a cement home in Guayaquil with all the basic services. He started a small store in his home 10 years ago and has continued to grow the store over the years. Now, he and his wife also bake and sell fresh bread in the store.

Daniel and his wife work everyday from 5:00 am to 10:00 pm. They have five children together with ages ranging from 10 to 30. The two youngest children live at home and attend school. The youngest wants to be a doctor. One difficulty of their business is that the suppliers won`t deliver merchandise to their home because it is not in a safe neighborhood and because of the delinquency rate in the area.

With the loan, Daniel is planning to buy broken washing machines, refrigerators, etc. that he will fix and then re-sell in his store for a profit. He would love to give his daughter the opportunity to be a doctor someday.

loans.use: To buy broken washers, refrigerators, etc. to fix

loans.name: Silvia Monserrath

texts.es:
El banco comunal Divino Niño Jesús lo conforma un grupo de mujeres muy alegres, luchadoras y carismáticas que buscan en el día a día la superación personal, familiar y en sus  trabajos siempre con optimismo  y visión de un mejor presente y futuro para todo los miembros de sus  familias, éste banco se encuentra en la ciudad de Cuenca tercera ciudad más importante del Ecuador ubicada en el centro sur del país que goza de clima frío permitiendo a su población dedicarse al cultivo de diferentes frutas y legumbres  para abastecer tanto su mercado local como para el resto del país.  

Silvia al igual que las otras socias vive en la urbe cuencana en casa  de una hermana  con sus tres hijos de 24, 14 años y su bebe de apenas cuatro meses de nacido, es madre soltera y  su hija mayor trabaja como secretaria en una empresa y le ayuda económicamente con los gastos del hogar,  el padre también aporta con algo para sus hijos.

Lleva seis ciclos  como socia del banco comunal Divino Niño Jesús y se caracteriza por ser una mujer muy  alegre y carismática, es comerciante  al por mayor de arroz, ropa y artículos para bazar, también vende al  detalle a sus vecinos, conocidos y cuando hace cobertura en la ciudad  en el vehículo de un familiar, toda la mercadería la adquiere en Guayaquil a los mayoristas.

Con el dinero de su crédito va a adquirir  arroz por quintales, pantalones, camisas, blusas, faldas, ropa interior para damas, caballeros y niños por mayor, su mayor sueño es llegar a tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
The "Divine Child Jesus" communal bank is conformed by a very happy, fighting and charismatic group of women who look for personal, family and work improvement every day with optimism and a vision of a better present and future for all the members of their families. This bank is located in the City of Cuenca, the third largest city in Ecuador, in the south central part of the country where they enjoy cold weather that allows them to devote themselves to the farming of different fruits and vegetables to supply both their local market and the rest of the country. Just like the rest of the partners, Silvia lives in the city of Cuenca in her sister's home with her three children of 24, 14 and 4 month old baby. She is a single mother. Her oldest daughter works as a secretary in a company and helps her financially with the expenses of the home. The father also helps out with some money for the children. She's been a partner of the "Divine Child Jesus" communal bank for six cycles and she is characterized as being a very happy and charismatic woman. She is a wholesale trader of rice, clothing, bazaar articles and also sells retail to her neighbors and people that she knows, and when she goes into the city in the vehicle of a relative, she purchases all of her merchandise in Guayaquil from wholesalers. With the proceeds from this loan she will purchase rice, pants, shirts, skirts, and underwear for women, men and children in bulk. Her dream is to one day own her own home.

Translated from Spanish by Esteban Riojas, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase rice, pants, shirts, skirts, and underwear for women, men and children in bulk

loans.name: Juan Luis

texts.es:
EL señor Juan Luis retorna desde el año 2007 para sacar un segundo credito pero actualmente trabajo como codeudor de la señora Nayda, el señor Juan se dedia a la compra (rescate) de antiguedades para luego restaurarlas o simplemente venderlas en su estado actual, para esto el señor va a la feria e El Alto, la feria de Oruro y tambien tienen contactos que le proveen de estos productos, el cliente tambien genera otros ingresos por venta de plateria ya sea como antiguedades o marcos de plata Peruanos que trae del vecino  Pais, es para esto que el cliente solicita este credito ya que tiene unas cuentas por pagar a sus proveedores de marcos para cuadros que le fueron entregados dias atras.

Esta agradecido con Emprender y Kiva por la confianza brindada en la otorgacion de credito.
texts.en:
Señor Juan Luis is returning from the year 2007 to take out a second loan. Now he works as a co-debtor with Señora Nayda. Señor Juan buys (rescues) antiquities to later restore them or simply sell them in their present condition. For this, he goes to the fair at El Alto, the fair at Oruro, and he also has contacts who provide him with these products. The client (Señor Juan) also generates income through the sale of silver such as antiquities or frames of Peruvian silver that he brings from the neighboring country. It is for this that he is applying for the loan, since he has some bills to pay to his suppliers of picture frames, which they delivered to him some days ago. He is grateful to Emprender and Kiva for the confidence shown in the granting of the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Pam McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase working capital

loans.name: Mauricio Yovani

texts.es:
Mauricio M. de  43 años, vive en una zona periurbana en Paraíso de Guayaquil, su casa es de cemento solo cuenta con luz y agua como servicio básico. Su esposa trabaja en una carreta a las afuera de su casa. 

La papelería la heredo de sus padres y desde entonces Mauricio y su esposa la han surtido con productos comestibles.

Ahora el tiene una papelería muy surtida con bebidas, cuadernos, laminas, cartulinas, etc. Tambien vende productos comestibles. Trabaja desde las 07h00 hasta las 21h00 todos los días. Una de las complicaciones que tiene es la delincuencia en el sector. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar cuadernos, plumas y más bebidas para sus clientes. En el futuro quiere dar a crédito lo que vende.
texts.en:
Mauricio M. is 43 years old and lives in a suburb of Paraiso de Guayaquil. His home is made of cement and only has electricity and water as basic services. His wife works with a cart just outside their house. He inherited his office supply store from his parents, and he and his wife took the initiative to stock it with food. Now he has a well stocked store with drinks, notebooks, paper, card stock, etc. He works from 7 am to 9 pm every day. One of his difficulties is the crime rate in the sector. With this loan he wants to purchase notebooks, pens, and more drinks for his customers. In the future he wants to be able to sell his products on credit.

Translated from Spanish by Esteban Riojas, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Notebooks, pens, paper, pencils

loans.name: Imelda

texts.es:
En el municipio del Sauce en Achuapa, La señora Imelda M. M. se dedica a atender su pulpería que posee desde hace 7 años.
Está solicitando un crédito para la compra de productos tales como azúcar, arroz, frijoles, etc. Con el crédito obtiene más ingreso para el desarrollo de su familia.
texts.en:
In the town of Sauce in Achuapa, Señora Imelda M. M. tends to her general store, which she has had for 7 years. She is applying for a loan to purchase products such as sugar, rice, beans, etc. With the loan, she will obtain greater income for the advancement of her family.

Translated from Spanish by Pam McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy products for her store

loans.name: Antonia

texts.es:
Nuestra socia  Antonia, pertenece al banco comunal  “CAPAC QOYA”, nuestra socia está ubicada en el distrito de Coya- Pisac a 50 minutos de la ciudad del Cusco.

Nuestra socia tiene 52 años de edad y es casada la socia tiene 1 hijo de 33 años de edad, nuestra socia es profesora de profesión, nuestra socia alterna sus actividades del hogar con el comercio minorista, nuestra socia cría pollos y los vende, La socia  ahora que esta retirada de la docencia se dedica íntegramente a la crianza de pollos, para luego de engordarlos venderlos al por mayor y menor, Nuestra socia solicita el préstamo para comprar pollos.

Nuestra socia agradece  la oportunidad brindada y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus diferentes cuotas en los plazos establecidos.
texts.en:
Antonia belongs to the Communal Bank "Capac Quoya". She lives in the Coya-Pisac district, 50 minutes away from the city of Cusco. She is 52 years old and she is married. She has one son, 33 years old. She is a teacher. She alternates her homemaking activities with retail sales. She raises chickens and sells them. She is now retired from teaching so she works full-time at raising chickens and, after fattening them, selling them. She asks for the loan to buy chickens. She is grateful for the opportunity that she is being offered and she is committed to fulfilling all the repayment terms punctually.

Translated from Spanish by Cecilia Piris, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of chickens

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth G. V. is a 56-year-old mother who lives with her family in Heredia, located in the central valley of Costa Rica. She manages a restaurant named ¨Soda Escuela Rafael Moya¨ which translates roughly as “The Restaurant of the Rafael Moya School”.

Elizabeth has dedicated the last ten years of her life to working hard, from 7 a.m. to 8 p.m., Monday to Friday, and from 8 a.m. to 3 p.m. on Saturdays. She is dedicated to the success of her business. In a good month, Elizabeth expects to earn 2,000,000 colons, in a bad month, only 1,500,000.

As a result of the success the restaurant has enjoyed, Elizabeth has been able to hire three employees. In this way, she has independently created work for herself and others in her community. Elizabeth says that a challenge in running her business has been coping with thieves.

Elizabeth prepares food for school children, but she also sells candies. She plans to use this loan to make general investments in restaurant inventory which will help her to offer high quality products to her clients.

Elizabeth hopes to be able to earn enough money one day to purchase a house for her children. Elizabeth also aspires to be the owner of a restaurant; presently she rents the space the restaurant occupies.

loans.use: To purchase restaurant inventory

loans.name: Fe En Dios 1,2 Group

texts.en: Hilda plans to use this loan to invest in her business selling underwear by purchasing brassieres, panties and pantyhose to sell. She is the coordinator of her group Fe en Dios ("Faith in God") and her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients (many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti) generally. Her group is located in Samana, a lush rugged peninsula with a nascent tourism industry, where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. She makes her home here in a simple structure as a single mother with her one child. Hilda is excited to be taking her first loan with Esperanza and having the opportunity to access capital at low interest rates. She will use the profits to purchase food and school supplies as well as a computer for her child. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: To buy panties, bras and pantyhose to sell

loans.name: Patricia

texts.es:
La Sra. Patricia tiene como actividad la venta de cosmeticos, perfumes y joyas por catalogo en distintos lugares de nuestra ciudad, esta atividad que realiza es un apoyo al ingreso de su familia, la misma  que esta compuesta por su esposo y sus dos hijos, ayudando de esta manera al sustento de su familia, el destino del credito es para comprar mercaderia de temporada (perfumes y cosmeticos), ya que los mismos estan de oferta para luego venderlos al precio original y tener buenas ganancias, unos de sus deseos es de tener una casa propia  y de ver a sus hijos profesionales.

la Sra. Pattricia esta muy agradecida con Emprender y Kiva por la confianza brindada en la otorgacion del credito.
texts.en:
Patricia sells Cosmetics, perfumes and jewelry from a catalog in various places around our city. This helps provide an income and support for her family, which includes her husband and two children. She will use the money from this loan to buy seasonal merchandise (perfume and cosmetics), now that they are available at a discount, and sell them at the regular price. This will provide a good profit. She hopes to have her own home one day and to see her children become professionals. Patricia is very grateful to Emprender and Kiva for the trust they have given in providing this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Inventory

loans.name: Mariano

texts.es: El Sr. Mariano nacido el 2 de junio en Villa Barrientos en 1980 casado con doña flora y con un hijo pequeño, el trabaja de agricultor en su propia parcela en cañada sthrogers hace 11 años, en la cual siembra yuca, maiz, y sorgo para hacer escoba y todo lo que produce el saca ha vender al mercado de el torno, es una persona responsable y trabajadora que saca a su familia adelante, esta  muy agradecida con Emprender y Kiva por la confianza brindada en la otorgacion del credito.
texts.en:
Mariano was born in Villa Barrientos on July 2, 1980. He is married to Flora and has a young son. He has been working as a farmer on his own land for 11 years, where he raises yucca, corn, and sorghum to make brooms and sells everything in the Torno market. He is a very responsible person who works hard to get his family ahead. He is very grateful to Emprendedor and Kiva for the trust given him by granting this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy wire (fence)

loans.name: Angelica Maria

texts.es: Angélica Maria tiene su actividad económica que es la venta de tortillas. Hace más de 3 años, que se dedica a este negocio por lo que tiene sus 2 hijos menores de edad de 6 y 10 años respectivamente. Ella comenzó una pequeña cantidad de maíz, por lo que es en su casa en donde realiza todas sus labores como la elaboración de tortillas, cuidar a sus hijos y ayudarle en sus tareas escolares. Es una mujer muy abnegada y responsable ella solicita este financiamiento para la compra de materia prima maíz, bolsas plásticas, cal y leña. Su deseo es que sus hijos logren finalizar sus estudios.
texts.en:
Angélica María works selling tortillas. She has been in this business for more than 3 years, as she has two young children who are 6 and 10, respectively. She began with little, which is why she completes her work such as making tortillas at home, caring for her children and helping them with their schoolwork. She is a very selfless and responsible work and she is requesting this loan for the purchase of raw material such as corn, plastic bags, lime, and firewood. Her wish is for her children to finish their studies.

Translated from Spanish by Kathleen O'Connell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Agueda María

texts.es:
La señora Agueda M. es profesora de primaria, del colegio José de la Cruz Mena desde hace 22 años. 

Este crédito que solicito es  para la compra de materiales para realizar algunas mejoras a su vivienda esto con el fin de tener mejores condiciones para su familia.

Cabe mencionar que es su primer crédito con Ceprodel, la cual se siente muy agradecida por el gran apoyo que se le ha dado para realizar las mejoras de su vivienda.
texts.en:
Aguenda has been an elementary school teacher in the José de la Cruz Mena school for 22 years. She is asking for this loan in order to make some improvements to her home in order to better her family’s living conditions. This will be her first loan through Ceprodel, which will allow her to make her home improvements, for which she is very grateful.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Building materials

loans.name: Creciendo Para El Futuro 4,5 Group

texts.en:
Veronica is the coordinator of her group Creciendo para el futuro ("Growing for the Future"). Her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients generally (many of whom recently emigrated to the Dominican Republic from Haiti). Her group is located in Samana, a lush, rugged peninsula where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. She makes her home here in a simple structure with her husband and their three children.
Veronica is excited to be taking her second loan with Kiva partner, Esperanza, after having successfully repaid her previous loan and grown her business. She plans to use this loan to invest in her clothes and shoes business by purchasing blouses, skirts, blue jeans and tennis shoes in the main market in Santo Domingo, and then bringing them back to her community to sell at a profit. She will use her profits to invest in her children by purchasing school shoes as well as a computer to assist their learning. She intends to invest in her home by remodeling it, as well as purchasing a local space for her business so that she can move it out of her home. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: To buy blouses, skirts, jeans and shoes to sell

loans.name: German

texts.es: El German vive en la localidad de El Torno distante a 40 Km. de la Ciudad de Santa Cruz, Esta casado el es carpintero de profesión, su esposa la Sra. Epifania , se dedica a la venta de comida, en el mercado central, tiene tres hijo de los cuales dos de ellos están a su cargo, y pasando estudios superiores, el Sr. German es una persona responsable y trabajadora, uno de sus deseos es de ver a sus hijos profesionales,el destino del crédito solicitado es para aumentar su capital  de trabajo que fue reducido, cuando su madre enfermo y al final falleció esto fue un golpe muy duro para el, pero supo salir adelante por su familia; el se siente contento por la confianza que emprender y Kiva le ha dado en la otorgacion del credito.
texts.en:
German lives in El Torno, 40 kilometers from the city of Santa Cruz. He is married and is a carpenter by profession. His wife Epifania sells food in the central market. They have three children, two of which they still support and who are completing their higher education. German is a hard working responsible person and he hopes to someday see his children become professionals. He will use the money from this loan to increase his working capital, which was reduced when his mother became ill and passed away. This was a difficult time for him, but he knew how to move his family ahead. He appreciates the trust that Kiva has placed in him by helping him obtain this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Filimon

texts.es: Filimon tiene 52 años de edad, por lo que su actividad económica es brindar el servicio de reparación de equipos en general. Por lo que tiene más de 6 años en este trabajo pues él se adapto a este nivel de vida porque no tenía los ingresos necesarios para mantener a sus 3 hijos, que actualmente laboran de manera independiente, por lo que él tiene otro trabajo como guarda de seguridad y esto le ayuda en lo necesario a mejorar sus condiciones de calidad de vida. El financiamiento que este hombre trabajador solicita es para capital de trabajo que será destinado para la compra de repuestos, accesorios, herramientas y algunas piezas nuevas que necesita pues él es muy famoso en su comarca. El sueña con remodelar su vivienda.
texts.en:
Filimon is 52 years old and he works providing repair services to general equipment. He has been in this business for more than 6 years, so he adapted to this level of life because he did not have the necessary income to support his 3 children, who currently work independently. This is why he has another job as a security guard and this helps him to improve his living conditions. The loan that this hardworking man is requesting is for working capital that will be used for the purchase of spare parts, accessories, tools, and some new pieces that he needs, as he is very famous in his region. He dreams of remodeling his home.

Translated from Spanish by Kathleen O'Connell, Kiva Volunteer
