loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Jehova Jireh  3 Group

texts.en:
Higinio is the coordinator of his group, Jehova Jireh, and his story is representative of his group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients generally (many of whom recently emigrated to the Dominican Republic from Haiti). His group is located in the outskirts of San Pedro, a town once based on the sugar cane industry but which has more recently been in decay, and where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. He makes his home here in a simple structure as a single father with his child.
Higinio is excited to be taking his first loan with Esperanza and pleased to have access to capital at low interest rates. He plans to use this loan to invest in his bakery business by purchasing pre-packaged bread to sell alongsiD. the pastries that he bakes. He will use the profits to invest in shoes and school supplies for his child, as well as purchasing a washer and improving the floor in his home. He thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: To purchase pre-packaged bread to sell in his bakery

loans.name: Los Godinez Group

texts.es: S. un grupo de personas que viven en un lugar llamado Pueblo Viejo, del municipio de Momostenango, de acuerdo a la actividad economica que realizan se dedican a 3 actividades, los cuales S. la crianza de pollos, Elaboración de canastas plasticas, asi también la siembra de invernadero, arbolitos para reforestar, ellas y ellos necesitan su prestamo para poder comprar materia prima para la elaboración de canastas, actualmente venden por docenas los cuales los lugares de venta S. en toda la republica de Guatemala,con el financiamiento que obtendrán les ayudará para aumentar de capital como también generara oficios a las personas del lugar que quieren trabajar con este oficio, solamente que S. contratados por los integrantes del grupo, de esta manera tendrán un mejor desarrollo economico en la comunidad donde residen.
texts.en:
They are a group of people who live in a place called Pueblo Viejo, which is in the Momostenango municipality. They work at three different activities, according to their businesses. They raise chickens, make plastic baskets, and use a greenhouse to plant small trees for reforestation. They need a loan to be able to buy raw material to make the baskets. They currently sell them by the dozens. They sell all over Guatemala. The loan they will get will help them increase their capital and generate jobs for people who want to work in this occupation. They are only hired by members of the group, and this way their community will have better economic development.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Roman

texts.es: El Sr. Roman  es de vallegrande de profesion zapatero , hace 10 años que el radica en cañada sthroger adquirio una parcela, en la cual trabaja tambien con la agricultura justamente con su esposa hilda, siembra maiz. Arroz, yuca, sorgo, tambien tiene sus sitricos como ser naranja, mandarina, para despues comercializarlo en el mercado de la zona, es muy trabajador ya que tiene dos actividades, el destino del  credito es para la compra de herramientas de zapateria ya que las que tiene ya estan muy gastadas y no le permiten realizar un buen trabajo y por tal motivo no satisface a sus clientes, esta agradecido con Emprender y Kiva por la confianza brindada en la otorgacion del credito.
texts.en:
Roman is from Vallegrande and works as a shoemaker. 10 years ago he acquired a parcel of land which he farms with his wife, Hilda. He grows corn, rice, yucca, and sorghum and also has his citrus trees, oranges and mandarin oranges. He sells his products in the local market and is a hard worker. He will use the money from this loan to buy new shoe making tools because the ones he has are worn out and they no longer allow him to do quality work to satisfy his customers. He is grateful to Emprender and Kiva for the trust they have placed in him by helping him obtain this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Tools

loans.name: Nancy Lucia

texts.es:
Nancy Lucia Vásquez O. es una persona responsable, trabajadora, emprendedora que en el tiempo que lleva de estar trabajando con Adim ha demostrado su ferviente deseo de autosuperarse y seguir adelante. Ella como muchas mujeres en Nicaragua se dedican a sacar adelante a sus familias con sus pequeños negocios.

La señora V. desde muy temprano sale a comercializar su negocio de ropa usada y por las tardes empieza a arreglar su pequeño local de fritanga con la parrilla en la acera de su casa y una modesta mesa con maten floreado donde coloca el chilero, la ensalada, los cubiertos, etc esta lista para comenzar otra dura jornada de trabajo. Ella invertirá el crédito en ambos negocios pero dándole prioridad al de fritanga ya que necesita de mayor cantidad de dinero.
texts.en:
Nancy Lucia Vásquez O. is a responsible, hard-working, and enterprising person. During the time that she has been working with Adim, she has demonstrated her fervent desire for self-improvement and to get ahead. She, like many women in Nicaragua, devotes herself to getting her family ahead with her small business. Mrs. Vásquez leaves very early to sell used clothes. In the afternoons she starts to arrange her small fried snack stand. The grill goes on the sidewalk to her house, and she places the cooler, the salad, and the cutlery, etc. on a modest table with a floral tablecloth. Then she is ready to start another hard day’s work. She will use the loan for both businesses, but she will give priority to the fried snack stand because it needs a greater amount of money.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy clothes and ingredients to prepare fried snacks

loans.name: Lesbia Yoconda

texts.es:
La señora Lesbia Yoconda R. inicia sus labores desde las 6:00Am haciendo las debidas compras para la elaboración de los ricos refrescos que tiene a la venta en su pulpería.
Este crédito que solicito es  para la compra de granos básicos, gaseosas, jugos, cosméticos y otros.
Cabe mencionar que la señora lesbia inicio en el negocio con su mamá, lo que la llevo a poner su propia pulpería. La señora Lesbia es casada, madre de tres hijos.
texts.en:
Lesbia begins working at 6:00 am, buying the ingredients she needs to make the delicious drinks that she sells in her store. She will use the money from this loan to buy basic grains, soft drinks, juices, cosmetics and other things. Lesbia started working with her mother. This motivated her to start her own store. She is married and is the mother of three children.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Inventory

loans.name: Florencia

texts.es:
Nuestra socia  Florencia, pertenece al banco comunal  “CAPAC QOYA”, nuestra socia está ubicada en el distrito de Coya- Pisac a 50 minutos de la ciudad del Cusco.

Nuestra socia tiene 44 años  ella es casada y tiene 3 hijos de 23, 12, 7 años de edad, nuestra socia alterna sus actividades del hogar con la docencia ella vive en la ciudad del Cusco y siempre que puede darse una escapadita se viene a su lugar de origen a ver a sus parientes y sus cosas aquí en Coya, ella trabaja en el ministerio de educación y solicita el préstamo para hacer un pequeño negocio está pensando invertir en dinero en dos posibles negocios que ella nos dará a conocer más adelante, ya que tiene la creencia de que si avisa antes es posible de que no se le cumpla el proyecto.

Nuestra socia agradece  la oportunidad brindada y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus diferentes cuotas en los plazos establecidos.
texts.en:
Florencia belongs to the Capac Qoya Communal Bank. It is located in the Coya-Pisac district, which is 50 minutes from the city of Cusco. She is 44, married, and has three children. They are 23, 12, and 7 years old. She alternates her activities between the home and teaching. She lives in the city of Cusco. Whenever she can take a little getaway, she always goes to the place she is from to see her relatives and such here in Coya. She works for the Ministry of Education. She is requesting a loan to start a small business. She plans to invest money in two possible businesses, which she will let us know about later. She believes that is she tells about it ahead of time, the project might not be completed. She is grateful for the opportunity of the loan, and she promises to make her payments on time.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Personal use

loans.name: Diana Florencia

texts.es:
El banco comunal Mas que Vencedoras está ubicado en la ciudad de Azogues capital de la provincia del  Cañar, a 50 km de la ciudad  se encuentran las ruinas de Ingapirca uno de los sitios turisticos  más visitados del Ecuador, Azogues y Cañar son famosos por su artesanía, especialmente por la elaboración a mano  de los sombreros de paja toquilla y sus productos cerámicos, su gente es cordial y muy amable como nuestras socias que cada día buscan la manera de salir adelante con sus familias.

Diana es socia del banco comunal Más Que Vencedoras, es una mujer muy participativa que irradia buena energía a todo su grupo, vive en el centro de la ciudad de Azogues, tiene 31 años de edad y se encuentra casada y fruto de su unión concibió dos hijos que se encuentran de 11 y 7 años, su esposo trabaja como guardia de seguridad de una empresa, no tienen casa propia y viven en casa de sus padres ya que ellos no se encuentran en el país.

Diana se dedica a la venta de productos naturales  Herbalife hace tres años, también comercializa productos de belleza femenina Avon y Yanbal  hace cinco,  se encuentra en el cuarto ciclo con los préstamos recibidos ha podido adquirir los productos para sus clientes, con el nuevo préstamo que reciba  va a comprar  vitaminas, batidos, suplementos alimenticios, etc. de la línea Herbalife  y  algunas cremas, perfumes, maquillajes de las líneas Avon y Yanbal, su meta es llegar a tener su propio club de nutrición de los productos de Herbalife.
texts.en:
The Más que Vencedoras communal bank is located in the city of Azogues, which is the capital of the Cañar province about 50km from the city where the Ingapirca ruins are located, one of the most visited touristic sites in Ecuador. Azogues and Cañar are famous for their handicrafts, especially handmade Panama hats and ceramic products. The people are friendly and pleasant, like the communal bank members who search for a way to move forward with their families each day.

Diana is a member of the Más que Vencedoras communal bank and she is a very active woman that radiates positive energy to the entire group. She is 31 years old and lives in the center of the city of Azogues. She is married and has two children who are 11 years old and 7 years old. Her husband works as a security guard at a company. They do not have their own house, so they live in their parents’ house now that they are no longer in the country.

Diana has worked selling natural Herbalife products for the past three years. She has also worked selling women’s beauty products from Avon and Yanbal for the past five years. This is her fourth loan and with the loan she has received, she has been able to acquire products for her customers. With the new loan, she will purchase vitamins, shakes, dietary supplements, etc. from the Herbalife line, as well as some creams, perfumes, and makeup from Avon and Yanbal. Her goal is to have her own nutrition club with Herbalife products.

Translated from Spanish by Kathleen O'Connell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase vitamins, shakes, and dietary supplements from Herbalife, as well as creams, perfumes, makeup and other cosmetics from Avon and Yanbal

loans.name: María Elena

texts.es:
En el municipio del sauce la señora María Elena D. Atiende su pulpería desde hace 5 años iniciando con pocos productos y atravez de los créditos recibidos ha mejorado su pulpería. 
Esta solicitando un crédito para  la compra de productos arroz ,azúcar, pan , galletas, y golosinas. Espera obtener el crédito para seguir fortaleciendo su negocio y por ende mejorar el nivel de vida.
texts.en:
Maria has been attending to her store in the municipality of Sauce for the past five years. She started with a few items and, with the help some loans, has improved her store. She is asking for this loan on order to buy products, such as rice, sugar, cookies, and soft drinks. She is hoping to get this loan to strengthen her business and improve her quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Inventory

loans.name: Marisol Marjorie

texts.es:
Marisol C. de 39 años, vive en una zona urbana en el Suburbio de Guayaquil, vive en la casa de sus padres. Es madre soltera y tiene 2 hijos de 8 y 1 año.

Empezó hace 3 años vendiendo aretes. Cuando se separo del esposo necesito solventar los gastos de sus hijos y decidió tener en su casa su propio negocio.

Ahora ella tiene en casa su negocio en donde vende aretes, perfumes, cremas y otros artículos personales. Trabaja desde las 10h00 hasta las 14h00 todos los días. Una de las complicaciones que tiene es salir a ofrecer sus productos con la delincuencia que hay en el sector donde vive. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar ropa, cosméticos, perfumes para su negocio. En el futuro quiere tener su propia casa y tener otra tienda.
texts.en:
Marisol C. is 39 years old and lives in her parent’s house in an urban zone of the Suburbio de Guayaquil. She is a single mother and has two children who are 8 years old and 1 year old.

She began selling earrings 3 years ago. When she separated from her husband, she needed to cover the expenses for her children, so she decided to have her own business in her home.

Now she has her business in her home in which she sells earrings, perfumes, creams, and other personal items. She works from 10:00am to 2:00pm every day. One of the complications that she has is going out to sell her products because of the delinquency that exists in the sector where she lives.

With the loan requested, she wants to purchase clothing, cosmetics, and perfumes for her business. In the future, she wants to have her own house and another store.

Translated from Spanish by Kathleen O'Connell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Clothing, cosmetics, and perfumes

loans.name: Kyazaire Hiv/aids Tweyambe Group, Bushenyi

texts.en:
B. Jouvline (shown inset and also in the main photograph) is the leader of her lending group in Bushenyi. She is 27 years old, married, and has one child who is not yet in school. She also takes care of two dependants.
Jouvline is a friendly and determined lady with a business selling beans for home consumption from Kasheshero trading center. Although she mostly sells fresh stock, her profits are not yet large enough to sustain her well. This is why she wants to expand her business further as well as stay together as a happy family. She is requesting a loan to increase her stock by buying more beans in bulk for resale.

loans.use: To buy more beans for resale

loans.name: Senon

texts.es:
El Sr. Senon nacio en la Provincia Padilla del Departamento de Santa Cruz el 2 de junio de 1973, tiene 3 hijos que se encuentran en edad escolar es casado con la Sra. Serafina quien le ayuda en la siembra de sus productos hace 17 años compro una parcela en Santo Corazon en donde vive y trabajan en la agricultura, siembra sandia, maiz y arros, tambien tienen su camion el saca madera para los carpintenros, el viene trabajando en emprender hace 4 años porque segun el en la institucion tiene suerte, es muy trabajador y resposable con el pago puntual de sus cuotas, el destino del credito sera para la compra de semillas y asi poder incrementar su capital de trabajo, Uno de sus deseos es de hacer construir su casa, esta muy agradecido con Emprender y Kiva por la confianza brindada en la otorgacion del credito.
						
Si quieres saber mas de la provincia Padilla visita esta pagina http://padilla.gov.bo/?modulo=info_t&pagina=historia.
texts.en:
Senon was born on June 2, 1973 in the province of Padilla in the Santa Cruz department. He has three school-aged children and is marred to Serafina. His wife helps him with his farming. He bought a parcel of land in Santo Corazon, where they now live and work the land. They grow watermelon, corn, and rice. They also have a truck that delivers lumber to carpenters. He has been working with Empender for the past four years and has had some luck. He is a responsible hard worker and pays his debts on time. He will use the money from this loan to buy seed and to increase his working capital. He would like to build a home someday. He is very grateful to Empender and Kiva for the trust they have placed in him in helping obtain this loan. If you would like to know more about the province of Padilla, visit its official website: http://padilla.gov.bo/?modulo=info_t&pagina=historia

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Seed and working capital

loans.name: Filomena

texts.es:
Nuestra socia  Filomena, pertenece al banco comunal  “CAPAC QOYA”, nuestra socia está ubicada en el distrito D. Coya- Pisac a 50 minutos D. la ciudad del Cusco.

Nuestra socia tiene 46 años D. edad, ella es casada y tiene 4 hijos D. 25, 24, 22, 19 años D. edad, nuestra socia alterna sus actividades del hogar con el comercio minorista, la socia cría gallinas y chanchos, nuestra socia está muy feliz por que los 3 hijos ya son profesionales y ella solo está terminando D. apoyar en los estudios al último D. sus hijos y compra aves D. corral para vender los huevos y también las gallinas y chanchos. Nuestra socia solicita el préstamo para apoyar a su hijo en sus estudios y también para comprar gallinas. . 

Nuestra socia agradece  la oportunidad brindada y se compromete a cumplir con el pago D. sus diferentes cuotas en los plazos establecidos.
texts.en:
Filomena is a member of the Capac Qoya communal bank. She is located in the Coya-Pisac district, 50 minutes from the city of Cusco.

Filomena is 46 years old, married, and has children who are 25, 24, 22, 19 years old. She alternates her household activities with retail sales. She raises chickens and pigs. She is very happy because her 3 children are already professionals and she is just finishing supporting the studies of the last of her children. She purchases poultry to sell the eggs, as well as chickens and pigs. She is requesting a loan to support her son in his studies and to also purchase more chickens.

Filomena is grateful for the opportunity provided to her and promises to make the loan repayments on time.

Translated from Spanish by Kathleen O'Connell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To support her son in his studies and to purchase chickens

loans.name: Kashozi Bahingi Twetungure Group, Bushenyi

texts.en:
K. Yosamu is the leader of his lending group in Bushenyi. He is 52 years old, married, and has three children, all in secondary education. He also takes care of two dependants, who are also in school.
Yosamu is a tea farmer from Kashozi. In order to earn a good income from his farming, he ensures that he grows good quality tea and that he increases his output. He is a hardworking and a determined man who would like to expand his farming business in order to increase his income and enable him to continue paying school fees for his children and general upkeep. Yosamu is requesting a loan to buy more tea leaves so that he is able to supply his customers since what he grows on his farm is still not enough to meet the demand of his expanding customer base.

loans.use: To buy more tea leaves for resale to supplement those grown on his plantation

loans.name: Simona Esperanza

texts.es:
La señora Simona Esperanza M. se dedica a la venta de cosméticos, su tramo esta ubicado en el mercado la terminal. 
Este crédito que solicito es  para la compra de mochilas, relojes, billeteras, vanidades, shampoo, crema, pinturas de uñas, gorras.

Un hecho relevante de la señora Simona es que además de vender en su tramo ella se desplaza también a vender  en los diferentes buses de la localidad
texts.en:
Simona sells cosmetics in the terminal Marketplace. She is asking for this loan in order to buy bags, watches, wallets, vanity items, shampoo, creams, nail polish, and hats. Simona not only sells in the marketplace, but also on the different buses in her area.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Cosmetics and vanity items for resale

loans.name: José Emilio

texts.es:
En el municipio de somotillo, sector l guasaule el señor José Emilio O. C., se dedica al desarrollo de diversas actividades como son la venta de comida, soldadura y como maestro de obras, el empezó su negocio cuando estableció su vivienda en el guasaule quien en este momento no vendía grandes cantidades, sin embargo al ser reconocido y al pasar el tiempo este fue creciendo y mejorando para ellos ya que es administrado también por su esposa, ellos trabajan de 10 am a 8 pm todos los días de la semana.
El crédito solicitado será empleado para la reparación de la cocina de su casa puesto que esta en mal estado y es una parte fundamental para su actividad la cual le genera la mayor parte de sus ingresos.
texts.en:
In the city of Somotillo in sector I of the Guasaule region, José Emilio O. C. is involved in the development of diverse activities such as the sale of food and flooring. He is also a master builder. He began his business when he established his home in Guasaule. At first he didn’t sell much, but with the passage of time his business increased and improved for him and his wife, who also helps administer it. They work from 10:00 a.m. until 8:00 p.m. every day of the week.

The loan applied for will be used for the repair of the kitchen in his house, which is in a bad state and which is vital for the business which generates the greatest portion of his earnings. .

Translated from Spanish by Richard Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase cement, concrete blocks, sand, steel, etc.

loans.name: Kashozi Bahingi Twetungure Group, Bushenyi

texts.en:
T. Annet (shown inset as well as in the main photograph) is the leader of her lending group in Bushenyi. She is 32 years old, married, and has five children aged three to fourteen. For the past seven years, Annet has had a retail shop business in Nyamiko Kigoma trading center. She sells mostly general merchandise such as sugar, salt, soap, cooking oil and muffins. The sustainability of her business is mostly attributed to her good customer care – she is a very friendly woman – and the help of loans. Annet hopes to own the biggest and main shop in her village in order to increase sales and have an educated family. At the moment, she is requesting a loan to buy more stock for her shop.
Note: The second lady from the left in the larger photograph is a member of another Pearl Microfinance loan group currently raising funds on Kiva and hence is not considered for this loan group.

loans.use: To restock her shop with more merchandise

loans.name: Reyna De Jesús

texts.es:
La Señora Reyna M., se dedica a la Ganadería en la Comunidad del Sauce, donde se dedica a la crianza de Novillos.
Solicita un Crédito para la compra de Novillos para Repasto, con el fin de obtener ingresos en un periodo corto, para continuar llevando el sustento a su hogar.
texts.en:
Reyna M. works with livestock in the El Sauce community. She raises steers. She is asking for a loan to buy steers to fatten in order to get income in a short period of time. She will do this to continue bringing sustenance to her household.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy steers

loans.name: Daysi

texts.es: En el municipio de Somotillo comarca el puma la señora Daysi C. M., se dedica a la crianza de ganado bobino y porcino junto a su esposo también es empleada de un centro educativo de primaria en donde imparte clases, ella empezó a dedicarse a la crianza de ganado cuando de caso, ella trabaja de 7 a 12 del día en la escuela y por la tarde le colabora a su esposo con las actividades de la finca, solicita el crédito para la compra de dos vacas paridas y aumentar su hato ganadero y  diversificar todos sus ingreso, para ofrecer un mejor bienestar económico a sus tres pequeños hijos
texts.en:
Daysi C. M. raises cattle and pigs in the Somotillo municipality in the town of El Puma. She does this with her husband. She is also employed at an educational center for primary education where she teaches classes. She started raising livestock when she got married. She works from seven until twelve at the school. In the afternoon she works with her husband on the farm. She is asking for a loan to buy two calving cows to increase their herd, to diversify their income, and to give their three small children a better state of economic well-being.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy two calving cows

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Silvio Benito

texts.es:
El señor Silvio se dedica a las labores de electricista, en donde un dia de trabajo para él es bien agitado y de riesgo.  Es su primero crédito con Ceprodel.

El crédito que ha solicitado es para la mejora de su casa en donde les brindara mejores condiciones de vida a su familia.

Cabe señalar que el señor M. también ofrece servicios de alquiler de cuartos a estudiantes lo que le permitara obtener mejores ganancias.
texts.en:
Silvio is an electrician; a typical work day for him is very agitated and risky. This is his first loan with Ceprodel. He will use the funds for home improvements in order to provide his family with better living conditions. It is worth noting that Mr. M. also rents rooms to students to earn additional income.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy building materials and supplies.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more clothes to sew and for resale

loans.name: Marina

texts.en:
Marina P. M. is a 64-year-old woman who normally lives by herself in a rented house in Goicoechea, San Jose. At the moment, Marina is responsible for the care of her granddaughter.

Marina has a business selling various catalogue products in her community; she has been involved in this line of work for the past twenty years. Going door to door, she offers potential clients the opportunity to browse a magazine full of a range of retail products, from portable barbecues, to clothing items. She plans to use this loan to increase her working capital and to purchase products for resale.

Marina is an experienced client of Fundacion Mujer. She has been approved for numerous loans in the past and has a proven track record of punctual repayments. The loan consultant that has been working with Marina most recently describes her as a responsible entrepreneurial and an excellent client overall.

Marina would like to be able to put on a bazaar in her house where potential clients with various desires could come and peruse the products she has to offer. Another goal is to earn enough income and savings to purchase her own house. Marina says the fact that she does not own her house is an obstacle in her life.

For this loan, Marina is applying for a relatively small amount because she is afraid of holding large amounts of debt that she might not be able to repay.

loans.use: To purchase various catalogue items to sell

loans.name: Ada Luz

texts.es: En el municipio de somotillo, comarca  rodeo grande la señora Ada luz E., se dedica a la crianza de ganado bobino, porcino y aviar también realiza actividades agrícolas como el establecimiento de cultivos anuales como maíz, ajonjolí, frijoles y sorgo, todos destinados a mejorar las condiciones económicas del hogar ya que ella tiene dos hijos los cuales dependen de ella y su esposo, doña Ada luz ha tenido tres créditos con CEPRODEl los que han mejorado su sistema productivo a través del aumento del hato ganadero que maneja y mejorando la forma en que establecía los cultivos.
texts.en:
Ada Luz E. lives in Somotillo, Rodeo Grande. She raises farm animals like: sheep, pigs and fowl. She also farms certain annual crops like: corn, sesame, beans and sorhgum. All this is aimed at improving her family's economic situation because she has two children that depend on her and her husband. Ada Luz has had three loans with CEPRODEL which have helped her to improve her productive system by increasing the number of animals in her herd and improving the way she manages her crops.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy four, lately delivered, cows.

loans.name: Rashelle

texts.en:
Rashelle J. is a business-minded woman. She is 30 years old and the mother of three daughters and one son. She is married to Willie Boy, a 31-year-old fisherman. She lives in Talim, Binangonan in the province of Rizal, Philippines. She belongs to a poor family that needs help to change their standard of living and she is grateful to ASHI for support, even in all the challenges in life.

With her belief and faith in getting out of poverty, Rashelle decided in 2008 to join ASHI (Ahon SA Hirap, Inc.), a micro-finance institution and Kiva partner in the Philippines, with a chance of having start-up capital for generating income. During her previous loan from ASHI, she carefully invested in her sari-sari store (a small retail store selling different goods). The profit is what she uses for daily expenses.

Now on her fourth loan, Lolita proposes to borrow Php 20,000 to create a broader business. Specifically, the amount will be used to purchase sacks of rice, vegetables, cooking oil, canned goods, and other supplies for her general store. She is very determined and disciplined in using the money which is lent to her.

Rashelle still dreams of the best for her family: to provide the best education for her children and to have a happy family. During her almost two years in ASHI, she has shown herself to be industrious and determined to make her dreams come true.

About ASHI: Ahon sa Hirap Inc. (ASHI) has the distinction of being the oldest existing replication of Grameen Bank Approach (GBA) to credit delivery to the bottom poor in the Philippines. With its outstanding achievements over the years, it has become one of the role models in credit delivery to the poor in the country.

loans.use: To purchase rice, vegetables, cooking oil, canned goods, etc. for her general store

loans.name: Kashasha Farmers Tukore Group, Ibanda

texts.en:
R. Felex is a happy and jolly man. He is shown at the top left and also happens to be in the big photo. He is 46 years old and married with 6 children; he also takes care of 3 more children.

Felex has been a mechanic in the Omukashasha trading centre for 20 years, and one of his strong points is being faithful to his clients. He repairs cars and motorcycles, and he needs a loan to be able to buy more spare parts for both motorcycles and cars. He would also like to have a section for bicycle repairs. He operates from a garage, and he wants to expand his business in the future so that he will be able to educate his children as some of them join him in his business.

loans.use: Buying spare parts to repair motorcycles and cars

loans.name: Fidelia Buenaventura

texts.es: Fidelia Buenaventura tiene 46 años, por lo que su actividad económica es brindar el servicio de sastrería. Hace más 15 años que se dedica a este negocio, por lo que desde hace mucho tiempo esta humilde actividad forma parte de su vida, anteriormente solo ofrecía el servicio de reparaciones de camisas, vestidos, pantalones de vestir entre otros productos así fue que logro realizar su propia fama de ofrecer muy buenos servicios, fue así que decide realizar de este trabajo un medio de ingreso para su vida y mejorar la calidad de vida de sus 2 hijos que están a su cargo. Ella solicita este financiamiento para la compra de telas, hilos, zipper, botones, tijeras, bordados y agujas. Fidelia sueña mejorar la calidad de sus productos o agrandar su taller.
texts.en:
Fidelia Buenaventura is 46 years old. Her economic activity is tailoring, which she has done for more than 15 years. This humble activity has been part of her life for quite some time. Previously, she only offered services repairing shirts, dresses, and pants, among other things, and this is how she built a reputation for doing good work. Then she decided to use this work as a source of income to improve the quality of life for her two children. She is seeking a loan for the purchase of fabrics, thread, zippers, buttons, scissors, embroidery, and needles. Fidelia wishes to improve the quality of her products and expand her workshop.

Translated from Spanish by Trisha Bury, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase capital

loans.name: Edelmira

texts.es:
Edelmira, de 36 años, es una mujer muy sencilla y trabajadora, vive en una casa alquilada junto a su esposo Abel, de 40 años, quien trabaja junto a ella en el cultivo de sus tierras, y sus 2 hijas; Yanilin de 18 y Yasmin de 16 años, y lo que más desea es mejorar su calidad de vida.

Su negocio está ubicado en el mercado modelo de la ciudad, ella se dedica a la venta de verduras; como alverjas, zanahorias, tomates, etc. Su puesto es muy concurrido, ya que sus productos son frescos y tienen un precio asequible, lo cual ha hecho que se vuelva una de las vendedoras más solicitadas por los clientes.
Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es conversar con sus vecinas de venta, ya que así hace más amenas sus largas jornadas de trabajo. Lleva 6 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es tener que permanecer todo el día en su puesto cuidándolo. Para más adelante, desea seguir trabajando duro y mejorar su negocio poco a poco.

Este es el tercer préstamo de Edelmira con MFP y está segura que el dinero del crédito la ayudará bastante en el desarrollo de su negocio. A su vez, dentro de su banco comunal trabaja muy duro junto a sus compañeros para que las cosas les salgan muy bien. Con los mil nuevos soles solicitados comprará más verduras para implementar mejor su puesto de ventas.
texts.en:
Edelmira, age 36, is a simple and hardworking woman. She lives in a rented house with her 40-year-old husband, Abel, who works alongside her cultivating their land, and their two daughters: 18-year-old Yanilin and 16-year-old Yasmin. What she wants most is to improve their quality of life. Her business is located in the city market. She sells vegetables like peas, carrots, tomatoes, etc. Her booth is very busy, as her produce is very fresh and reasonably priced. This has made her one of the most popular vendors among the customers. What she likes most about her work is talking to her fellow vendors, because this makes working long hours more pleasant. She has been doing this work for six years, and she considers staying in her booth all day to be the most difficult part. In the future, she hopes to keep working hard and improve her business little by little. This is the third loan Edelmira has sought from MFP, and she is sure that the credit will help her a great deal in developing her business. She works very hard in her communal bank along with her partners to ensure that everything goes well. With the 1,000 soles she is requesting, she will purchase more vegetables to improve her sales.

Translated from Spanish by Trisha Bury, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase merchandise

loans.name: Esmeralda

texts.es:
Esmeralda, de 44 años, es una mujer muy trabajadora y alegre, vive en un cuarto alquilado junto a sus dos hijas; Grisell de 24 y Linsey de 10 años, a quienes desea dar una buena calidad de vida.

Recorriendo las calles de la ciudad de Tarma, Esmeralda realiza su trabajo, ella se dedica a la venta de cosméticos y es una vendedora muy convincente, motivo por el cual sus productos se venden muy rápido y tiene que renovarlos constantemente. Siente que su trabajo es muy rentable, ya que gracias a él puede brindarles a sus hijos los estudios que se merecen.
Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es aconsejar a sus clientes sobre los productos que mejor actuaran sobre su piel; lleva 6 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es tener que caminar todo el día en busca de clientes. Con el tiempo, desea poner una tienda, donde pueda vender con más comodidad sus productos de belleza.

Este es el noveno préstamo de Esmeralda con MFP y está muy feliz de poder obtenerlo, manifiesta que invertirá todo el dinero en su negocio, ya que quiere mejorar su vida. En su banco comunal es una socia muy alegre y participativa. Con los setecientos nuevos soles solicitados comprará más productos de belleza, para poder ofrecer a sus clientes una mayor variedad de dónde elegir.
texts.en:
Esmeralda, age 44, is a hard-working and happy woman. She lives in a rented room with her two daughters. Grisell is 24, and Linsey is 10. Esmeralda wants to give them a good quality of life. Esmeralda works by traveling the streets of the city of Tarma. She sells cosmetics, and she is a very convincing salesperson. Therefore, her products sell very quickly, and she constantly has to replenish them. She feels that her work is very profitable. Thanks to her work she is able to give her children the education that they deserve. What she likes most about her work is advising her customers about the products that will work best on their skin. She has been doing this activity for six years. She feels that the most difficult part is having to walk all day looking for customers. In time, she wants to set up a store where she can sell her beauty products more comfortably. This is Esmeralda’s ninth loan with MFP. She is happy to be able to get it. She will invest all of the money in her business because she wants to improve her life. She is a very happy and active participant in her communal bank. With the 700 PEN she is requesting she will buy more beauty products to be able to offer her customers a greater variety from which to select.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy beauty products

loans.name: Graciela

texts.es:
Nuestra socia  Graciela, pertenece al banco comunal  “CAPAC QOYA”, nuestra socia está ubicada en el distrito de Coya- Pisac a 50 minutos de la ciudad del Cusco.

Nuestra socia tiene 43 años de edad, ella es casada y tiene 3 hijos de 21, 14, 5 años de edad, nuestra socia alterna sus actividades del hogar con el comercio minorista, la socia tiene un pequeño restaurante en la carretera principal, justo en la entrada a Coya, nuestra socia tiene como principal cliente a todos los taxistas que prestan servicio desde Pisac a Calca, nuestra socia nos comenta que ahora con la inundación y por las carreteras dañadas así como por la caída del puente de Pisac los carros están dándose la vuelta por otro lado, perjudicándose la socia con este problema que tomará 2 meses en superar, nuestra socia por el momento solicita el préstamo para poder invertir en la compra de utensilios para el restaurante y ahora que está cerrado implementara de mejor manera su local y esperará hasta que las cosas mejoren aquí en Coya.
 
Nuestra socia agradece  la oportunidad brindada y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus diferentes cuotas en los plazos establecidos.
texts.en:
Graciela belongs to the Capac Qoya Communal Bank. She is located in the Coya-Pisac district, which is 50 minutes from the city of Cusco. She is 43, married, and has three children. They are 21, 14, and 5 years old. She alternates her activities between the home and her small business. She has a small restaurant on the main road right at the entrance to Coya. Her main customers are all of the taxi drivers who provide service from Pisac to Calca. She says that now with the flood, the damaged roads, and the fall of the Pisac Bridge, the cars are turning around on the other side. This problem hurts her business, and it will take two months to overcome. She is now asking for a loan to buy utensils for her restaurant. Now that it is closed, she will set up her place better and wait until things improve here in Coya. She is grateful for the opportunity of the loan, and she promises to make her payments on time.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy utensils for her restaurant

loans.name: Luz

texts.es:
Luz, de 42 años, es una mujer muy sencilla y trabajadora, vive en la casa de su madre junto a su esposo Juan, de 38 años, y sus 3 hijos: Kenedy de 19, Pamela de 14 y Araceli de 5 años, quienes son el motivo de todos sus esfuerzos.

En el mercado mayorista de la ciudad se encuentra el puesto de frutas de Luz, su principal producto son las manzanas. Todas las mañanas abre su puesto para atender con mucho cariño y respeto a todas las personas que desean comprar sus sabrosos productos, ya que sabe que si les brinda una buena atención, volverán.
Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es conversar con sus compañeras de venta y así informarse de las cosas que pasan en el mercado. Lleva 12 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es transportar las manzanas, puesto que el viaje es muy largo y cansado. Para más adelante, espera contratar dos ayudantes, con los cuales pueda atender mejor a todos sus clientes.

Este es el noveno préstamo de Luz con MFP, siente que tiene la obligación de pagar todas sus cuotas puntualmente. En su banco comunal es una socia muy responsable, es por eso que es muy respetada por el resto de sus compañeras. Con los quinientos nuevos soles solicitados comprará más manzanas para implementar mejor su puesto de ventas.
texts.en:
Luz, 42 years old, is a simple and hard-working women. She lives in her mother's house with her 38 year old husband, Juan, and their three children: Kenedy, age 19, Pamela, age 14 and Araceli, age 5 who are the reason for all her efforts. Luz has a fruit stand in the city's wholesale market where her primary product is apples. Every morning she opens her stand to sell with love and respect to all the people wanting her tasty products. People return to her knowing that she always pays very good attention to her customers. The part of her work that she likes best is working with the neighboring saleswomen where she can learn about all that happens in the market. She has being doing this activity for the last 12 years and has found that the most difficult part is transporting the apples since the trip is long and tiring. In the future she would like to contract with assistants so she can provide a better service to all her clients. This is the ninth loan Luz has taken with MFP and she feels that she has an obligation to make all her payments punctually. In her village bank she is known as a very responsible partner making her respected by all her friends. With the 500 nuevos soles that she is requesting, she plans to buy more apples so she can begin to see a rise in her sales.

Translated from Spanish by Sierra Visher, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy apples

loans.name: Matilde

texts.es:
La señora Matilde se dedica a la venta de de frutas y verduras dando inicio a sus labores desde las 6:00 am comienza a ofertar sus productos a su clientela, su tramo esta ubicado en la 4ta calle del mercado la terminal.

Este crédito que solicito para la compra de zanahoria, cebolla, chiltoma, papa, yuca y otros.

Cabe mencionar que la señora Matilde es madre soltera tiene  seis hijos, el mayor de 27 años le ayuda en el negocio.
texts.en:
Mrs. Matilde works selling fruit and vegetables. At 6:00 am she starts selling her product from her location on Fourth Street in the Terminal Market. She will use this loan to buy carrots, onions, peppers, potatoes, yucca, and other products We should mention that Mrs. Matilde is a single mother with six children, the eldest of whom is 27 and helps her with her business.

Translated from Spanish by Patrick King, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of carrots, peppers, potatoes, onion, yucca, tomato

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
María, de 45 años, es una mujer muy sencilla y alegre, vive en su casa propia y lo que más desea es mejorar su calidad de vida.

Desde muy pequeña le enseñaron a trabajar en varios oficios para alcanzar sus metas, ahora se dedica a la venta de alfalfa y cuyes, los cuales ella misma cultiva y cría respectivamente. Pero paralelamente, trabaja junto a su hermana en la elaboración de quesos y manjar, los que lleva a la ciudad de Lima para su venta.
Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo, es criar sus cuyes y lo hace con mucho amor, lleva 15 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil, es tener que viajar constantemente a la ciudad de Lima por los pedidos de manjar y queso que tiene. Con el tiempo, espera que su negocio siga creciendo y que le pueda brindar mejores ingresos económicos.

Este es el décimo préstamo de María con MFP, está dispuesta a pagar todas sus cuotas puntualmente, ya que no desea meter en problemas a su banco comunal, donde es muy solidaria con el resto de sus compañeras. Con los dos mil nuevos soles solicitados comprará más comida para sus cuyes, ya que es la actividad que mejores ingresos le está generando.
texts.en:
Maria, 45, is a cheerful and unassuming woman who lives in her own home. What she most desires is to have a better quality of life. From the time she was very small, she was taught many trades in order to reach her goals. Now she sells alfalfa and guinea pigs, which she cultivates and raises, respectively. At the same time, she works with her sister making cheese and dulce de leche (a milk-based dessert), which she takes to the city of Lima to sell. What she likes most about her job is raising her guinea pigs, which she does with a lot of love. She has been carrying out these activities for 15 years, and what she considers most difficult is to have to travel constantly to the city of Lima to fill her orders for dulce de leche and cheese. Over time, she hopes that her business will continue to grow so that it will provide a better economic return. This is Maria's 10th loan with MFP, and she is prepared to make all of her payments on time, since she does not want to create problems in her communal bank where she is very supportive of her fellow members. With the 2,000 Peruvian soles requested she will buy more feed for her guinea pigs, since this activity generates the most income for her.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy feed for her guinea pigs

loans.name: Corazon

texts.en:
Corazon A. is a woman of courage to battle challenges in order to achieve her goals in life. She is 53 years old and married to Sancho A., 52, who is a fisherman. She is a caring mother to three children, all of whom have education degrees. She lives in the coastal place of Talim Island, in the town of Binangonan, Rizal Province, in the Philippines.

In 2007, she joined ASHI (Ahon SA Hirap, Inc.), an MFI and Kiva partner in the Philippines, with an opportunity of having start-up funds for generating income. She carefully invested loans from ASHI in her fish-selling business and it gave her a reasonable earnings. Now on her fourth loan, she requests 20,000 PHP for additional working capital for her fish-selling business. Specifically, the amount will be used to purchase tilapia, big heads, milk fish, ayungin, kanduli, and fingerlings.

As a mother, Corazon dreams of funding her grandchildren to go to school and completing their college degrees so they can find jobs for a healthier life. She also enjoys considering that the loan from ASHI and KIVA partner will change their lives and provide her family's needs.

About ASHI: Ahon sa Hirap Inc. (ASHI) has the distinction of being the oldest existing replication of Grameen Bank Approach (GBA) to credit delivery to the bottom poor in the Philippines. With its outstanding achievements over the years, it has become one of the role models in credit delivery to the poor in the country.

loans.use: To purchase fish to sell

loans.name: Nelly

texts.es:
Nelly, D. 49 años, es una madre soltera muy amorosa y trabajadora tiene 5 hijos pero actualmente solo vive con 3 D. ellos: Abigail D. 20, Wendy D. 18 y Gisela D. 15 años, sus otros dos hijos ya tiene familia y son independientes. Actualmente vive en casa D. su madre, Doña Cirila D. 74 años. 

Nelly trabaja diariamente con su inseparable carretilla donD. transporta sus deliciosas golosinas, para ello se ubica en las puertas D. un D. los colegios D. la ciudad D. Tarma, donD. tiene muchos clientes, pues es una vendedora muy persuasiva y siempre convence a sus clientes D. comprar más D. lo que en un inicio querían.
Lo que más le gusta D. su trabajo es conversar con sus vecinas D. venta, lleva 8 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es tener que permanecer bajo el inclemente sol todos los días, puesto que es agotador. Para el futuro, espera juntar más dinero para instalar una tienda D. abarrotes donD. pueda atender a sus clientes con mayor tranquilidad.

Este es el sétimo préstamo D. Nelly con MFP y sabe que tiene que cumplir con los pagos D. todas sus cuotas a tiempo, en su banco comunal es una socia muy alegre y solidaria. Con los mil nuevos soles solicitados comprará más golosinas para incrementar sus ventas.
texts.en:
Nelly, age 49, is a very loving and hard-working single mother. She has five children but only lives with three of them: Abigail, 20, Wendy, 18, and Gisela, 15. Her other two children are independent and already have families of their own. Sho lives at home with her 74-year-old mother, Doña Cirila. Nelly works everyday with her trusty little cart carrying delicious candies, and she places herself at the door of one of the high schools in the city of Tarma, where she has many customers. She is a very persuasive saleswoman, and she always ends up convincing her customers to buy more than they initially want. What she likes the best about her job is being able to chat with her fellow businesswomen. She has been at this job for 8 years, and she considers staying under the merciless sun every day as the most difficult part, as it is an exhausting place to be. In the future, she hopes to get together enough money to be able to construct a grocery store where she can more easily tend to her customers. This is Nelly's seventh loan with MFP, and she knows that she must meet the monthy repayments on time. She is a very joyful and supportive member of her community bank. She plans to use the 1,000 nuevos soles to buy more candies in order to increase her sales.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Merchlewitz, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase her merchandise selection

loans.name: Jhony

texts.es:
Nuestra socia  Jhony, pertenece al banco comunal  “CAPAC QOYA”, nuestra socia está ubicada en el distrito de Coya- Pisac a 50 minutos de la ciudad del Cusco.

Nuestra socia tiene 29 años de edad, es natural de Coya y la socia es casada tiene 2 hijos de 10 y 1 año y medio años, la socia alterna sus diferentes actividades del hogar con el comercio minorista, Nuestra socia vende desayunos de quinua en la esquina de la plaza todas las mañanas, desde las 6:00 a.m. hasta la hora que se le termine, Nuestra socia solicita el préstamo para comprar insumos como son, quinua, azúcar, manzana, leche, y comprar  gas para la cocina.
 
Nuestra socia agradece  la oportunidad brindada y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus diferentes cuotas en los plazos establecidos.
texts.en:
Our member, Jhony, is part of the communal bank “CAPAC QOYA." She lives in the Coya-Pisac district which is 50 minutes from Cusco. Our member is 29 years old, from Coya, and is married with two children ages ten and one and a half years. This member alternates between her different jobs of home maker and retailer. Jhony sells breakfasts of quinua on the plaza's corner every morning from 6:00 a.m. until she is finished. She is asking for a loan to buy ingredients like: quinua, sugar, apples, milk, and to buy gas for the kitchen. Our member is grateful for the opportunity offered her and promises to comply with her established payment schedule.

Translated from Spanish by Shelly Hubman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy ingredients: quinua, sugar, apples, milk, and to buy gas for the kitchen.

loans.name: Rosmery

texts.es:
Rosmery, de 28 años, es una joven madre de familia muy alegre y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Alex de 28 años, quien trabaja como chofer y sus dos hijos; Jefferson de 8 y Grisell de 4 años, a quienes desea brindar una buena educación.

Con mucho esfuerzo ella ha logrado trabajar sus tierras y volverlas muy productivas, cultiva espinacas, zanahorias y lechugas, las cuales lleva a vender hasta la ciudad de Lima, donde las vende al por mayor. Sus cultivos le han dado los ingresos necesarios para mantener a su familia, es por eso que desea poner todas sus ganas en sacar adelante este negocio.
Por otro lado, lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cuidar sus cultivos, lleva 5 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es transportar sus productos hasta la ciudad de Lima, ya que los sacos que lleva son muy pesados y la cansan mucho. Para más adelante, espera mejorar su producción y poder así tener mejores ingresos.

Este es el noveno préstamo de Rosmery con MFP, ha sido muy puntual en sus anteriores créditos y espera serlo también ahora. En su banco comunal es una socia muy participativa y siempre está al tanto de los acuerdos a los que llegan en su grupo. Con los tres mil nuevos soles que solicita comprará abono e insecticidas, con lo cual espera mejorar sus cultivos.
texts.en:
Rosmery is 28 years old and a very happy and hardworking young mother of a family. She lives in her own house together with her husband, Alex, who is 28 years old and works as a chofer, and their two children: Jefferson who is 8 and Grisell who is 4. They would like to provide their children with a good education.

With much effort, she has been able to work her lands and make them productive again. She grows spinach, carrots, and lettuce, which she brings to sell in Lima, where she sells them wholesale. Her crops have provided her with the necessary income to support her family, which is why she would like to put all of her effort into moving the business forward.

On the other hand, what she likes most about her job is caring for the crops. She has been doing this for 5 years and considers the most difficult part to be transporting her products to the city of Lima, since the sacks that she brings are very heavy and are very tiring. In the future, she hopes to improve her production and as a result, have better earnings.

This is Rosmery’s ninth loan with MFP. She has been very punctual with her previous loan repayments and hopes to be punctual now as well. At her communal bank, she is a very active member and is always on top of the agreements reached by the group. With the 3,000 PEN that she is requesting, she will purchase fertilizer and insecticides, with which she hopes to improve her crops.

Translated from Spanish by Kathleen O'Connell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer and insecticides

loans.name: Blanca Liliam

texts.es:
La señora Blanca inicia a ofertar sus productos desde tempranas horas de la mañana en su tramo ubicado en la 4ta calle del mercado la terminal.

Este crédito que solicito es para la compra de plátanos, la cual estaban a un buen precio y como tiene bastante demanda por parte de sus clientes. 

Algo relevante de la señora blanca que los créditos que ha obtenido con Ceprodel le ha permitido que su negocio crezca más y así obtener mejores ganancia la cual le permite mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Blanca begins selling her products in the early hours of the morning at her stand located in the Fourth Street market. La señora Blanca inicia a ofertar sus productos desde tempranas horas de la mañana en su tramo ubicado en la 4ta calle del mercado la terminal. This loan will be used to purchase plantains, which are available for a good price, and are in high demand by her clients. The loans that Blanca has received from Ceprodel have allowed her business to grow giving her more profits and thus giving her family a better quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Patrick King, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of plantains

loans.name: Sandra Azucena

texts.es:
La señora Sandra Azucena P. C., tiene un negocio de una farmacia desde hace 16 años la tiene ubicada en su casa de habitación en el barrio Santa Ana, abre su negocio a las ocho de la mañana  y lo cierra a las cinco y media de la tarde de lunes a domingo, el crédito ella lo solicito para comprar mercadería para la farmacia ya que necesitaba surtir su inventario.
La señora P. C. es madre soltera, tiene un hijo que estudia y por el cual lucha para darle el sustento de la comida y poder pagarle la universidad  ya tiene 3 años de trabajar con nosotros de los cuales los a sabido administrar satisfactoriamente ya que su negocio ha evolucionado bastante y no dejas de realizarles mejoras a sus casa.
texts.en:
Mrs. Sandra Azucena Perez C. has run a pharmacy for 16 tears. She runs the pharmacy out of her house in the Santa Ana neighborhood. She opens at 8 in the morning and closes at 5:30 in the afternoon from Monday to Sunday. The loan will be used to buy merchandise for the pharmacy which needs to be restocked. Mrs. Perez C. is a single mother. She has one son who is in school and motivates her to fight to provide food for her family and to be able to pay for university classes. She has worked with the organization for three years and has shown the ability to manage her business well. The business has evolved considerably and she continually makes improvements to her home.

Translated from Spanish by Patrick King, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of medicines to restock pharmacy

loans.name: Agali Awamu Kikajjo Group, Kampala

texts.en:
M. Enid appears in the photo at the top right and also in the big group photo. She is the leader of her lending group in Kampala. She is a hard-working young lady. She is married with one child, aged 6 years, and she takes care of her grandmother.

Enid has had a salon on Namaruba stage in Namasuba for 6 years. Through good customer care, together with the help of loans, she has been able to have enough stock in her salon. She hopes to have a first-class salon in the future, plus have a good and rich family. Some of the challenges she faces in her salon are the capital and power shortages. However, this does not stop her from requesting another loan to help buy braids and weaves for plaiting her customers’ hair.

loans.use: To buy braids and weaves for her salon

loans.name: Maureen

texts.en: Maureen C. is a 31-year-old mother who cares for her two children. She is married to Rommel, who is a fisherman. To help to support her husband, she started a business selling fish. With dreams to get away from poverty, in 2008 she joined ASHI (Ahon Sa Hirap Inc., which means “To rise up from poverty”), a Kiva partner in the Philippines. Since her membership in the institution, she had shown good performance in her credit rating (on the basis of loans) to get more capital for her business. Now on her third loan, she applied for a 20,000 Philippine peso loan to buy additional fish to sell, such as big heads, tilapia, fingerlings (small fish) and other types. In the future, Maureen hopes to establish a stall in the market where she can fulfill orders. She also wants to be able to save for her children's education and to have a comfortable house for living and a happy family to live with. About ASHI: Ahon sa Hirap Inc. (ASHI) has the distinction of being the oldest existing replication of the Grameen Bank Approach to credit delivery to the bottom poor in the Philippines. With its outstanding achievements over the years, it has become one of the role models in credit delivery to the poor in the country.

loans.use: To buy an additional fish to sell, such as big heads, tilapia, and fingerlings (small fish)

loans.name: Etelbina Del Socorro

texts.es:
La señora Etelbina del Socorro S. es comerciante del mercado Santa Ana tiene un negocio de comida rápida, hace desayunos y almuerzo ya que donde esta ubicada queda frente a una empresa (ENACAL), ella llega a su puesto  a las siete de la mañana y termina de vender a las tres de la tarde, después que ella vende viene al mercado a hacer compras.
La señora S. tiene de vender ocho  años ahí en ese puesto empezó con un capital de C$ 500.00, pero antes ella vendía ambulante agua helada.
Es madre soltera no tiene hijos a cargo lucha para salir adelante para ella sola lleva trabajando con nosotros tres años y manifiesta que estos créditos le han ayudado bastante por que su negocio ha evolucionado bastante ahora ella tiene una cocina móvil que se la lleva diario a su casa, en la que ella realiza la comida, también tiene  plantas telefónicas  que es otro ingreso para ella.
texts.en:
Mrs. Etelbina del Socorro Sanchez works in the Santa Ana market where she has a fast food business. She makes breakfast and lunch at her location in front of ENACAL. She starts work at 7:00 am and finishes at 3 in the afternoon, after which she goes to the market to shop. Mrs. Sanchez has had her stand for eight years. She started with 500 Cordobas of capital. She had previously worked selling cold water in the streets. She is a single mother, though she does not live with her children. She works hard to improve her life. She has worked with the organization for three years, and she says that these loans have helped her business evolve. She now has a mobile kitchen which she brings daily to her house, which she uses to make her food. She also has phones which is another way for her to make money.

Translated from Spanish by Patrick King, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of food and soda

loans.name: María Eugenia

texts.es:
La señora María Eugenia inicia su actividad  a las 7:00 am ofreciendo sus productos en las diferentes unidades inter urbanas y públicos en general de forma ambulante en el mercado la terminal.
Este crédito que solicito la señora Chavarria es para la compra de productos como: gaseosas, jugos, agua, y cosa de horno. 

Un hecho relevante de la señora María Eugenia es que este negocio lo inicio desde que era una niña alado de su mamá y fue en el mercado la terminal.

Es madre soltera de  tres niños, dos de ellos son los que  están en la escuela.
texts.en:
Mrs. Maria Eugenia starts working at 7:00 am selling her products to customers using local and interurban buses in the market at the bus terminal. Mrs. Chavarria will use this loan to buy products like soda, juice, water, and baked goods. A relevant fact is that Maria Eugenia has worked in this business since she was a child assisting her mother. She is a single mother with three children, two of whom are in school.

Translated from Spanish by Patrick King, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of soda, juice, water, and baked goods

loans.name: Melinda

texts.en:
Melinda V. is a 43-year-old woman, married and blessed with five children. She and her husband worked together to raise their big family. They are currently living at Brgy. Bombong, Binangonan, Rizal, Philippines. She is also a woman of good faith who defeats all challenges to reach her dreams. 

In 2008, she joined ASHI (Ahon sa Hirap, Inc.) a microfinance institution and KIVA partner in the Philippines. As a member of ASHI for almost two years, she has shown very good performance in her attendance in center meeting, weekly repayment and her business still exists; therefore, she is qualified to acquire larger loans. 

She runs a fish vending business and buys and sells rice and charcoal. She started her fish vending through her initiative of dealing with customers. She wants to continue her business; it gives them good income to support her five children's education. She is requesting a loan of PHP 15,000 to use for additional capital to improve her business and her income.

She dreams of growing her business. Her five children are her inspiration to pursue her fish vending business. She now feels very happy with the service of ASHI and KIVA. It gives them a big chance to pursue their family dreams. She hopes that they continue the service for a long time and help many families who want to get ahead.

About ASHI: 

Ahon sa Hirap Inc. (ASHI) has the distinction of being the oldest existing replication of the Grameen Bank Approach (GBA) to credit delivery to the bottom poor in the Philippines. With its outstanding achievements over the years, it has become one of the role models in credit delivery to the poor in the country.

loans.use: To have additional working capital

loans.name: Kyaliwajjala Group, Kampala

texts.en: N. Jane, at the top left, also appears in the group photo. She is the leader of her lending group in Kampala. She is a friendly lady and married with six children. One of her children is in the secondary section while five are in the primary section. She takes care of two dependants. Jane has had a retail shop in the Namugongo Nsawo zone for 10 years. She is able to make profits amounting to 85,000/= per week although she lacks enough capital for her business. She says that her good customer care skills have won her more customers and she would like to expand her shop further in the future as well as to have a well-off and educated family. Jane needs a loan to be able to buy more merchandise like sugar, cooking oil, bread, blue band (a spread for bread) and others for her shop.

loans.use: To buy more merchandise for her shop.

loans.name: Ana Elsy

texts.es: Ana Elsy G. de 40 años de edad, reside en el municipio de Soyapango, ubicado en el departamento de San Salvador. Vive junto a su esposo y sus dos hijos de 10 y 4 años de edad, los cuales se dedican a estudiar. Ana posee una panadería la cual esta ubicada en su propia casa. Ella se encarga de elaborar el pan, que posteriormente sale a vender por las calles de Soyapango, así mismo les entrega el pan a sus clientes en diferentes tiendas. Ana es una persona muy responsable quien siempre entrega sus pedidos a tiempo, y quien hace pan de muy buena calidad, razón por la cual cuenta con muchos clientes quienes incluso compran por unidad el pan en su casa. Ana solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda comprar mayor cantidad de harina, ya que en este momento ha aumentado de precio y ella desea contar con el dinero necesario para comprarla por mayor, así de esta manera podrá contar con provisiones, así también desea comprar manteca, levadura y azúcar, todo para la elaboración del pan.
texts.en:
Ana Elsy G. is 40 years old and lives in the municipality of Soyapango, located in the department of San Salvador. She lives together with her husband and two children, who are 10 and 4 years old and are in school. Ana owns a bakery, which is located in her own home. She makes bread, which she later sells on the streets of Soyapango and also brings to her customers in different shops. Ana is a very responsible person who always completes her orders on time and makes good quality bread, which is why she has many customers, including those who purchase bread by the unit at her house. Ana is requesting a loan which she can use to purchase more flour, since the price has now increased and she would like to have the money to purchase it at wholesale price so that she will have provisions. She also wants to buy lard, yeast, and sugar for making the bread.

Translated from Spanish by Kathleen O'Connell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of flour, lard, and sugar

loans.name: El Chilamate Group

texts.en:
The Chilamate Group includes Yahoska Rafaela Jirón Blandón, Eveling María Narváez Laínez and Elena de los Ángeles P. Mendoas.

Yahoska Rafaela Jirón Blandón is a woman entrepreneur who has worked very hard for the well being of her family.  For them, she began selling snacks, sodas, and juices, amongst other products.  Recently Yahoska has improved her business by turning it into a general store where even more products can be found including cosmetics, basic grains, sausages, meat, fruits, and vegetables.

Eveling María Narváez Laínez has been selling all types of products since 1995 including clothing, hair accessories, jewelry, and more. Elena de los Ángeles P. M. sells used clothing.

loans.use: To buy more products to sell in her store

loans.name: Felipe

texts.es: El señor Felipe M. es una persona separada y por tal motivo vive solo, el es pensionado y además inicio un negocio de nombre “Abarrotes July”, establecido desde hace un año, el es una persona muy trabajadora y con grandes deseos de salir adelante. Por tal motivo es su esfuerzo y dedicación. En estos momentos esta tramitando un crédito para la inversión a su negocio en compra de mercancía por mayoreo y así ofrecer mejores precios y además mayor ganancia.
texts.en:
Felipe M. is estranged and lives alone, and he is also a pensioner. In addition, he started a business named "Abarrotes July" one year ago. He is a very hard-working person with great hopes of getting ahead. For this reason he shows a lot of effort and dedication. Currently, he is applying for a loan to be able to invest in buying wholesale products for his business so as to offer better prices and gain a greater income.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Merchlewitz, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To invest in his business

loans.name: Reina Guadalupe

texts.es: Reina Guadalupe M. C. de 20 años de edad, vive junto a su madre y a su pequeña hija de 9 meses de edad. Reside en casa propia, la cual esta ubicada  en el departamento de Ahuachapán. Reina posee una tortillería, la cual esta ubicada en su propia casa, desde hace un tiempo atrás que ella se dedica a este oficio, debido a que es madre soltera, y que su madre sufre una enfermedad muy grabe, la cual le impide trabajar. Es por esta razón que Reina debe trabajar muy duro por seguir adelante tratando de crecer en su negocio de tortillas, ya que es esta la única fuente de ingresos con la que cuenta. Reina solicitó un préstamo a Integral con la esperanza de poder mejorar las condiciones de su negocio, ya que por medio de este ella comprará mayor cantidad de maíz, el cual al comprarlo por mayor lo obtiene a precios más bajos. Esto será de mucho beneficio para ella ya que le permitirá atender mayor demanda, lo cual le brindará mayores ganancias. Esto llena de muchas esperanzas a Reina ya que contará con el dinero necesario para brindarle todos los tratamientos médicos que su madre necesita.
texts.en:
Reina Guadalupe M. C. is 20 years old and lives together with her mother and her small, 9-month-old child. She lives in her own house, which is located in the department of Ahuachapán. Reina owns a tortilla shop, which is located in her own home. She has been in this business for some time, due to the fact that she is a single mother and her mother has a serious illness. This is why Reina must work very hard to continue progressing and trying to help her tortilla business grow, as it is the only source of income that she has. Reina requested a loan from Integral with the hope of being able to improve her business conditions. With this loan, she will purchase more corn and with purchasing it at wholesale price, it will be at a lower price. This will be of great benefit to her, as it will help her meet higher demand and provide her with higher earnings. This gives Reina a lot of hope, since she will have the necessary money to provide her mother with all of the medical treatments that she needs.

Translated from Spanish by Kathleen O'Connell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase wholesale corn

loans.name: Eddy

texts.en:
Eddy worked as a welder for several years before he was able to save the money necessary to start his own auto repair business. Originally a mechanic in Guatemala, Eddy was finally able to return to his preferred profession in 2008 when he opened the automotive shop with two friends.

It has not been an easy process – not long after opening, the economic crisis hit and Eddy and his partners often had conflicting ideas about how to best run the business. As Eddy found himself handling most of the mechanic work and finances on his own, he decided to buy out his friends and run the shop on his own. “It was a challenge to grow the business on my own, and to make sure that everything got done and my workers got paid. But now the business is sustainable and it’s growing!”

Thanks to Eddy’s solid skills as a mechanic and excellent rapport with his customers, his business growth has so far been sustained largely through referrals from existing clients. A $6,000 loan will allow Eddy to expand his inventory of auto parts to serve his clients better and faster, to invest in more marketing efforts to continue to grow business, and to hire a second full-time employee to help manage the growing workload.

In another year and a half Eddie would like to open another shop, and he says his dream is, “to own an auto chain like Speedy!”

Although the recession has affected business, Eddy is optimistic about the future and is proud to be able to provide for his family. Of his children, he says, “If they want to be mechanics and work in the shop it is here for them, but for now it is important that they study. I want them to be able to be whatever they want.”

loans.use: To expand his inventory of automotive parts, pay for a marketing campaign and hire a second employee

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more clothes and shoes to sell

loans.name: Milagros

texts.en: Milagros C. is from Barangay Bombong, Binangonan, Rizal. She is 40 years old, is married, and has five children. The eldest is 20 years old and the youngest is a 5-year-old kid. To make an income, Milagros runs a business selling small goods by going house to house in their village. She has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month. In 2008, Milagros joined ASHI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from ASHI. This previous loan was used to purchase more stock for her business. Milagros is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory, such as five sacks of rice, a container of gasoline, twenty sacks of charcoal, one gallon of cooking oil, and other supplies. This loan will be her 4th from ASHI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to expand her business. With the chance given to her family by ASHI, Kiva’s partner, the couple believes that they are getting closer to the achievement of their family dreams. About ASHI Ahon sa Hirap Inc. (ASHI) has the distinction of being the oldest existing replication of Grameen Bank Approach (GBA) to credit delivery to the bottom poor in the Philippines. With its outstanding achievements over the years, it has become one of the role models in credit delivery to the poor in the country.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory for her business

loans.name: Ma. Luisa

texts.es: La señora María Luisa N. vive con su pareja el señor Gerardo Domínguez el es pensionado de los Estados Unidos y ella labora para una casa como encargada de una persona enferma, viven solos ya que todos sus hijos están casados, están tramitando este crédito para la impermeabilización del techo de su casa; ya que con la temporada de lluvias se deterioro.
texts.en:
María Luisa N. lives with her partner, Gerardo Domínguez. He is retired from a job in the United States and she works in a private home caring for an ill person. They live alone since all their children are married. They are negotiating this loan in order to waterproof their roof because the rainy season deteriorated it.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To waterproof her roof.

loans.name: Digna Esperanza

texts.es: Digna esperanza P. de 39 años de edad, reside en el departamento de San Miguel, lugar en el cual vive junto a su esposo el cual trabaja como comerciante y  a sus seis hijos de 19, 18, 16, 8, 4 y 3 años de edad, de los cuales los dos menores no se dedican a estudiar. Digna se dedica a la venta de papas fritas, tostadas de yuca, plátano y pasteles de carne, este ultimo esta hecho a base de masa de maíz, la cual se rellena de verduras y luego se fríe, es un platillo típico del país el cual se acostumbra a comer por las tardes. El negocio esta ubicado en las cercanías de la iglesia católica del lugar. Esto le trae muchos beneficios ya que es un lugar muy transitado, en el cual las personas salen a comprar cada tarde algún tipo de platillo típico para disfrutar con sus familias. Digna solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda contar con el dinero necesario para comprar: papas, aceite, ejotes, zanahorias, ya que son estos los ingredientes principales de su venta. Digna posee una familia muy extensa, por la cual debe trabajar muy duro junto a su esposo, e por esto que con la esperanza de poder mejorar sus ventas y por ende sus ganancias, ella ha solicita un préstamo a Integral.
texts.en:
Digna Esperanza P. is 39 years old and lives in the department of San Miguel, where she lives together with her husband (who works as a salesman) and their six children (19, 18, 16, 8, 4, and 3 years old), the two youngest of which are not in school. Digna works selling french fries, fried yucca and bananas, and meat pies. The meat pies are made from a corn base and are filled with vegetables and then fried. It is a typical dish of El Salvador, which is usually eaten in the afternoons. Her business is located in the vicinity of the Catholic Church in the area. This brings her many benefits, as it is a busy area where people go shopping each afternoon to buy a typical dish to enjoy with their families. Digna is requesting a loan so she can have the necessary money to purchase potatoes, oil, green beans, and carrots, as these are the main ingredients for her sales. Digna have a very large family, so she must work very hard together with her husband. This is why she has requested a loan from Integral; because she has the hope of being able to improve her sales and her earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Kathleen O'Connell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase corn, vegetables, and fried yucca and bananas

loans.name: Dominga Yamilet

texts.es:
La señora Yamilet B. tiene la edad de 34 años, es casada y comerciante, se dedica a la venta ambulante de cosméticos Avon desde hace 7 años, el negocio lo inicio con la ayuda de su esposo y con el objetivo de tener otros ingresos y darle un mejor nivel de vida a sus 3 hijos los cuales están en edad escolar.
La señora trabaja con Ceprodel desde hace 4 años y hasta la fecha se le han otorgado 17 créditos y nos expresa que han sido de gran ayuda, ya que esto le permite invertir en su negocio y poder satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientes cuando le hacen los pedidos.
texts.en:
Yamilet B., 34, is married and has been an Avon products merchant for the past 7 years. She started her business with help from her husband; her aim was to earn extra income so that their three, school-aged children could have a better standard of living. She has collaborated with Ceprodel for 4 years and has had 17 loans to date. She tells us that they have been of great use to her making it possible for her to invest in her business and meet her customers' needs when they place their orders.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer
