loans.use: To buy men’s cologne, women’s perfume, lipsticks, eye shadow, vanities, shampoo, face and body creams, children’s cologne, lip-gloss.

loans.name: José Daniel

texts.es: José Daniel R. C. de de 36 años de edad, reside en Zacatecoluca, municipio ubicado en el departamento de La Paz. Vive junto a su esposa y su pequeño hijo de 6 años de edad. José posee una venta de bolsones, carteras, ropa y alpinas, las cuales comercializa a las afueras del mercado Municipal de Zacatecoluca, así mismo trabaja como empleado para una empresa privada por las noches. Durante el día su esposa le ayuda en el negocio vendiendo los productos de manera ambulante tanto adentro como afuera del mercado. José ha demostrado ser una persona muy trabajadora a quien no le importa esforzarse por sacar adelante a su familia, es por esto que él cuenta con muy buenas referencias por parte de sus vecinos, ya que siempre están tratando de salir adelante junto a su esposa, y velando por el bienestar de su hijo, el cual estudia en el kinder. José solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda aumentar su inventario, incrementando los productos que ya posee obteniendo diferentes estilos y colores de bolsones, esto le permitirá abarcar mayor cantidad de clientes, así mismo mayor cantidad de ropa, sobre todo para hombre que es la que más vende.
texts.en:
José Daniel R. C. is 36 years old and lives in Zacatecoluca, a municipality located in the department of La Paz. He lives together with his wife and their small 6-year old boy. José owns a business selling backpacks, purses, clothing and alpine clothing, which he sells in the outskirts of the Zacatecoluca municipal market. He also works as an employee for a private company at night. During the day, his wife helps him with the business selling the products on foot both inside and outside of the market. José has proven to be a very hardworking person who does not mind putting in effort to help his family move forward. This is why he has very good reference from his neighbors, as he is always trying to move forward with his wife and looking out for the well-being of his son, who is in kindergarten. José is requesting a loan to be able increase his inventory (increasing the number of products he already has, obtaining different styles and colors of backpacks). This will allow him to cover a larger number of customers. Likewise, have more clothing is important because it is what he sells the most.

Translated from Spanish by Kathleen O'Connell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase clothing and backpacks

loans.name: Kadiatu

texts.en: Kadiatu K. makes a living selling cooking items in her town's central market. She has been in this business for 22 years, while her husband makes a living selling various food items. She has 10 children, works very hard, and does not often get assistance from other people.  Her long-term goal is to buy the stall she works in so that she no longer needs to pay rent. Kadiatu believes this will be possible because she has an outstanding credit history and is a member of a loan group.  She is applying for a loan to support her children and build a house on land that she recently acquired.

loans.use: To increase her income by buying more items to sell.

loans.name: Maribel

texts.es: La señora Maribel es casada con el señor Esteban Garcia, y son padres de familia de 3 hijos, son una familia muy unida y responsable, pero sobretodo muy trabajadora. El tiene su negocio propio de la venta de herramientas y aparatos electrónicos, y ella también es propietaria de un negocio de la venta de ropa y calzado para dama seminuevos. Ellos están tramitando este crédito para invertir en más producto para sus negocios ya que desean surtir por mayoreo; y así tendrán una gran variedad en venta y sus clientes seguirán prefiriéndolos.
texts.en:
Maribel is married to Esteban García and they have three children; they are a very unified and responsible family but, above all, a very hard-working one. He has his own business, which consists of the sale of tools and electronic items and she owns a used clothing and women's footwear sales business. They are negotiating this loan in order to invest in more product for their businesses because they would like to sell at wholesale; this will make it possible for them to have a greater variety of stock available for sale and their customers will continue to prefer them.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy stock inventory merchandise.

loans.name: José Miguel

texts.es: José Miguel A. R. de 28 años de edad, reside en el departamento de San Miguel, lugar en el cual vive junto a su madre y su hermana. José es un hombre muy soñador y visionario quien estudió odontología en la universidad, esto con el deseo de poder ayudar a otras personas que lo necesitaran. Es por esto que hace 2 años que el inició su propio consultorio, el cual esta ubicado en su propia casa de habitación. José solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda contar con el dinero necesario para invertir en su consultorio, adquiriendo todos los elementos necesarios para elaborar su trabajo, así mismo a través del préstamo solicitado a Integral, el espera comprar maquinaria mucho más moderna con el fin de brindar un mejor servicio a sus clientes. José posee el deseo de poder poner en práctica todo lo aprendido durante muchos años, lo cual lo ha ido logrando poco a poco, pero que ha pesar de todos sus esfuerzos aún no lograba obtener muchas de las herramientas que el deseaba para su consultorio, ahora el ve una esperanza, ya que con el dinero obtenido se le facilitará en gran manera equipar su negocio.
texts.en:
José Miguel A. R., 28 years of age, resides in the department of San Miguel, El Salvador He lives together with his mother and sister. José is a dreamer and a visionary, having studied dentistry at university with the hope of being able to offer help to others who may need it. This wish of his led José to open his own dental practice 2 years ago, setting up an office within his own house. Jose requests a loan through which he would be able to have sufficient money to invest in his dental office, acquiring all the necessary elements to properly carry out his work. He also hopes to use the loan he requests from Integral to purchase much more modern machinery, for the purpose of offering better services to his patients. José hopes very much to put into practice all of the skills he learned during his many years of school. Bit by bit, he has been able to expand his office's capacity for dental service, but in spite of all his efforts,he still has not been able to obtain many of the tools that he needs to offer a full range of high quality dental services. Today, he sees cause for hope in the loan he requests, since the money he obtains would finally enable him to fully equip his dental practice.

Translated from Spanish by Kevin Lenhart, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Compra de equipo para clinica dental.

loans.name: Marie

texts.en: Marie J. is a businesswoman who makes a living selling provisions and other cooking items at the central market in her town, which is named Bo. She has been in this line of work for 20 years, while her husband makes a living as a tailor. They have eight children. Marie is applying for a loan to buy supplies in bulk from a wholesaler. She has an outstanding credit history and is a member of a loan group. She will use the increased income made possible by this loan to pay for the schooling of her children and complete work on her new store.

loans.use: To buy more items to sell to her customers

loans.name: Hilda Veronica

texts.es:
La Sra. Hilda Martínez vende productos de la AVON, ZERMAT, ORIFLAME,  por catalogo.
Ella va a utilizar el crédito para comprar más productos, ya que le encargaron un pedido grande y los ingresos que tiene ahorita no le cubren para comprar el paquete. 
Su negocio comenzó cuando ella vendía productos de la AVON ambulante, hoy en día trabaja con 3 casas de productos diferentes (AVON, ZERMAT, ORIFLAME).
Ella dice estar agradecida con CEPRODEL, por la confianza que ha depositado en ella en hacerle este préstamo y dice no decepcionar a la institución para poder seguir trabajando con la institución ya que es el primer crédito que tiene hasta ahora con Ceprodel.
texts.en:
Hilda Martínez sells AVON, ZERMAT, and ORIFLAME products by catalogue. She will use the funds to buy more product because she has a large order to fill and she lacks the necessary funds to purchase the entire package. She began her business as a door-to-door AVON salesperson. Today, she works with three different cosmetic companies (AVON, ZERMAT, ORIFLAME). She says that she is grateful to CEPRODEL for the trust they have placed in her by granting the loan and she states that she will not disappoint the institution so that she may continue to collaborate with it since this is her first loan to date with Ceprodel.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy catalogue cosmetics.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn L. is 41 years old, married and blessed with seven children, all of whom need her support. She and her husband work hard to raise their big family, and their children have given them an incentive to pursue their dreams.

Her husband’s income is insufficient to the needs of their family, which is why Jocelyn joined ASHI in 2005. ASHI is a microfinance institution and Kiva Partner in the Philippines, and exists to provide people with working capital. Since receiving her first loan, Jocelyn has carefully invested to her hog-raising business, which has gone smoothly and generated a good income. She wants to continue in this line of work and make more investments in it.

She has applied for her fourth loan from ASHI, for 20,000 PHP, to expand her business by buying additional piglets, vitamins and feed. Her long-term goal is to escape from poverty and send all of her children to college. 

About ASHI: Ahon sa Hirap Inc. (ASHI) is the oldest example of the Grameen Bank's Approach (GBA) to credit delivery to the lowest-income people in the Philippines.

loans.use: To buy additional piglets, vitamins, and feeds.

loans.name: Teresa

texts.es:
L a señora Teresa M. es casada, tiene la edad de 42 años y con 2 hijos de los cuales uno de ellos esta bajo su carga familiar y es estudiante universitario. Doña Teresa es Psicóloga y trabaja para el Minsa Posoltega de donde ella es originaria, labora desde hace 24 años y se desempeña como jefe de brigada de enfermedades de transmisión vectorial. 
Ella tiene 4 años de trabajar con Ceprodel y los créditos que se le han otorgado han sido de gran ayuda, ya que los 3 primeros fueron para mejoramiento de vivienda y este último que lo solicito para gastos médicos.
texts.en:
Teresa M., 42, is married and has two children, one of whom is still dependent on her; he is a university student. Teresa is a psychologist employed by the Ministry of Health in Posoltega, which is where she is from. She has worked for 24 years and is head of a vector transmission diseases nursing brigade. She has collaborated with Ceprodel for 4 years and the loans she has gotten have been of great help to her; she used the first three for home improvements and this last one is to cover medical expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For personal expenses (medical tests and medicine)

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: For housing repairs and interior walls sealing.

loans.name: Mariano De Jesus

texts.es:
El Sr. Mariano M. tiene una granja  de cerdos  en su casa de habitación que está ubicada en Puente de hoyo, municipio del Viejo.
EL va a usar este crédito para la compra y crianza de cerdos.
El quiere engrandecer la granja de cerdos ya que piensa en poner un puesto de destace de cerdos en su casa, para tener más ingresos y así llevar el alimento a su hogar. 
El Sr. Mariano M. dice estar agradecido con CEPRODEL, ya que gracias a la ayuda que la institución le ha brindado le ha servido de mucho para obtener mejores  ingresos así como el desarrollo en su vida familiar.
texts.en:
Mariano M. has a pig farm in the yard of his home, which is located in Puente de Hoyo, in the municipality of Viejo. He is going to use this loan to buy and raise pigs. He wants to enlarge his pig farm, and is thinking of adding a butchering post to his home to increase his income and to provide food for his household. Mariano M. says that he is grateful to CEPRODEL, since thanks to the help he has gotten from the institution he has been able to increase his income and in this way improve his family's life.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy pigs to fatten and then slaughter

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn M. is 39 years old, married, has eight children, and lives in the province of Rizal with her husband Ronnie. To supply additional income for her family, Jocelyn has spent the last five years raising hogs. Her husband is an electrician and works closely with her.

Jocelyn would like to obtain a loan to pay for more piglets, vitamins, and feed. Buying these items, she believes, will allow her to increase her monthly income.  Since 2005, she has been a proud member of Ahon Sa Hirap, Inc. (ASHI), a Kiva microfinance partner in the Philippines. Jocelyn has been a devoted advocate, regularly attending weekly meetings and making on-time payments for previous loans.

Her long-term goals are to expand her business and educate all eight of her children. She also dreams of enjoying a brighter tomorrow and a higher standard of living. 

About ASHI: Ahon sa Hirap Inc. (ASHI) is the oldest example of the Grameen Bank Approach (GBA) to credit delivery to the poorest people in the Philippines.

loans.use: To buy additional piglets, vitamins, and feeds.

loans.name: Adrián Natividad

texts.es: Adrián Natividad B. de 37 años de edad, reside en el departamento de San Miguel, lugar en el cual vive junto a su esposa quien se dedica a los quehaceres del hogar y junto a sus cuatro hijos, los cuales asisten a la escuela del lugar en el que viven. Adrián es un hombre muy responsable quien de lunes a domingo sale a trabajar por el bienestar de su familia. Él se dedica a la venta de relojes, baterías y repuestos para estos; así mismo comercializa accesorios para el cabello, cremas, talcos, y ropa. Todo esto lo comercializa en su casa con la ayuda de su esposa, ya que el trabaja todo el día ofreciendo sus productos de forma ambulante por las calles y cantones de San Miguel, esto le permite obtener mayores ganancias, lo cual es de mucha importancia para él ya que es la única fuente de ingresos con la que cuenta. Adrián solicita un préstamo con el fin de poder aumentar la cantidad de productos, y de esta manera poder ofrecer mayor variedad a sus clientes. Cada día Adrián debe esforzarse al máximo, debido a que sus ganancias son diarias de lo cual debe utilizar en gran parte para los gastos del hogar, quedándole poco para invertir en el negocio.
texts.en:
Adrián Natividad B., age 37, lives in the department of San Miguel. He lives with his wife, who dedicates herself to the household chores, and their four children. The children go to the school in the area where they live. Adrián is a very responsible man who goes to work Monday through Sunday for his family’s well-being. He sells watches, batteries, and replacement parts for watches. At the same time he sells hair accessories, creams, powder, and clothes. He sells all of this in his house with his wife’s help. He works all day offering his products as a traveling salesman in the streets and cantons of San Miguel. This allows him to get greater earnings. This income is very important to him because it is the only source of income that he has. Adrián is requesting a loan to be able to increase the quantity of products he has. This way he will be able to offer his customers greater variety. Each day Adrián needs to put forth his maximum effort because he needs to use most of his daily earnings for the household expenses. Little is left to invest in the business.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy clothes, watches, and hair accessories

loans.name: Nery

texts.es: Nery P. D. A. D. 38 años D. edad, resiD. en el departamento D. San Salvador, lugar en el cual vive en el cual vive en compañía D. sus tres hijos D. 21, 18, y 16 años D. edad. Nery posee una tienda D. abarrotes, en los cuales comercializa productos D. primera necesidad como pastas, pan, huevos y otros más los cuales son fundamentales dentro D. un hogar. Ella cuenta con 5 años D. poseer el negocio, el cual le ha permitido ir mejorando su economía familiar, la cual en muchas ocasiones es bastante mala, sobre todo porque muchas veces ella no cuenta con todos los productos que las personas buscan lo cual le baja en gran manera sus ganancias. Es por esta razón que Nery solicita un préstamo a integral, con el fin D. poder contar con el dinero necesario para poder surtir su negocio con esos productos tan necesarios que no posee, así mismo con el deseo D. poder aumentar la cantidad D. los que ya posee. Nery desea mejorar su negocio, sobre todo porque ella es madre soltera, y debe velar por sus hijos cada día, esto a pesar que uno D. los hijos mayores trabaja, esto no da abasto con los gastos del hogar, razón Por la cual Nery posee la esperanza D. poder mejorar su situación gracias a este préstamo.
texts.en:
Nery P. D. A., 38, lives in San Salvador department with her three children, who are 21, 18 and 16 years of age. Nery has a grocery store where she sells basic items like: pasta, bread, eggs and others that are basic in any home. She has had the store for 5 years and it has make it possible for her to improve the family's economic situation which, on many occasions is quite bad, above all because she often lacks all the products that customers are looking for and this lowers her profits. For this reason, Nery is asking Integral for funding in order to be able to stock her store with the items she doesn't have as well as to increase quantities of those items she does have. Nery wishes to improve her business, above all because she's a single mother and must watch over her children every day; even though one of her older children is employed, this is still not enough to meet all household expenses. Nery hopes to be able to improve her situation thanks to this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy stock items for her store.

loans.name: Álvaro

texts.es: Álvaro A. A. de 65 años de edad, reside en Atiquizaya, ubicado en el departamento de Ahuachapán. Vive en casa propia, en compañía de su esposa quien se dedica a los quehaceres del hogar y un hijo el cual trabaja para solventar sus gastos personales y brindarles una pequeña ayuda a sus padres. Álvaro posee una venta de medicinas y algodón, la cual esta ubicada en su casa de habitación. Desde hace 10 años que él posee este negocio, a través del cual se ha ganado la vida, ya que las medicinas le brindan muy buenas ganancias. Álvaro solicita un préstamo a través del cual él pueda comprar mayor cantidad de medicinas, de manera que su negocio pueda crecer y le brinde una esperanza de poder mejorar su estabilidad económica. Álvaro es un señor el cual busca la manera de seguir adelante y poder mejorar en la vida.
texts.en:
Álvaro A. A. is 60 years old and lives in Atiquizaya, located in the department of Ahuachapán. He lives in his own home with his wife, who is dedicated to the household tasks, and a son who works to cover his personal expenses and to provide a small amount of help to his parents. Alvaro has a business selling medicines and cotton wool which is located in the house where he lives. He has had this business for 10 years, and through this business he has made his living, since the sale of medicines provides very good earnings. Alvaro requests a loan that he will use to buy a larger quantity of medicines, so that his business can grow and provide him with the hope of having increased economic stability. Alvaro is a man who is always looking for a way to get ahead and improve his life.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy medicine

loans.name: Dolores Del Carmen

texts.es: Dolores del Carmen P. D. F. D. 47 años D. edad, resiD. en Ilopango, ubicado en el departamento D. San Salvador, lugar en el cual vive junto a su esposo el cual trabaja como carpintero y su hija D. 17 años D. edad, la cual se dedica a estudiar. Dolores D. dedica a la venta D. cosméticos, los cuales comercializa en su hogar y así mismo D. forma ambulante con sus vecinas y amigas D. la colonia. También hace almuerzos en su casa, los cuales ya tiene cinco años D. comercializar, lo que le ha permitido contar con varios clientes fijos. Dolores solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda comprar mayor cantidad D. materia prima para la elaboración D. la comida, y D. esta forma poder atender  a más clientes, los que muchas veces no pueden adquirir sus alimentos ya que se terminan con rapidez, así también ella espera comprar más cosméticos en diferentes precios, lo cual le permita abarcar mayor cantidad D. clientes. Esto la llena D. mucho ilusión puesto que le permitirá aumentar sus ventas y D. esta forma ayudarle a su esposo con todos los gastos del hogar.
texts.en:
. Dolores del Carmen P. D. F., 47, lives in Ilopango, San Salvador department, with her husband, who is a carpenter, and their 17-year-old daughter, who is a student. Dolores sells cosmetics from home and door-to-door among her friends and neighbors. She also prepares lunches at home which she has been selling for five years now; this has created a regular customer base. Dolores is asking for funding to buy a larger quantity of ingredients for her lunches so that she can increase the number of customers served; often, some are unable to buy her lunches because she runs out of them too soon. She also hopes to buy more cosmetics at a variety of prices so that she can attract a wider variety of customers. This fills her with hope that her sales will increase and she will be able to help her husband meet household expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cosmetics and ingredients for meals preparation.

loans.name: Arlie

texts.en:
Arlie M. lives in the village of Disud, Sindangan, Zamboanga del Norte. She is 39 years old, married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Arlie has run a general store for the last eight years. In February 2010, she joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her life and business. She is requesting a loan of 20,000 PHP, her first, to buy additional items to sell and increase her supply of working capital. 

About PMPC:
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy additional items to sell and increase her supply of working capital

loans.name: Diosa

texts.en: Diosa J. is from the village of Tubod, Aloran, Misamis Occidental. She is 44 years old. Diosa is married and has three adult children. To make a living, Diosa makes and sells food. The main source of income for the business comes from selling snacks and other delicacies in the local community. Diosa has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 3,000 Philippine pesos a month for these activities. In 2005, Diosa joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Diosa has successfully repaid a previous loan of 14,900 PHP from PMPC, a Kiva partner. This previous loan was used to invest in expanding the business. Diosa is requesting a new loan of 14,900 PHP which will also be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the seventh loan taken out by Diosa from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Mario

texts.es:
Mario Rodríguez Ramírez esta preocupado por el bienestar de su familia con ahorros propios construyo su vivienda. El señor es padres de 5 hijos y una de sus hijas es madre soltera en la que sigue apoyando moralmente; es por ello que quiere construir una recamara en la parte de arriba de su casa para que tenga privacidad junto con su hijo pequeño. Mario y su hija son las personas que trabajan ya que la esposa se queda a cargo de sus demás hijos para darles mejor atención. 
Mario es una persona que desea darle lo mejor a sus hijos es por ello que pide el apoyo para poder realizar su proyecto y seguir ayudando a su hija.
texts.en:
Mario Rodríguez Ramírez cares about his family's wellbeing. He used his own savings to build his house. He is the father of 5 children and one of his daughters is a single mother, to whom he continues to offer moral support. For this reason, he wants to build a bedroom on the top of his house so that she and her small son can have privacy. Mario and his daughter are the members of the family that work because his wife says home to care for the rest of the children. Mario is a person who wants the best for his children and asks for this help to complete this project so that he can continue to help his daughter.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To build a bedroom for his daughter.

loans.name: Danilo

texts.en:
Danilo A. is from the village of Lingion, Talakag Bukidnon. He is 37 years old. Danilo is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Danilo owns and operates a a service-based business. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from providing transport services to local community members. Danilo has been a driver for over 8 years and earns approximately 2,500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Danilo joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Danilo is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP, which will be used to purchase materials needed to expand the services he provides. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Danilo from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his business.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To expand his transportation service

loans.name: Patricio

texts.es:
Patricio Gómez L. es un chofer de transporte urbano desde hace 29 años donde el es concesionario y tiene su propio camión para trabajar. El es una persona responsable en su trabajo y da un buen trato a sus pasajeros. 
Para seguir dando la mejor atención, el desea darle mantenimiento a su camión para que este en muy buenas condiciones y no pueda suceder algún percance en la carretera cuando lleva pasajeros.
texts.en:
Patricio Gómez L. has been a public transportation driver for 29 years. He works on his own, and he has his own bus in order to work. He is a responsible person in his work, and he treats his passengers well. To keep giving the best service, he wants to have maintenance performed on his bus so that it will be in good condition. He wants to make sure that nothing unfortunate can happen while he is on the road with passengers.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Perform maintenance on his bus

loans.name: Dionesio

texts.en:
Dionesio S. is from the village of Lingion, Talakag Bukidnon. He is 53 years old. Dionesio is married and has adult-aged children. To make a living, Dionesio owns and operates a service-based business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from providing transportation services with the used of his motor vehicle. Dionesio has been engaged in his business for over 20 years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Dionesio joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Dionesio is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP, which will be used to purchase materials needed to provide service. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Dionesio from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the income of his family.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase materials for his business

loans.name: Avelina

texts.en:
Avelina V. is 75 years of age. Despite her age, the woman still possesses strength and determination to change her standard of living, along with her husband, who is as old as she is. Avelina and her husband Angel are blessed with a child whom they cherished, nurtured, and loved when he was still young. Now that their child has his own family, Avelina has to think about herself and her husband so that their child will not to worry so much about them being poor but will be able to focus on growing his own family, especially in attending to the needs of his children.

Therefore, Avelina and her husband agreed to become a member of ASHI, Kiva's field partner in the Philippines, in order to have access to loans. Since joining ASHI in 2006, Avelina has taken out three loans. Those loans were managed well and enabled Avelina and her husband have a business which is their source of income.

The primary income-generating activity for Avelina and her husband is selling food such as boiled peanuts, sweetened banana and sweetened potato. They also buy and sell fresh agricultural crops in the public market of the neighboring municipalities. Being in this business for three-going-on-four years now, Aveline and her husband have gained customers from different municipalities and villages.

To increase the volume of the products they sell, and to supply the demand of their increasing number customers, Avelina is requesting a much larger loan. Through her business proceeds, she hopes to make her dreams come true and help her grandchild’s education in college, taking up nursing.

loans.use: To purchase fruits and variety of agricultural crops to sell

loans.name: Catalina

texts.en:
Catalina U. is from the village of Brgy.4, Talakag Bukidnon. She is 44 years old. Catalina is widowed and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Catalina owns and operates a business venture in the food sector running a food stall. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling a variety of viands and other items in the local community. Catalina has been engaged in her business for over 12 years and earns approximately 12,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Catalina joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Catalina is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Catalina from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Nub

texts.en:
Nub S., age 45, is married and resides with her husband in Takeo Province, Cambodia. She has three children. Her husband is a farmer and also breaks stone at the mountain for sale, earning an income of US$2.5 per day.

S. is engaged in a business of weaving Cambodian traditional silk, earning approximately an income of US$1.3 per day. By doing so, she is able to cover her family expenses, especially for the children’s education. She has been with this business since 2000. Her family's standard of living has improved since S. started this business, so she wants a loan to expand her business. S. is requesting a loan of USD $600 to purchase a motorbike for her husband to commute to work. This is her first loan from CREDIT, a Kiva partner. (S. is pictured with her husband)

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for her husband's commute

loans.name: Cynthia

texts.en:
Cynthia B. is from the village of Magsaysay Street, San Pedro, Initao, Misamis Oriental. She is 45 years old. Cynthia is married and has 1 school-aged child. To make a living, Cynthia owns and operates a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling vegetables and cooking ingredients in the local community and in the local market. Cynthia has been engaged in her business for over 6 years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Cynthia joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Cynthia is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Cynthia from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income.

NOTE: The photo was taken while Cynthia was helping a customer.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand her product offering

loans.name: Chum

texts.en:
Chum P., age 60, is married and resides with her husband in Takeo Province, Cambodia. She has two children.

She is engaged in the agriculture sector with her her husband, earning an income of approximately US$ 0.5 each per day. By doing so, she is able to cover her family's expenses, especially the children’s education. She has been in this business since 1979. The family is assisted mainly by her two children, who are currently working at a local garment factory.

P. is requesting a loan of USD 1000 to purchase a motorbike for her children to use to commute to work. This is her first loan from CREDIT, a partner of Kiva. (P. is pictured with her husband.)

loans.use: To buy a motorbike

loans.name: Son's Group

texts.en: Son P. is a stable laborer who works in the busy fish market. Also, she is hired by people to help carry their fish. She was born in 1982 and has been married for many years to Mr. Ouk Vuthy, age 27. Her husband is a truck driver in the fish sale location. Together they make $5 per day. This couple has three young children who are enrolled in primary school and dependent on their income. Son P. is taking out her loan to mend/decorate her old house. This group loan has been applied for by four low-income people. Mrs. Son P. has been promoted by the other members of the group to be the leader. The other borrowers are: Seng T., a cake seller, who requests a loan to increase her business capital; Ma R., who is a cleaner and asking for a loan to repair her existing house; and Lem S. is a grocery seller who needs a loan to accumulate the quantity of her inventory.

loans.use: To mend/decorate her old house.

loans.name: Prum

texts.en:
Prum V., age 43, is married and resides with her husband in Takeo Province, Cambodia. She has two children.

She and her husband are construction workers, earning approximately an income of US$ 3.5 each per day. By doing so, she is able to cover her family's expenses, especially the children’s education. She has been in this business since 1998. Her standard of living has been improved since V. is with this job.

V. is requesting a loan of USD 500 to purchase a motorbike for her husband to use to commute to work. This is her first loan from CREDIT, a partner of KiV.. (V. is pictured with her husband.)

loans.use: To buy a motorbike

loans.name: Noel

texts.en:
Noel H. is from the village of Sto. Nino, Talakag Bukidnon. He is 51 years old. Noel is married and has 5 adult-aged children. To make a living, Noel owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising pigs and chicken for sale. Noel has been engaged in his business for over 20 years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Noel joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Noel is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional animals. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Noel from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his business.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional animals

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
Delia L. is from the village of Purok 1, San Pedro, Initao, Misamis Oriental. She is 46 years old. Delia is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Delia owns and operates a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling vegetables and cooking ingredients in the local community. Delia has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Delia joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Delia is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Delia from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement income of her family and support the education of her children.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

Because of this problem, S. is looking for a loan to buy a pump to pump the water for her crops. The family has five school-aged kids.

loans.name: Fe

texts.en: Fe J. is from the village of Mahayahay, Initao, Misamis Oriental. She is 46 years old, is married, and has two school-aged children. Fe owns and operates a specialized retail business, selling RTWs (Ready-To-Wear clothes - used clothes), dried fish and processed meat in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 3,500 PHP a month. In 2010, Fe joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her first from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the income of her family. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. loans.name: Sherlita's Group

texts.en:
Sherlita M. is from the village of Villa Marzo. Sherlita is the group leader of a 6-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. 

Sherlita is 48 years old and married, with 2 adult-aged children. To make a living, Sherlita raises livestock. The main source of income for her business comes from raising pigs for fattening and sale. Sherlita has been in business for more than 2 years and earns approximately 3500 PHP whenever she sells her raised animals.

In 2008, Sherlita joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Sherlita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15000 PHP from ASKI, which she used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. Sherlita is requesting a new loan of 17000 PHP to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. This loan will be the sixth loan taken out by Sherlita from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fishers and small entrepreneurs.

Firmen plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand his business. Roxann has been engaged in her business for more than 3 years and earns approximately 15000 PHP a month for these activities.

This year, Roxann joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Roxann is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP to repair a transport vehicle used in the business. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support members of her extended family. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fishers and small entrepreneurs.

loans.name: Brenda

texts.en: Brenda L. is from the village of Gimangpang, Initao, Misamis Oriental. She is 35 years old, is married, and has three school-aged children. Brenda owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail store, selling a variety of different products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month. In 2010, Brenda joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her first from HSPFI. Brenda plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family’s income and to support the education of her children. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. loans.name: Run

texts.en:
S. Run, age 35, is a widowed silk scarf weaver who lives in the Takeo Province with three young children and one of her sisters. She typically makes about US $6.00 each day, and her sister, S. Ry, makes about US $3.00 each day as a garment factory worker. 

S. Run would like a loan of US $1200 to reinvest in her silk scarf business. She will purchase more silk scarves from the weavers in the village and resell them to the market wholesaler. This business will increase her profits and it would also allow her to save even more for her children’s education in the future. 

S. Run appears in the picture with her sister.

loans.use: To buy scarves to sell

loans.name: Mil

texts.en: Mil L. has her own small business and her main activity is to sell groceries in front of her home. She sells her items to people who live nearby her house. She is blessed with two kids who are pupils in primary school. Also, Mil L. relies on her husband’s income. He works in construction. Mil L. is very busy with her business due to there being a lot of clients who need her products. To satisfy her customers' needs, Mil L. is requesting a loan to order more grocery inventory for her store.

loans.use: To order more grocery inventory for her store.

loans.name: Keoun

texts.en: N. Keoun, age 27, is a farmer who lives with her husband and two young children in Takeo Province. N. Keoun and her husband sell coconuts. She typically makes about US $1.00 each day and her husband, Oun Eng, makes about US $5.00 each day. The weather conditions have been difficult in Cambodia this past year and inflation has also been out of control. These factors have played into a difficult economic year for many Cambodians, N. Keoun included. N. Keoun would like a loan of US $400 to purchase a trailer to transport more coconuts to the local market to sell.

loans.use: To purchase a trailer for her business

loans.name: Nhek

texts.en:
Nhek S., age 52, is widowed and resides with her children in Kompong Chnang Province, Cambodia. She has six children. She sells vegetables and fruits, earning approximately US $7.00 per day. By doing so, she is able to cover her family's expenses, especially her children’s education. She has been in this business since 1981. The family is also assisted by her three children who work at different workplace to support the family. Their standard of living has been improved since S. started her business, so she wants a loan to expand her business. 

S. is requesting a loan of USD $700 to purchase more vegetables and fruits to sell. This is her first loan from CREDIT, a Kiva field partner. 

S. and her daughter appear in the photograph.

loans.use: To buy more fruits and vegetables to sell

loans.name: Sreyoun

texts.en:
C. Sreyoun, age 39, has been selling groceries in the local market in Takeo Province since 1998. Every day, she is able to make about US $3.00 in profits. Her husband is a construction worker who is able to make only US $2.00 each day. This couple has three children living at home to support.

C. Sreyoun plans to open another business so that her family can make more income to improve their standard of living. She will take a loan of US $400 for her husband to purchase a motorbike. Her husband will use the motorbike to transport vegetables to the village to sell them.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike for her vegetable business

loans.name: Sreymom

texts.en:
C. Sreymom, age 27, is married and has two young children living at home. The family lives in Takeo Province. She and her husband have business selling grilled bananas. On average, she is able to make around US $5.00 a day. 

Because this business makes a significant income, C. Sreymom would like to take a loan of US $350 to reinvest in her business. She would like to use this money to purchase a motorbike and a trailer so that she and her husband can transport and sell grilled bananas around the village.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike for her food business

loans.name: Eannys

texts.es:
Eannys  C. A. vive en el barrio los Cusules de Soledad, se dedica con su esposo a la elaboración de calzados para damas,  tienen 3 hijos en las edades de 7,12 y 16 años.
Su negocio lo inició cuando una entidad estatal le dio un curso de modelaje de calzado donde aprendió el arte y luego accedió a su capital semilla, con el que compró una maquina y  herramientas para elaborar sus primeros calzados, posteriormente contrató a un empleado para aumentar la producción y de él aprendió su esposo, quien se adicionó productivamente a este negocio; este es su segundo crédito  con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo por valor de $1,000.000, el cual utilizará  en la compra de materias primas como odena, tacones material sintético, capelladas y suelas, para elaborar calzado femenino; ella vende a comerciantes por docenas  e individualmente   a clientes que le encargan de acuerdo a una revista, donde ellos eligen el modelo que desea les elabore.
Su desafío más importante es la competencia,  porque dice que el mercado está saturado de calzado a muy bajo precio, pero no tienen la calidad del calzado que ellos fabrican, esto se refleja en  la durabilidad y en los buenos materiales que utilizan y de esta manera lo ha asimilado su clientela. Su sueño es salir adelante en su negocio, para establecer las bases de sostenimiento futuro para su familia, especialmente para que sus hijos estudien y sean exitosos y para que mas personas tengan un empleo.
texts.en:
Eannys C. A. lives in the Cusules de Soledad neighborhood. She and her husband, who have three children that range in ages from 7 to 16 years, are ladies shoes manufacturers. She started the business after a State-run entity had a course on shoe modelling where she learned this skill. Later, she was able to gather seed money that she used to buy a machine and tools to make her first shoes. After that, she hired an employee to increase production and he trained her husband, who became proficient in this work. This is her second loan with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo; it is valued at $1,000.000 and will be used to buy raw materials and supplies like: sandals, heels, synthetic materials, soles, etc. to make ladies shoes. She sells to merchants by the dozen and to individuals, who order the style of shoe they want made from a catalogue, by the unit. Her most important challenge is competition because she says that the market is saturated with low-price footwear. However, these are not of the same high quality as the shoes she makes. This is reflected in their durability and the fine materials they use. Their customers have understood this. Her dream is to succeed with her business in order to set bases for her family's future support, especially so that her children will study and be successful and so that she can provide employment for others.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy shoe-making supplies and raw materials.

loans.name: Jeza

texts.en:
Jeza N. is from the village of Pangantucan , Bukidnon. She is 30 years old. Jeza is married and has 2 school-aged children.

To make a living Jeza sells seafood products including fish and shrimp to the local community. Jeza has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 6000 PHP a month.

In 2008, Jeza joined HSPFI to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jeza successfully repaid a previous loan of 8000 PHP from HSPFI which she used to purchase additional products to sell. Jeza is requesting her third loan from HSPFI, for 11000 PHP, which she will invest in her business.

About HSPFI

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

loans.name: Treng

texts.en:
Treng V., age 45, is married and resides with her family in Kompong Chnang Province, Cambodia. She has four children.

She and her husband are involved in the construction business as construction foremen, each earning approximately US $7 per day. V. is able to cover her family expenses, especially for the children’s education. She has been with this business since 2000.

The family is also assisted by two of her children who are currently working at a local garment factory. The family's standard of living has improved since V. is with this business, so she wants to take a loan to expand her business.

V. is requesting a loan of USD $600 to purchase more construction tools to expand the current business. This is her third loan from Kiva partner CREDIT.

loans.use: To buy construction tools to expand the business.

loans.name: Sepha

texts.en:
G. Sepha, 45, is a state teacher in the Takeo province. He is married with five children. Two are students and three are employed as garment factory workers.

On average, G. Sepha is able to make about US$2 a day, while his wife, pictured here, sells vegetables and beef at the local market. She is able to make US$2 of profit a day as well.

Due to the high transportation costs that her children spend every day to commute to work, G. Sepha would like to purchase a motorbike for her children. This will help reduce transportation costs and allow her children to save even more.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike.

loans.name: Ariel

texts.en:
Ariel G. is from the town of Rosary Ville, Sto. Rosario Capas, Tarlac. He is 43 years old. Ariel is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Ariel owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector operating a clothing business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from providing general clothing and slippers services to local community members. Ariel has been engaged in his business for over 10 years and earns approximately 20,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Ariel joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Ariel is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional inventory and working capital. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Ariel from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the borrower's business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and working capital.

loans.name: Elvira

texts.en:
Elvira M. is from the village of Gimangpang, Initao, Misamis Oriental. She is 58 years old. Elvira is married and has 4 adult-aged children.

To make a living Elvira operates a sari-sari (variety) retail store where she sells a variety of different products in the local community. Elvira has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 4000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Elvira joined HSPFI to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Elvira is requesting her first loan from HSPFI, for 5000 PHP, which she will use to purchase additional products to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue to supplement her family's income.

loans.name: Nancy Esther

texts.es:
Nancy Esther Sanjuán E. vive con su esposo y sus 3 hijos   de 10 17 y 21 años de edad  en la Ciudadela Metropolitana,  barrio ubicado en Soledad –Atlántico.
Nancy quería sentirse independiente e inició su negocio aprovechando tanto el conocimiento de su esposo (a su lado) en la línea de soldadura, como su capacidad administrativa natural;  por eso respondió a su deseo de  capacitarse en emprendimiento y manejo administrativo de negocios y se preparó previamente  antes de la puesta en marcha del  “Taller de Herrería y ornamentación Stefany”   que hoy es la base del sustento familiar  y es el espacio en el que los esposos articulan sus capacidades y aptitudes en beneficio de su familia . Unidos han conseguido contratos con empresas, centros educativos y construcciones que son su principal mercado, sin dejar a un lado los negocios individuales que realizan con sus familiares vecinos y personas que conocen la calidad con que trabajan en su taller.
Aun recuerdan cuando iniciaron con una máquina de soldar haciendo cajas pequeñas y metálicas, para proteger los medidores de gas natural; durante un tiempo fue lo único que hacían en su taller, pero  gradualmente adicionaron otros productos como rejas, sillas, mesas, ventanas, puertas y antenas; este es su segundo crédito  con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, necesitan  $ 2.000.000 para comprar materiales como tubos, hierros, pintura, soldadura  y elaborar esqueletos de sillas giratorias y puertas solicitadas por una entidad educativa con la que regularmente negocian.  Su taller de herrería y ornamentación, les ha dado para comprar su casa y en un amplio cuarto adecuar  su taller, el cual quieren a corto plazo  mejor su infraestructura. La competencia es su gran desafío por eso constantemente escuchan la voz de su cliente y tratan de participar en actividades formativas de mejoramiento de la calidad a nivel administrativo y técnico.
texts.en:
Nancy Esther Sanjuán E. lives with her husband and three children who are 10, 17 and 21. They live in Ciudadela Metropolitana, a neighborhood located in Soledad –Atlántico. Nancy wanted to feel independent and she started her own business. She took advantage of her husband's knowledge (at her side) in welding and her natural managing ability. She responded to her wish to be trained in launching and managing businesses and she prepared beforehand before starting the “Taller de Herrería y Ornamentación Stefany”. Today it is the basis of the family income and the place where the couple express their skills and aptitudes to benefit their family. Together they have obtained contracts with businesses, educational centers, and contruction which is their main market. They haven't left the individual jobs behind that they do with family, neighbors, and people who know the quality of their work in their workshop. They still remember when they started with one welding machine making small metalic boxes to protect natural gas meters. For a time it was the only thing they made in their workshop. Gradually, they added other products such as bars, chairs, windows, doors and antennas. This is the second loan with the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. They need $ 2.000.000 to purchase materials such as tubes, irons, paint, soldering, and to make skeletons of spinning chairs and doors ordered by an educational organization with which they regularly do business. Their blacksmith and ornamentation workshop has allowed them to purcahse their house and outfit their workshop in a spacious room which improved their infrastructure in a short time. Competence is a challenge and that is why they always listen to the client and they try to participate in training activities to improve the quality at a management and technical level.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase materials such as tubes, irons, paint, soldering, and to make skeletons of spinning chairs and metallic doors

loans.name: Rath

texts.en:
Rath P., 58, is a widowed farmer who lives with her three daughters. (She is pictured with one of her daughters.) Living in the Takeo province, she typically makes about US$1 each day and two of her daughters together make about US$6 each day as garment factory workers at Phnom Penh city.

Rath P. would like to take out a loan of US$500 to purchase a motorbike for her daughters to commute to work. This will allow her daughters to save even more.

In the future, Rath P. wants her daughters to create their own business instead of working as garment factory workers at Phnom Penh. She says that her daughters need to spend alot on food and accommodation. If her family has enough money, she will suggest that her daughters sell vegetables and fruit at the local market of Takeo province, so that her family will live happily and closely.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike.

loans.name: Viema

texts.en:
Viema L. is from the village of Pangantucan, Bukidnon. She is 35 years old. Viema is married and has 3 school-aged children.

To make a living Viema operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. where she sells both food and daily use products in the local community. Viema has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 8000 PHP a month.

In 2008, Viema joined HSPFI to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Viema successfully repaid a previous loan of 14000 PHP from HSPFI which she used to to purchase additional products to sell. Viema is requesting her fifth loan from HSPFI, for 17000 PHP, which she will invest in her business. About HSPFI

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

loans.name: Jorie

texts.en:
Jorie J. is from the village of Pigsag-an, Cagayan De Oro City. She is 29 years old. Jorie is separated from her spouse and has 3 infant children. Jorie owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) store where she mainly sells food, daily use products and children's toys. Jorie has been engaged in her business for over 12 years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month.

In 2008, Jorie joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Jorie has successfully repaid a previous loan of 17,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to invest in expanding her business. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business.

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase stock to expand her product inventory

location.town: Pigsag-an, Cagayan De Oro City, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Cheat

texts.en:
C. Cheat, 43, is married with three children who live at home in the Takeo province. Since 1984, she has been making and selling palm cakes in her village. She makes about US$3 profit a day. Her husband is a blacksmith. On average, he makes US$6 a day. Two of their children go to school and one is a construction worker. 

Every month C. Cheat spends about US$80 on food, US$10 on utilities and about US$20 on transportation. C. Cheat would like to take out a loan to expand her husband’s business. Her husband will use the loan to purchase blacksmith tools.

loans.use: To purchase blacksmith tools.

loans.name: Thom

texts.en: Thom T. has been in the farming business for years. She plants various crops to earn a living and is specialized in growing rice. She typically generates an income of $3 per day. She has always received help from her husband in planting crops. This couple has been married for years and has six children. They all are students and are also temporary laborers. After the rainy season for rice passed and the rice drying season arrived, Thom T. lacked some supplies to use in growing her crops. So, she has asked for a loan of $500 to be used to plow the farmland. She will then buy fertilizer and seeds to grow.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and seeds to grow.

loans.name: Mila Maniego Group

texts.en:
Mila M. is from the town of Lawy, Capas Tarlac. She is 38 years old. Mila is the group leader of a 7-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Mila is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Mila owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector running a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Mila is just starting this business.

In 2010, Mila joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Mila is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Mila from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

loans.name: Zul-Huu

texts.en:
Zul-huu is 26 years old and lives with his wife in Bayanhongor province, Mongolia. He and his wife live together in a ger, the Mongolian nomadic tent. Currently, his wife stays at home. 

In 2003 Zul-huu graduated as a lathe solderer from a college in Ulaanbaatar. From 2005 to 2007 he worked as a solderer at a private company in his own province. From 2007 to 2009 he worked as a solderer and drum master at a goldmine. Since 2009 he has been operating his own soldering business  from his yard.  He is planning to create his own workplace in his yard. 

Zul-huu is a decent and very hardworking person. He says, “I would like to create my own workplace and to concentrate more on my soldering business”.  He is requesting a 415,000 tugrug loan to purchase appliances and materials for his business.

loans.use: To purchase appliances and materials for his welding business

loans.name: Abdykalykova Kanayim`s Group

texts.en: Kanayim, 50, is married with 6 children. Her 3 oldest children are in Russia, while the other 3 go to school. Her husband works in the family business. They fatten cattle which they sell in the local market. She also sells milk and milk products and has been in this business since she got married. The average family income is about 350 USD. This loan will be used to buy 2 calves to fatten. Taalay is 47 years old and is married with 4 children. They have 2 main sources of income: trade and livestock. His wife works in her own little shop where she sells food and consumer loans. Taalay also fattens animals. This loan will be used to buy 1 milk cow with a calf. It will also let them produce milk and milk products to sell. Gulmayram is 39 years old. She is married with 4 children. Her husband is a taxi driver. All her children are at university or school. She has been working in the livestock business since 1992 and her annual income is about 200 USD. This loan will be used to buy 1 milk cow with a calf. She hopes that this will increase her income and that she will be able to repair her house this year. Guljan is married. Her husband is currently in Russia. She has 2 grown children: a son and a daughter. She is in the livestock business and has 3 cows and 3 sheep. She will use this loan to buy 3 more sheep. In the near future she wants to open a mini-market near her house to diversify her sources of income. --- Where Did This Loan Come From? --- This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious, socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan. Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of the 3-Ps concept - People (building human capital and taking care of both its customers and the society), Profit (to be profitable to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and to view a video presentation about the organization, please click here If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and Mol Bulak staff.

loans.use: to buy 2 calves

loans.name: Gillian's Group

texts.en:
Gillian P. is from the village of Mohon. She is 23 years old. Gillian is the group leader of a 2-member group loan offered by PMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Gillian is single and has 1 infant child. To make a living, Gillian owns & operates a  specialized retail store where she sells clothing & shoe products. Gillian has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 2,500 PHP a month.

In 2007, Gillian joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Gillian is requesting a new loan of 3,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory & provide working capital. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Gillian from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory & provide working capital

loans.name: Merlina
